Job Title: Network Engineer | Eindhoven | Tot €65k | Eindhoven | Layer
Job Description:
Vacature van Layer, locatie Eindhoven.

Groeiende organisatie | Glasvezel | 32 – 40 uur | Leaseauto mogelijk | Mobiel en laptop van de zaak | Bonusregeling | Ruim opleidingsbudget | Goede pensioenregeling | Thuiswerken mogelijk

Functie

Als Network Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het grote, actieve glasvezelnetwerk van dit bedrijf. Het netwerk bestaat uit 2 lagen waarin jij verantwoordelijk bent voor de tweede laag, een ethernet netwerk met veel switches dat groeiende is. Op dit netwerk zitten door heel Eindhoven veel klanten aangesloten. Deze klanten willen soms uitbreiden, wijzigen of opzeggen. Jij gaat ervoor zorgen dat al deze changes doorgevoerd worden. Als er een nieuwe locatie op het netwerk wordt toegevoegd ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de planning. Ook zoek je uit welke apparatuur het beste aansluit en welke partijen je erbij gaat betrekken. Je schrijft een proposal en selecteert vendors.

Ongeveer 25% van je tijd ben je bezig met troubleshooten met klanten. Er zijn wel eens storingen of onverwachte veranderingen, met jouw expertise help jij de klant de problemen op te lossen. 65% Van je tijd focus je op het oplossen van technische vraagstukken op het gebied van ethernet, routers, switches en IP. Als je houdt van complexe netwerk gerelateerde uitdagingen dan zit je bij dit bedrijf perfect. De oplossingen voor deze vraagstukken kun je eerst testen in het lab dat speciaal voor jou is ingericht. Een droom voor elke network engineer. De laatste 10% van je tijd sta je in contact met commerciële partijen. Je hebt contact met klanten, leveranciers en overheidsinstanties.

De organisatie

De organisatie richt zich op het leveren van glasvezel in Eindhoven en daarbuiten. Ze zijn een van de weinige bedrijven met een volledig eigen glasvezel netwerk. Door hun razendsnelle netwerk is er veel mogelijk op het gebied van innovatie. Daarnaast staan ze in nauw contact met de gemeente die deze innovatieve projecten stimuleert. Je werkt met 15 collega’s in een gezellige en groeiende organisatie. Uiteraard staat Brabantse gemoedelijkheid hier ook centraal. Op dit moment werkt er één andere network engineer waar je veel mee gaat samenwerken, uiteindelijk wordt je getraind om zijn baan over te nemen. Omdat ze zo aan het uitbreiden zijn zal deze afdeling snel groeien, hier liggen dus veel doorgroeimogelijkheden. Ook krijg je uiteindelijk inspraak in de samenstelling van je team.

Innovatieve projecten

Een van de projecten die nu lopen is de straatverlichting op Stratumseind “slim” maken. De verlichting wordt aangesloten op het razendsnelle netwerk van dit bedrijf. Door het plaatsen van sensoren in de lampen kunnen er in real time ruzies en opstootjes worden opgespoord in het uitgaansgebied. Deze lampen staan in direct contact met de meldkamer van de politie waardoor snel en adequaat gehandeld kan worden door de handhaving. Hierdoor maak je Eindhoven een stuk veiliger met behulp van het netwerk.

Ook heeft dit bedrijf een netwerk ontwikkeld voor de GGD. Dit netwerk kan draaien op glasvezel, Ethernet, 4G en Wifi. Hierdoor kan de GGD overal werken en hebben ze altijd toegang tot hun netwerk. In de nabije toekomst zal dit netwerk gebruikt worden om coronatesten en vaccineren op meer locaties mogelijk te maken. Zo draag je direct bij aan de bestrijding van COVID-19.

Benieuwd geworden naar wat dit bedrijf nog meer voor uiteenlopende en innovatieve projecten heeft? Ze vertellen je er graag veel meer over tijdens een kennismakingsgesprek. Ze zijn immers, volledig terecht, super trots op het werk dat ze doen.



Eisen

HBO/MBO+ werk- en denkniveauJe hebt kennis van Ethernet en IPJe hebt ervaring met routers en switchesJe bent bij voorkeur CCNA of CCNP gecertificeerd.Aanbod

Salaris tot max € 65.000,- per jaar32 tot 40 uur per week25 vakantiedagenBonusregeling bespreekbaarUitstekende pensioenregeling (1/3 inleg werkgever)Ruim opleidingsbudgetThuiswerken mogelijkDoorgroeimogelijkhedenLaptop en mobiele telefoonLeaseauto mogelijk

Vacature van StackOps, locatie Utrecht.

Wil jij als pure network engineer richting klanten gaan? Ben jij een network engineer die ervaring heeft met automatiseren en vooral werkt met Cisco? Solliciteer dan direct!

Wat ga je doen?

Als network engineer ga je er voor zorgen dat de klanten een storingsvrij netwerk hebben. Klanten zitten door heel Nederland, dus reisbereidheid hoort hier zeker bij.
Je gaat werken met Cisco firewalls, switches en accesspoints, en het is belangrijk dat je het leuk vindt om zaken te gaan automatiseren. Naast deze zaken ga je ook bezig houden met de infrastructuur van de datacenters en vind je het interessant om hier ook de security van op te pakken.

Voor De Rest Van Je Bezig Met Het
 Installeren van volledige netwerk bij de klant; Zorgen voor de goede operatie van het volledige netwerk bij de klant Installeren en configureren van Cisco firewalls en switches;
Wie ben je?

Een network engineer met enige ervaring en kennis van geautomatiseerde systemen, denk aan MS Active Directory. Je kan zelfstandig naar de klant en bent verbaal sterk. Belangrijk is ook dat je een MBO ICT hebt afgerond.

Daarnaast
 Heb je ITIL kennis; Heb je ervaring met Citrix en Ivanti; Ben je CCNA gecertificeerd of ben je bereidt deze snel te gaan halen;
Wat mag je verwachten?

Een baan waar je veel vrijheid hebt en diverse verschillende uitdagingen kan gaan oppakken. Het is belangrijk dat je het leuk vindt om naar klanten te gaan en deze ook echt te ondersteunen en te helpen met hun netwerk vraagstukken. Daarnaast vind je het leuk om zaken te gaan automatiseren om alles efficiënter te laten draaien.

Daarnaast wordt er goed gezorgd voor de collega’s, denk hierbij aan:
 Een salaris dat start bij €2,000 en loopt tot €3,500,- hier word je ingeschaald op basis van kennis en kunde; Veel opleidingsmogelijkheden die gericht zijn op de werkzaamheden die je uitvoert; Een laptop, telefoon en leaseauto; Ook na je werkende leven wordt er goed voor je gezorgd met een premievrij pensioen; Sportabonnement om lekker te sporten.
Waar ga je werken?

Je gaat werken bij een bedrijf dat onwijs snel aan het groeien is, waardoor het een van de grootse leveranciers is van technologie en outsourcing. Ze ontzorgen hun klanten in al hun netwerk vraagstukken en komen graag bij de klant over de vloer. Voor de rest is het een informele club waar ze samen met enthousiaste collega’s graag een stap harder te zetten voor de klant. Lunchen doen ze graag samen evenals een gezellige borrel aan het einde van de week.

Job Title: Network Engineer | Utrecht | Good Company - ICT
Job Description:
Vacature van Good Company - ICT, locatie Utrecht.

Leer de organisatie kennen
Onze opdrachtgever houdt zich bezig met de vraag hoe het onderwijslandschap baat kan hebben bij de steeds groter wordende mogelijkheden van digitale middelen. Didactisch vernuft in combinatie met ijzersterke, technologische toepassingen, waarbij je moet denken aan interactieve lesmaterialen, ICT-beheer en virtuele servers. Met meer dan honderd onderwijsorganisaties als klant verleent dit bedrijf zijn diensten aan tienduizenden leerlingen en onderwijsprofessionals. Dit allemaal met maar één doel: het onderwijs zodanig in te richten dat het optimaal profiteert van de huidige digitalisering, waardoor leerlingen, studenten en onderwijsmedewerkers tezamen bouwen aan Nederland als kennisland.
Over de functie

Als Netwerkbeheerder los je complexe netwerkproblemen op voor zowel klanten als collega’s. Je bent kortom hun redder in nood. Daarnaast beheer en configureer je LAN/WAN/Wifi netwerken en begeleid je klantvraagstukken en geeft hierover je advies. Je komt te werken in een team dat zich bezighoudt met oplossingen van verstoringen, het uitvoeren van wijzigingen en meewerkt aan grote interne en externe netwerkprojecten. Tot slot neem je deel aan het Network Operations Center waar proactief duizenden netwerkcomponenten worden gemonitord en beheerd.

Jij Herkent Jezelf In
Een gezonde ambitie en je bent initiatiefrijk en resultaatgerichtHoge mate van klantgerichtheidJe bent communicatief sterkJe kunt onder druk prima functioneren
Jouw kwaliteiten
HBO Werk- en denkniveauJe kunt aantonen werkervaring te hebben met het volgende:
MPLS en Layer3 routering protocollen als BGP, OSPFopzetten en troubleshooten van remote access VPN, SSL-VPN en P2P VPN tunnelsJe hebt een CCNP-certificaat, bovendien wil jij graag je kennis verdiepen door het volgen van workshops en opleidingen om zo je kwaliteiten te ontwikkelenJe ziet securityvraagstukken als een uitdagingJe hebt affiniteit met Software Defined NetworkingJe hebt goede kennis van LAN netwerken, WiFi Enterprise oplossingen, NextGen Firewall oplossingen en WAN verbindingenJe bent up to date m.b.t. de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen het vakgebiedJe bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs B
De voordelen
Een uitstekend salarisVeel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid bij het uitvoeren van je functieGroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden zodat jij je (professioneel) kunt ontwikkelenJe komt te werken in een inspirerende omgeving met bevlogen collega’s die je waarderen om wat je doet én om wie je bentGoede arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals de mogelijkheid tot inkoop van vakantiedagen, een partnerpensioen, een eindejaars- en winstuitkering, een smartphone en een laptop

Job Title: Network Control Group Agent Schiphol | DHL Express
Job Description:
Vacature van DHL Express, locatie Schiphol.

Snap jij als geen ander hoe elke zending zich door ons rood-gele netwerk beweegt en heb jij een passie voor luchtvracht? Ben jij goed in plannen en in het houden van overzicht? Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap in jouw carrière? Dan is de vacature van NCG Agent bij DHL Aviation Schiphol iets voor jou!

Onze hub op Schiphol is dé schakel in ons DHL netwerk. Jij ziet het vliegtuig bij zonsopkomst, jij hoort de banden draaien en proeft in alles de dynamiek van de Express logistiek. Jij werkt in een klein, gezellig en behulpzaam team dat elke dag opnieuw tot een succes wilt maken.

Dit ga jij doen
Jij zorgt er samen met jouw collega's voor dat alles administratief in orde is om zendingen probleemloos te kunnen laten vertrekken met onze vrachtwagens en vliegtuigenJij zorgt ervoor dat ons Aviation netwerk altijd blijft draaien en verliest daarbij de kwaliteit nooit uit het oogJij houdt overzicht over de in- en uitgaande 'linehauls' en hierin onderhoud jij contact met collega's, maar ook met externe partijen zoals vliegtuigmaatschappijen.Jij krijgt vaak te maken met ad-hoc veranderingen (zoals weersomstandigheden en stakingen), waardoor jij steeds opnieuw in zal spelen op de nieuwe situatie.Dit allemaal om het netwerk op volle toeren te laten draaien en onze klanten iedere dag opnieuw blij te maken met op tijd geleverde zendingen.
Klinkt dit spannend en uitdagend? Dat klopt! Gelukkig word jij in het begin op weg geholpen door jouw collega's en leer jij zo met de vele systemen die wij gebruiken om te gaan.

Dit ben jij

Jij bent gek op dynamisch werk, bent stressbestendig en haalt daarnaast veel voldoening uit het werken onder tijdsdruk. Jij bent waanzinnig klantgericht en hebt een proactieve instelling. De uitdrukking 'can do' is jou dan ook op het lijf geschreven. Jij bent niet bang om de telefoon te pakken en de informatie op te halen die jij nodig hebt.

Daarnaast Voldoe Jij Aan De Volgende Functie-eisen
Minimaal 1 jaar logistieke ervaring binnen DHLErvaring met administratieve processenErvaring met outlook en excelFlexibele beschikbaarheid: ons netwerk stopt niet om 17.00 uurJij spreekt en schrijft goed Nederlands en Engels.

Dit bieden wij
Een mooi salaris in cao 7;Een contract bij DHL Express voor 40 uur per week;Avonduren worden met 112,5% en 125% uitbetaald;23 vakantiedagen;Keuze uit 13 extra vakantiedagen of 6,24% extra salaris;Reiskostenvergoeding van 0,19 euro per km tot aan 30 km (enkele reis);Een introductie training waardoor jij de organisatie van binnen en buiten leert kennen;Een organisatie waar ontwikkeling echt centraal staat; dit betekent dat er veel ruimte is voor interne trainingen en doorgroeimogelijkheden;Aandacht voor jou, beloofd.

Over DHL Express

Als wereldwijd marktleider in expresvervoer en logistiek levert DHL Express oplossingen voor het beheer en transport van goederen over de hele wereld. Wij opereren in meer dan 220 landen en mogen ons daarom het meest internationale bedrijf van de wereld noemen. In Nederland werken wij met een team van 2000 medewerkers om van iedere dag een succes te maken. Op onze site vind jij meer over onze cultuur, arbeidsvoorwaarden en over jouw toekomstige collega's, dus neem vooral een kijkje!

Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment and pharmaceutical products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the key emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing in Europe and the USA.

Group's key figures are approx. 3.8 billion Euros turnover, over 800 laboratories across 47 countries and about 45,000 staff.

Job Responsibilities

The Network Engineer provides technical support to customers in all aspects of the operation of the network. This includes participation in implementation, testing and troubleshooting activities as well as network configuration, debugging, and optimization. As a member of the Infrastructure team, you will work on one of the most demanding network infrastructures spread across the world, you will work with latest technologies and network tools, You will help in deploying and run the network and support diverse complex projects in order to make the best use of the infrastructure you have created. Vacature van StackOps, locatie Utrecht.

Je verleent een hoogwaardige service aan onze klanten. Dit doe je natuurlijk niet alleen als Field Engineer Sr. / Network Engineer, maar samen met een top team van medewerkers.

Wat ga je doen?

Als Field Network engineer ben jij samen met je collega’s verantwoordelijk voor de juiste installatie en operatie van het volledige netwerk van zo’n 5000 gebruikers bij onze klanten door heel Nederland. Onze klanten rekenen op een betrouwbaar en storingsarm netwerk. Om dit te kunnen leveren maken wij gebruik van Cisco firewalls, switches & wireless accesspoints. Hierbij is er een grote mate van standaardisatie en automatisering toegepast.

Je komt terecht binnen het Netwerk & Security team samen met 6 andere collega's en ben je dus ook verantwoordelijk voor de infrastructuur van de datacenters.

Wie ben je?

 Cisco CCNA afgerond (bereid deze te behalen) Minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring Kennis van Router, Switches en Firewalls Communicatief en leuk vinden om met klanten te schakelen

Wat mag je verwachten?

 Een salaris dat loopt tot €3,500,- hier word je ingeschaald op basis van kennis en kunde; Veel opleidingsmogelijkheden die gericht zijn op de werkzaamheden die je uitvoert; Een laptop, telefoon en leaseauto; Ook na je werkende leven wordt er goed voor je gezorgd met een premievrij pensioen; Sportabonnement om lekker te sporten.

Waar ga je werken?

Zoals aangegeven groeien zij snel, niet alleen qua mensen maar met name op het gebied van kennisontwikkeling en innovatie. Qua dienstverlening focussen zij zich op een specifieke branche en ontzorgen zij de klant volledig op het gebied van Werkplekken, Cloud, Netwerken, Hosting, Office365 en Security. Dit doen zij met behulp van een gezellig club van specialisten. In totaal zijn zij momenteel met circa 50 man, bestaande uit diverse teams. Er is verder volop ruimte voor ontwikkeling, en dit wordt ook erg gestimuleerd. Naast dat je dus de mogelijkheid krijgt om je verder op te leiden door middel van certificaten, trainingen wordt je na het behalen ervan dus ook beloond. Al met al, een leuke en hechte club waar je je zeer divers en in verschillende richtingen kan ontwikkelen.

Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op met: Jordy van den Bosch | tel: 070 - 2 197 197 / 06 - 2843 4010 |

Would like to work for our client in Amsterdam/Rotterdam, The Netherlands? Read on. You are an energetic Network Engineer with a passion for IT Infrastructure and positive can-do mind-set. You are a team player, working as a core member of a multidisciplinary and cross-functional squad with end-to-end responsibility for selected infrastructure services. For our customer we are looking for an experienced Datacenter Network Engineer. This is a demarcated migration project from Cisco to another solution for the data center network (aggregation). We are looking for an engineer with extensive experience in data center networking who can work independently, but is also not afraid to proactively seek cooperation within the data center team. Building a secure network is your hobby, but you can also easily switch to a business environment where uptime, performance and security are critical to providing the best service to customers. You love scripts and program for fun, but you can also apply these skills to your work. You are an energetic engineer who is creative and has a can-do mentality. You are a team player, working together and sharing knowledge is a natural behavior. From Rotterdam you will end up with an international team responsible for managing and developing the IaaS technology of the cloud platforms. You participate in agile work processes such as daily stand-ups, sprint reviews and planning. Together with the Product Owner, the team works on common goals and a shared backlog. They use video and collaboration tools to facilitate the communication process. What are you going to do?Migration project from Cisco to another solution for the data center network (aggregation);Minimum 3 to 5 years experience as Network Engineer, preferably within a financial institution Cisco certified, minimal CCNP The ideal candidate:

 have proven experience with Firewalls Broad knowledge of Cumulus (Must) have Certificates and proven experience with F5 have Certificates and proven experience with Palo Alto Proven experience with Checkpoint Firewalls Proven experience with Cisco ISE ! have Certificates and proven experience with Loadbalancer! We are ambitious and ask a lot of you. So it is so fair to give you a lot in return. That is why our employment conditions are good to very good! In a number of areas we are distinctive and an example for other organizations. You get an excellent salary with us and build up a good pension. You can opt for an OV annual card and / or a travel allowance. You may also decide on part of your employment conditions yourself, for example when you pay your vacation allowance, or the 13th month. In addition to our excellent employment conditions, we are happy to invest in your craftsmanship! Craftsmanship is what makes and keeps us big. Take the opportunity to continue to develop your skills and innovative strength and to expand your network. Surprise yourself! Not with how good you are, but with how good you can be. Do it better than everyone thought possible. And continue to develop into an ever better version of yourself. We invest in your personal leadership and your craftsmanship. We both benefit from that. You become more valuable to us and at the same time you are always prepared for the next step in your career. We believe diversity is important, and therefore want to create an open and accessible working environment. The reason we do this, because we want you to be able to focus all your energy on your work and development. Important: Remain yourself, nobody can determine who you are better than you!

Job Title: Commercial Bank International - EMEA Network Group – Analyst - Amsterdam
Job Description:
Job Description

About Commercial Bank International

The EMEA CBI is part of the Commercial Bank at JPMorgan Chase that focuses solely on European subsidiaries of US companies with whom we have a banking relationship in the US, and who require traditional banking services in Europe, Middle East and Africa. Our competitive advantage is that we cover this market through a partnership with our global bankers who build relationships with our clients and offer customized financial solutions. This approach brings together integrated banking solutions ranging from cash management to raising capital and structuring complicated financial solutions. Other products that we provide include loan syndications, working capital financing, asset based financing, derivatives and foreign exchange.

About The Team

The EMEA networt team is a group of talented indiviuals that focus on serving the core portfolio of clients in Commercial Bank International. Many of our clients have a single point of contact in the EMEA region who works closely with their US counterparts, along with the JPM International Product Specialists in the US, to determine the best global treasury solutions. The Network team’s objective is to act as a valued relationship manager helping the client to navigate J.P. Morgan. Network ICEs work to incubate key future clients of the firm as they grow and as their businesses change; the aim is to ensure that these clients see J.P. Morgan is a valued advisor and first point of contact for new business. Network is a large portfolio representing around 80% of the clients in CBI EMEA and annual revenues in excess of $80mm.

Role Overview

This position will be primarily focused on: servicing the specific cash management needs of the bank’s existing network clients; relationship management; helping our colleagues to manage on-boarding & ramping of new business mandates from clients; as well asworking in close partnership with US origination teams i.e. International Product Specialists (IPSs), US Bankers (Corporate Client Bankers & Middle Market Bankers) and other Product Specialists from across the Firm to identify and support the broader banking needs and requirements of CB clients.

The Network Analyst will work with professionals across the business and within the broader bank as (s)he manages relationships with Middle Market or Corporate Client Banking Bankers & clients.

This Position Represents An Excellent Opportunity For Candidates To
 Gain exposure to solving client issues and relationship management Develop expertise in managing cross region client dialogue and how to have difficult client conversations Negotiation, client sales and credit skills Build knowledge of commercial treasury management products and services

Key Responsibilities

Core functional responsibilities and expectations include but are not limited to the following:
 Client coverage of a defined portfolio of names Execute on the regional Network client strategy for uncovering future opportunities (Incubate/Grow Clients) alongside providing robust relationship coverage of clients where we hold their entire EMEA wallet (Defend Clients) In partnership with key stakeholders, conduct a semi-annual review of your respective Network portfolio to ensure appropriate coverage and knowledge of opportunities Key contact and escalation point for all portfolio matters Thorough understanding of Know Your Customer responsibilities, importance and requirements, and the ability to apply these principles to entire portfolio of assigned clients Reporting directly to the CB EMEA Network Regional Executive

Qualifications

Candidates interested in becoming a full-time employee with the CBI:
 Degree level qualification and relevant experience in Treasury Services sales, corporate relationship management, or portfolio management with proven problem solving experience are preferred Broad commercial banking product knowledge and/or experience would be an advantage – cash management, payment FX, overdrafts and traditional trade products etc. Knowledge of treasury services products a clear advantage Excellent communication skills both written and verbal Excellent organizational, planning, problem solving, time management and analytical skills are required Attention to detail Strong teamwork abilities Ability to multi-task and manage competing prioties to meet deadlines and exceed expectations. Self-starter with a strong work ethic and desire to learn. English is essential, Dutch, Spanish and Italian are preferred. Demonstrated, consistent professional presence with the ability to adapt to evolving needs and situations

About Us

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Organization

Commercial Banking is focused on helping our clients succeed and making a positive difference in our communities. We provide credit and financing, treasury and payment services, international banking and real estate services to clients including corporations, municipalities, institutions, real estate investors and owners, and nonprofit organizations.

It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without adverts or commitments.

Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, curiosity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our culture.

Netflix is looking for a motivated and dynamic person to join the Production HR Team to help shape this function during an exciting period of transition and growth. We want to create the best content around the globe for our members but we also think how we do that matters and that’s where Production HR comes in. The Production HR Manager will work as a part of the EMEA Production HR team with specific focus on Netflix Original productions within Middle East, Turkey and Africa. Acting as a thought partner to on-set production leadership as well as internal cross functional teams to bring the safest, most inclusive and respectful production experience to our writers, cast, crew, and post teams working on Netflix productions across the globe. In doing this, we look to ensure the execution of their vision is aligned with how we work at Netflix.

The North star for the Netflix Production HR team is to support our industry in changing the way content is made around the globe, helping shape the culture by ensuring differing perspectives are embraced, nurtured, and empowered to enable all to contribute to the creation of our original content.

This is not a traditional HRBP role and is more about creative problem solving than it is about following HR processes and procedures. We work closely with partner production companies to consult, influence and guide as they make productions under the Netflix banner. It’s a new and unique role within Netflix and the wider industry, and with that comes a unique challenge as well as great rewards.

As such the ideal candidate will be flexible, curious and tenacious, with the ability to influence and have impact in a fast-growing and fast-paced environment across a diverse range of countries and cultures. This role will suit someone who is excited by the opportunity to do something different, to seek out opportunities for change and development in the industry, to build a function from the ground up and to work with creative people in an exciting and ever evolving environment. There is no manual, so this role needs someone who is confident when dealing with ambiguity and can work based on sound judgement and initiative.

The Production HR Manager will report to the Director, Production HR (EMEA and LATAM) and will be based in Amsterdam with regular travel to other Netflix offices in the region, as well as local productions.

Responsibilities
Partner with and coach internal and external production teams to provide support and guidance on all people related issues throughout the lifecycle of a production.Working with the Director, Production HR and internal partners to identify areas of opportunity for improving the production working environment taking into account the varied and unique challenges and opportunities of each country.Supporting Netflix in achieving its creative ambitions in a scalable manner, through developing relationships with in-country experts and partners to help the business navigate new environments and build cultural IQ.Develop and facilitate the delivery of training programmes for production leadership, cast and crew members looking at ways to innovate and evolve to meet current challenges. Ensure all productions operate in line with our standards around anti-harrassment provisions and coordinate the facilitation of anti-harrassment training where required.Work closely with cross-functional partners to provide guidance and recommendations around labour standards, especially with regards to child actors/minors on set and other applicable local and international labour standards.Work with our internal Employment Legal team to act as the informed captains on any Employee relations related issues on a production

Requirements
HR consultant, where you’ve had to problem solve creativelyExperience of working within this region and across a number of countriesExperience of, working autonomously and thinking on your feetInsight into and a curiosity around Inclusion and Diversity, current developments in the space and how to practically apply them in the workplaceProject management experience - the ability to generate an idea and see it through to completionExperience of building a network of specialist and expert contacts Knowledge of the production environment (desirable)Experience of conflict resolution and crisis managementThe courage and tenacity to jump in and use initiative and judgment to solve complex people issues without relying on policy and procedureA collaborative style with the ability to influence others into action and to think creatively about solutions

At Beerwulf we're looking for a Logistics Specialist to join our team.

HI SOON-TO-BE LOGISTICS SPECIALIST OF BEERWULF.com
We’re a pretty young company (4 years young), and we've recently evolved from start-up to scale-up phase. We are active in 10 European countries, and offer a dynamic and innovative work environment where you can truly make an impact. Our team is a selected blend of around 70 beer and eCommerce specialists. We're looking for a Logistics Specialist to join the pack!

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL FOCUS ON
Working in an international start-up does require some traveling, especially since our outsourced Distribution Centers are located in multiple European Countries. So besides working from our Amsterdam based office as much as possible, you will also have to travel from time to time (<10%).
As a Logistics Specialist, you will be part of the Operations Team. Together with our Head of Logistics - Brent Jones, you will have to monitor and steer the performance along the whole supply chain, from inbound via fulfillment over packaging towards last mile.

Your Key Tasks
Managing our 3PL's on a daily basis as well as leading MBR's and QBR'sDriving innovation initiatives in collaboration with our 3PL'sFirst point of contact for all internal inquiries with regards to fulfillmentEnsuring internal cost reporting is up to scratch and on-par with set targets
Leading mayor logistics projects such as network redesigns

THE THINGS YOU BRING TO BEERWULF AS A LOGISTICS SPECIALIST

You Are a Person With

 A Masters (or equivalent) degree in Supply Chain Management or Industrial Engineering.Between 2 to 5 years working experience in Logistics/Supply Chain or a similar role within FMCG. Strong stakeholder and relationship management capabilities, as you're the operational point of contact for our LSPs and final mile carriers. Close alignment with our Commercial Team on campaigns and promotions. Attention to detail. Curiosity to investigate and provide further continuous improvements to existing processes. A mastermind to solve problems. You'll encounter a wide range of situations that are outside regular process where beer must travel across borders quickly. Our customers have a strong demand for fresh beer, you're flexible to deliver this with pace and urgency. Fluency in English to work in an International team with European ambitions. Experience with analytical tools would be great, but a sharp mind that is eager to learn every day is a must.
Please note you must be eligible to work in the EU. But above all, you are excited to work for the online beer retailer that is conquering Europe!

YOUR TYPICAL DAY @ THE OFFICE AS OUR LOGISTICS SPECIALIST

As We Are a Start-up, Not One Day Is The Same, But Your Day Is Likely To Look At Bit Like This

First thing you do after you arrive at the office? You start your day by checking Slack/Jira and of course your email (all after a good cup of coffee). A quick look at different reports shows, how the E2E supply chain performed the day before and if all involved parties stayed within agreed productivity targets. Followed by a short call with our 3PLs to discuss the upcoming day(s).
Together with the team you will have delicious lunch in our canteen or garden, during which you hear from our sourcing & merchandising team about a potential sales peak due to an online promotion. Back at your desk, proactive as you are, you immediately check the packaging stock levels and staff planning in our DC to make sure we are prepared in case of an unexpected sales uplift.
Later in the afternoon it's time to check with our development team if the new report you have been asking for is ready to use. You will be trained on how to create the report yourself from now on. Since you are a strong analytical thinker with incredible problem-solving skills and mathematical abilities, you will quickly, after checking the report, identify a few things which can be further improved. After making sure that all these ideas will be translated into user stories incl. deliverables and being put on the development backlog, you will enjoy a well-deserved beer with the team.
On top of your daily operational activities, you will support the business by expanding our logistics infrastructure to new markets both inside and outside of Europe.
We can call it a good day, when we have been able to make our customers happy, by ensuring they receive their chosen products On Time in Full on lowest possible cost.
Don’t forget: It’s important that we know our beers. Beer is everywhere, so the work is never done. It will most likely grow on you, and after some time you will stop and look at beers in bars, supermarkets, festivals and online. You will become (if not already) curious and excited about beer!
MEET THE TEAM

NEXT STEPS FOR THE LOGISTICS SPECIALIST @ BEERWULF
No motivation letter, just a few questions for you to answer in the next step. We will take a look at your resume, so make sure it is shiny and bright. After a CV screen we ask you to make an assignment.
In the best case scenario, you will have two interviews before you’re hired. The first one will be with Brent Jones (Head of Logistics) and Sjoerd de Reus (Logistics Specialist). The second and final round is with Wolfgang Fahrner (COO Beerwulf) and Katinka Bezemer (Head of HR)
Questions about this position? Send them to Brent.Jones@beerwulf.com.
Still enthusiastic? Then hit that button and upload your resume!
Please do not make use of this vacancy as an acquisition opportunity

Mission

Services expansion journey is taking us to a next step in offering peace-of-mind outcome services’ solutions to our customers. Munters equipment is supported by an expert global service network for optimal performance. The extensive experience in process climate optimization, heat recovery and other upgrades provides optimal efficiency and performance improvements. Our aim is to help secure the customers perfect climate, maintaining the efficiency of their equipment and ensuring uninterrupted, fault-free production.

The Project Coordinator supports our Continuous Improvement Specialist and Business System Specialist in the standardisation of the Munters Services processes, the implementation of these processes, and most importantly the cleaning of the current data. You will be helping to identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities, assisting on the delivering of internal projects, focusing on time, cost and quality. You wil l support the Management team in following up on ongoing projects/product launches.

The role is ideally suited for a dynamic Project Coordinator who is looking for career advancement as part of the Munters Services organisation.

The position can be based in any Munters offices preferably in Belgium or Netherlands or Sweden.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

As the new Project Coordinator, your main responsibilities will be to follow up and track progress of our projects/product launches and support in the implementation of standardized processes and tools (systems).
 Create and assists in project planning for internal projects and product launches.  Execute of internal projects and product launches, support with defining project scope, milestones and deliverables.  Follow up and track progress of projects/product launches with effective and standardized project management tools.  Review current data quality and perform data cleansing. Work with the Continuous Improvement Specialist to implement standardized processes globally.Support the Service Management Team with administrative tasksWork with the Business System Specialist in the creation of work instructions for the data entryProvide super user training after the implementation of the processes and system.Assist in organizing events.

Procurement Specialist

Location: Amsterdam

Salary: Competitive

Closing Date: 30 April 2021

Are you a Procurement Specialist with extensive experience in EU/EC procurement law? Have you been carrying out aggregated procurements within your organisation, but are now looking for a new challenge within a dynamic procurement team organising procurement and tender efforts for network and over-the-top service?

GÉANT is the association where 40 European National Research and Education Networks (NRENs) collaborate. Collectively, we serve over 10,000 institutions and 50 million users. GÉANT is a fundamental part of Europe’s e-infrastructure, delivering the pan-European GÉANT network for scientific research, education and innovation.

GÉANT operates as a centralised purchasing body (CPB), which runs aggregated procurements on a pan-European scale, for the NRENs and the wider Research and Education (R&E) community in Europe. The candidate will be part of a highly regarded procurement team, organising procurement and tender efforts, for network and over-the-top service.

In this varied and exciting role, you will be responsible for the following:
 Aligning the needs of the GÉANT community; Identifying suitable delivery and operational models; Engaging the market; Running procurements; Establishing agreements and managing the relationships with suppliers.
Our ideal candidate

To be successful in this role you must be a proven procurement specialist within depth knowledge of current EU/EC procurement laws. You will have extensive experience in carrying out aggregated procurements within an organisation which is subject to Member State implementation of EC Directive 2014/24. Ideally you will have practised within the Netherlands in accordance with the Aanbestedingswet 2012 as well. You will already have been working with IT suppliers and in particular cloud providers. Knowledge of the education and research sector is a strong advantage.

We are looking for someone who enjoys working in an open and collaborative manner. You will have the ability to manage a varied workload, and to respond effectively to changing priorities, to achieve agreed deadlines without compromising quality or standards You will have efficient English writing skills, ability to write concisely and to summarise complex documents and concepts.

GÉANT operates primarily in the technology sector (especially cloud and telecoms) and the candidate must be able to consider many dimensions simultaneously: how the IT market works; how customers in the Research and Education community consume; and the boundaries of the EC Procurement Directive regulating the procurement. Scale and complexity will not challenge the ideal candidate.

GÉANT has an important role in the European Open Science Cloud Programme. Specifically, GÉANT coordinates the efforts in the Open Clouds for Research Environments project (OCRE), where together with several partner organisations a large-scale tender for cloud and Earth Observation is organised to drive further adoption of cloud services in the research and education community.

Why work for GÉANT?

We offer a blazing-fast, cutting-edge network that connects scientists, researchers and academics across Europe and the world. Thanks to our terabit network, 50 million researchers, scientists, academics and students can share record volumes of data unconstrained by location, solving some of mankind’s biggest challenges.

Work at GÉANT and you’ll be supporting critical research into sustainable energy, deep space, high-energy physics, earth observation, environmental disasters, medicine and more!

Benefits Of Working For GÉANT

You’ll receive excellent benefits at GÉANT – we offer a 8 % holiday allowance and a 5% end of year end of year allowance as standard. We also invest heavily in learning to help our people become the best at what they do.

Where the role and service allow, we offer flexible working (around core business hours) and the opportunity to work from home. Currently working from home is the standard until our offices reopen again.

The other benefits you receive include an appropriate pension scheme, the possibility to join our collective medical insurance and/or a medical insurance allowance and 31 vacation days per year.

If this role is filled in our Amsterdam office, it will be offered as a 1-year definite contract, with the possibility of becoming indefinite thereafter.

Company Name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
Job Description:
Omvang vacature: 1,0 fte
Bij het Instituut voor Communication, Media & IT van de Hanzehogeschool Groningen is een vacature ontstaan voor een Docent Network & Security Engineering (1,0 fte).
Ben je een innovatieve ICT-er met kennis van moderne infrastructuren, Cloud Computing en bijvoorbeeld Software Defined Networking? Wij zoeken een professional die zich graag wil ontwikkelen tot Docent.
FunctieomschrijvingAls docent begeleid je studenten op het vakgebied Network & Security Engineering. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het verzorgen van colleges en het begeleiden en coachen van studenten uit met name het tweede en vierde jaar die werken aan integrale opdrachten, stage- en afstudeeropdrachten. Je gaat vakken geven zoals:Computerarchitectuur.Besturingssystemen.Netwerken.ICT Security.Cloud Computing.Software Defined Networking.
Daarnaast lever je een bijdrage aan de constante ontwikkeling van onderwijsinhoud, blended onderwijswerkvormen, studiemateriaal en toetsing. Je bent op de hoogte van actuele, relevante ontwikkelingen in jouw vakgebied en je onderhoudt contacten met het werkveld om zo je kennis up-to-date te houden. Ook deel je op deze wijze kennis en ervaring. Met collega’s spar je over didactische vaardigheden en methoden en de verdere ontwikkeling daarvan. Afhankelijk van je kennis/ervaring en belangstelling doe je mee aan onderzoeksprojecten van de lectoraten.
Waar ga je werken?Als docent ICT maak je deel uit van het opleidingsteam HBO-ICT en werk je onder de verantwoordelijkheid van een opleidingsmanager. Het team is verantwoordelijk voor de uitvoering en de ontwikkeling van het HBO-ICT-onderwijsprogramma. Dit gebeurt in nauwe relatie met het beroepenveld en de lectoraten New Business & ICT en Personalised Digital Health. Onze Innovatiewerkplaats DSH (Digital Society Hub) is de plaats waar onderzoek, projecten met werkveldpartners en onderwijs samenkomen. Het team, dat bestaat uit ongeveer 50 docenten en hogeschooldocenten, verzorgt het vol- en deeltijdonderwijs voor de opleiding HBO-ICT. Daarnaast kun je worden ingezet voor docent werkzaamheden bij de IT Academy Noord-Nederland, als onderzoeker bij de lectoraten New Business & ICT en/of Personalised Digital Health en in projecten van de DSH. De opleiding HBO-ICT maakt deel uit van het instituut voor Communicatie, Media & IT.
Functie-eisenJe beschikt over minimaal een relevante hbo-opleiding met een grote component informatica.Je hebt enige kennis en ervaring met programmeren (voorkeur Python).Je hebt ervaring als technisch en/of security-specialist.Je bent in bezit van een pedagogisch-didactisch getuigschrift of bereid om deze te behalen.
AanbodHet salaris bedraagt minimaal € 2.652,- en maximaal € 5.026,- bruto per maand bij een fulltime dienstverband conform schaal 10 of 11 cao-hbo.Het betreft een structurele positie, waarbij je start met een jaarcontract. Datum van indiensttreding is zo spoedig mogelijk.
De Hanzehogeschool Groningen heeft een uitgebreid pakket secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een 13e maand. Daarnaast stimuleert de Hanzehogeschool medewerkers om zich voortdurend te professionaliseren. Onze Hanze PL Academy faciliteert en ondersteunt hierin.
InlichtingenAls je interesse hebt in deze functie of meer informatie wilt over de werkzaamheden, kun je contact opnemen met Niek Witsenboer, Corporate Recruiter, telefoonnummer 050-595 6916 of email n.witsenboer@pl.hanze.nl. Let op! Dit emailadres niet gebruiken voor je sollicitatie.
Deze vacature is gelijktijdig intern en extern opengesteld. Medewerkers die werkzaam zijn bij de Hanzehogeschool Groningen hebben voorrang op externe kandidaten.Wij vragen nieuwe medewerkers om bij indiensttreding een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) aan te vragen. De kosten hiervoor worden door de Hanzehogeschool vergoed.
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
Sluitingsdatum: 15 april 2021

Job Description:
Are you the Control Systems Network Specialist who is Equipped for Impact?

Do you as Control Systems Network Specialist want to be part of a world-wide-operating team of innovators? Do you have what it takes to make an impact? And do you have a Bachelor degree, preferably in a technical area (such as Mechanical-, Electrical engineering or Maritime), Network knowledge (think of Switches, Routers, Firewalls, VLANs, VPNs) and knowledge of Windows 7 and 10 and Linux (DHCP, DNS, Samba, KVM, Asterisk)?
Yes? Please keep reading. We might have the job you as Control Systems Network Specialist are looking for.

First, let us briefly introduce ourselves.

Pleased to meet you, we are Huisman. We develop step changing technical solutions and translate these into the design and construction of the largest construction equipment. For decades, we have been working all over the world for offshore wind, geothermal, oil & gas, leisure and civil industries. We design and produce in-house and deliver our turn-key products to our clients worldwide. Clients choose us for our entrepreneurial spirit, skills, reliability, and innovative solutions. Examples? What to think of our HM100 Land Drilling Rig? So, if you join Huisman make sure you are equipped for impact. In other words, surprise us, our clients and … yourself!

“Discovering new possibilities in sustainable energy gives meaning to my work.”

Korneel van der Meer, Product Manager

We ask a lot of you. However, we also have a lot to offer.

A challenging position in which you can stretch your horizon within a vibrant and international operating organisation, with opportunities for personal development and growth. You will become part of a dynamic and professional organisation where innovation, quality, flexibility and creativity are key to meet our company goals. In addition to our inspiring atmosphere, we offer an excellent benefits package tailored to your background and experience.

What will you be doing working as a Control Systems Network Specialist for Huisman?

As Control Systems Network Specialist, you are responsible for Commissioning of equipment, possibly on site, during the commissioning phase of a project.

Your Will Be
 Setting-up, maintaining and documenting network and network applications standardization Investigating and testing network technologies and advising about applying these technologies within the equipment of Huisman Providing after-sales service to customers Preparing configurations for network equipment where needed
Wondering if you are equipped for impact? Ideally, you as Control Systems Network Specialist are:
 Accurate, you have an eye for detail Able to adapt quickly to new requirements and know how to prioritise Flexible and creative Analytical and you prefer a systematic way of working Proactive and persuasive Result and client orientated Willing to travel
To conclude, some practical things we need you to have:
 An EU passport / valid work permit for the Netherlands A practical disposition and a good command of the English language verbally and in writing.
Still with us? Does this sound like you?

Apply online for the position of Control Systems Network Specialist by scrolling down and apply there.

We are curious to learn what kind of impact you will make!

Still need a bit more info or looking for something that suits you better?

Please contact us via our contact form for more information about the position. Or explore other career opportunities at this website www.werkenbijhuisman.com or stay informed through our job alert.

Disclaimer For Recruitment And Selection Agencies

We don’t accept any unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment and selection agencies. Proposing candidates without invitation is not appreciated and will not be considered by Huisman. Applications received are property of Huisman. We don’t appreciate acquisition and this also applies to Huisman colleagues or associated Huisman companies.

What you do as a SIEM SpecialistAs a SIEM Specialist you will manage customer SIEM solutions globally. This role is part of our Managed SIEM team in CyberSOC. Where you and other SIEM specialists will securely enable availability- and performance levels of customer SIEM solutions. Daily tasks involve mitigating incidents, deploying changes, maintaining- and developing customer SIEM solutions through lifecycle management. You will be an important resource in our service delivery and an integrated part of our team.
Your tasks consist ofEnsuring a safe continuity of customer environments regarding cybersecurityMonitoring the MSIEM infrastructureAnalyzing, advising on, and solving SIEM-related issuesManaging onboarding projects of new customersCoordinating vendor support staff to solve incidentsUpdating and upgrading the MSIEM infrastructure of customersReporting on a monthly basis about customer environmentsBeing involved in the development of CyberSOC related to MSIEMCooperating with different colleagues in different roles to deliver crucial support to stakeholders
What you bring to Orange CyberdefenseKnowledge of SIEM solutions such as Splunk, LogPoint or QRadarKnowledge- and experience of operating system versions of Windows & Linux ServerKnowledge of TCP/IP, Routing, Switching and Firewall policiesKnowledge of Microsoft SQL and/or MySQLExperience with Python

Depending on your level of seniority, one of the above certificates is desired. As a junior SIEM specialist you should be prepared and willing to obtain said certificates.You have a broad network-, Linux- and security foundation to build on with special interest in SIEM/log solutions as well as server administration. Your communication skills in Dutch and English are good, both spoken and written. You thrive with troubleshooting and see problem solving as an exciting challenge. You are also able to cope with stress and to work individually.

What can you expect from Orange Cyberdefense?Working at Orange Cyberdefense will give you the chance to develop both personally and professionally. New challenges are our favorite! We believe that by providing an atmosphere where we try to have fun at work and love what we do, we will also get the best end results.We offer a generous benefit package including a company car, pension plan, a financial bonus based on personal targets as well as company targets and much more!
Interested?Do you contribute to our European footprint; Build a safer digital society? Beautiful! Apply immediately! If you want to see or know more, please contact Dorien Verhulst (Corporate Recruiter) via 06- 15294527 or dorien.verhulst@orangecyberdefense.com

Our ultimate dream is that in 2025 the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Do you also love to shape the product with the team?

You are enthusiastic about being the ultimate decision maker on the most valuable backlog items to deliver. You provide clear and aligned quarterly roadmaps. Your data driven approach means you can say ‘No’ or ‘Yes’ when needed, and back it up with data. You prioritize the Why and the What on a high level, and you know how to delegate the details.
 If you look back after one year at FRISS, what will you have achieved? Thanks to your data driven decisions and clear communication, FRISS has been on a roll! The team know exactly what is expected in the roadmaps. You have made sure that they understood why we’re doing things the way we’re doing them. You owned the backlog like a champ. Even when you haven’t had uncertainty on certain issues, you have ensured that the team is not left floundering in the dark. You have made the backlog transparent to the organization.
You and your FRISS Team We offer the opportunity to work in an exciting and international environment, with lots of room for initiative and personal development. Like the rest of us at FRISS, you want to put your best foot forward and deliver and push us to achieve high standards in our work – because our customers expect nothing less. Based in our headquarters in Creative Valley in Utrecht, the Netherlands, you will work in very close cooperation with your Product Manager and the other Product Owners within FRISS. You will work closely with different stakeholders within (and occasionally outside) FRISS, from product management to tech, and from Dutch to Bolivian.
Who are you? At least 2-3 years experience as Product Owner You are a Subject Matter Expert on Network Analytics, Graph technology, Data Science and Data engineering You have a technical background (ideally computer science, software engineering, information systems) You come with more than basic knowledge of data science and pattern recognition, so that you can be the sparring partner for the team, without losing yourself in the tech side of it You are a team player who is able to translate concepts into detailed backlog items Preferred if you have knowledge about the insurance industry, STP process, and fraud investigation/scenarios

Don’t let Imposter Syndrome stop you from applying! If you have any questions, you can contact us at shravan.rangarajan@friss.com.

NETWORK FINANCE MANAGER – FOODS EUROPE

Location: Rotterdam - Weena
Local terms and contract apply

Function: Finance Business Partnering

Schedule: 100%, full time

Travel: Up to 20%

About Unilever

Unilever is one of the world`s largest Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) businesses, with interest across Personal Care, Homecare, Refreshment and Foods product categories. We make products that people love – and that make a difference. Nutritious foods. Household care essentials. Indulgent ice creams. Refreshing teas. Luxurious shampoos. Affordable, disease-combating soaps... and many more. In fact, we make around 400 much-loved brands including global brands such as Knorr & Dove, but also local brand such as Calvé (the Netherlands) and Suave (the Americas). Shoppers buy them in more than 190 countries. That means you’ll find at least one of our products in seven out of ten households on the planet. And we want every one of those products to make a positive impact on the lives of the people who buy them.

We want our business to flourish, and we know that our success depends on others flourishing around us. That's why our purpose is to make sustainable living commonplace, and why sustainable, long-term growth is at the heart of our business model.

Purpose Of The Role

European Supply Chain organization is at the core of the European Operational Model. Through its significant factory footprint in Europe, the regional Supply Chain supplies the four European Performance Management Units (EU PMUs) as well as a variety of other Unilever Units and 3rd party customers. Foods contribute roughly 40% to Unilever turnover in Europe

Based in Rotterdam and reporting into Foods Finance Director, Network Finance Manager for Foods is responsible for managing the production costs across the manufacturing network.

Key Priorities For The Incumbent Are
Performance Management: Manage and optimize >EUR 300M production cost across Foods factoriesStewardship: Ensure zero control deficienciesChange Programs / Transformation: Finance lead for in full implementation of Change ProgramsMarket insights: Create and enhance market x factory interlock points to drive end to end cost improvementPeople Development: Develop and manage a broad team of factory controllers

The incumbent partners Supply Chain VPs for Foods for key decisions related to manufacturing footprint and production costs management. As part of Category Supply Chain Leadership team, the job provides a great opportunity to work with large number of stakeholders across Manufacturing, Planning, Finance and Markets.

Main Responsibilities

Performance Management
Lead overall category Business Planning for production costsPartner Category Supply Chain VPs to deliver in-year factory financial plansDrive the waste reduction agenda (Zero Based Material Waste, Business Waste) aligned with category strategy/planBe the custodian of monthly performance management rhythm for production costs (actuals, forecast, manage risks and opportunities and drive gap closing plans)Custodian of production CAPEX and other investment plans (including proposals, budgeting, approval, tracking etc)

Change Programs / Transformation
Lead multi-year factory masterplans including and Change ProgramsEnsure On time and in full delivery of in-flight Change ProgramsDrive WCM cost optimization and Run to Standard Finance support as per factory plans

Stewardship
Ensure effective implementation of relevant Financial controls including Fixed Assets, Inventory and IFRS complianceDrive financial control stewardship across site, resulting in zero control deficiencies

Markets Insights
Ensure regular handshake with Categories and Markets to explain key movements in factors impacting production costsHighlight and drive key hotspots requiring joint supply chain and markets efforts in order to drive costs/service optimization (e.g. SKU complexity reduction, Run to Standard/WCM)Custodian of governance of N1 supplier investment tracking

People Development
Manage and develop a broad team of Finance resources across EuropeContinuously energize and motivate the resources to become a highly effective finance team

Experience

JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
We are looking for an experienced Finance Manager for the role.Minimum of 8 years’ experience in Finance, with min. 3-4 years’ experience in a manager role of Supply Chain FinanceWorking experience in a FMCG company or similar industryProfessional finance qualification equivalent to CA, CIMA, ACCADeep understanding of (Unilever) P&L and has experience with the relevant controlling processes.

Leadership Behaviour
Strong business acumen has a natural passion for operations design and business results.Is biased towards actions that have the most tangible and significant impact to the business.High level of flexibility to see the big picture but at the same time courage to deep-dive into specific areas if need arisesAlways on curiosity to continuously peel the OnionAbility to present effectively to senior leaders in the organization and to flex the communication style depending on the audience.Ability to work remotely with numerous stakeholders and to develop with them collaborative relationships.Genuine passion to develop people through mentoring and coaching.Fluent in English, both verbal and written

Why You Should Work For Unilever

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!
A competitive salary package according to role & experienceAttractive short and long term incentivesCompany Pension (Only applicable if based in the Netherlands)Flexible career opportunitiesLibrary full of learning & well-being resources whenever and whereverAn exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen

Excited About The Role

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

Disclaimer

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Microsoft continues to invest over $1B per year in cybersecurity and research, to provide its customers with solutions that integrate across the ecosystem by connecting all of your identities, endpoints, apps, emails, docs and clouds to help you close critical gaps in coverage, reduce risk, and save costs with a streamlined security portfolio.

As we continue to grow as a Security Specialist organization, we are hiring enterprise sales professionals to run and drive security engagements within our largest accounts. Join a team of Cybersecurity Professionals lead by a diverse set of leaders from across the industry. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and provide resources and support to everyone on our team.

Responsibilities

As the Security Sales Specialist, you are considered a subject matter expert with deep technical expertise within our enterprise sales organization. You will be expected to exceed sales quota by creating and implementing strategic account plans targeting enterprise-wide deployments. You develop trusted relationships at an executive level and build credibility across all levels of the customer’s organization through a concrete understanding of our products and areas that can be resolved by our solutions.

You feel empowered by our product offerings - and love a technical challenge.

Key Accountabilities
Acquire, lead, and develop security opportunities (remote work, security, compliance, cloud security) in your assigned territory Strong account management skills to identify cross-selling and up-selling opportunities within your accounts Own opportunities from qualification to close by orchestrating a virtual team of sales, technical, services, and partner resources across an extensive portfolio of products Demonstrate knowledge of cybersecurity industry, products, and competitor offerings Develop relationships with customer, CxO level Business and Technical Decision Makers Fundamental understanding of security threats, solutions, security tools, and network technologies Communicate value propositions to clients and stakeholders that speak to their needs and requirements Stay updated on industry news and trends, and how they affect Microsoft products and services Travel as necessary within your territory, and to company-wide meetings

Qualifications

Who We are Looking For
Consider yourself technical enough to cover accounts while your technical specialist is busy assisting others Not afraid to demonstrate the product History of exceeding your quota Experience with cloud network security technology (including intrusion monitoring, threat detection and prevention systems, firewalls, and DDOS prevention solutions), data protection technology (including encryption, key management, data loss prevention, and hardware security modules), and identity management systems (including directories, access servers, authorization services, identity provisioning and governance systems) Understand how to win by leveraging Channel and strategic partners Demonstrated ability to segment accounts across the territory and dig in using the entire ecosystem Ability to lead all aspects of the of the sales cycle; ability to uncover, qualify, develop, and close net new business in accounts Possess a successful track record selling complex-solutions directly to enterprise customers Excellent time management skills, and work with high levels of autonomy and self-direction Highly competitive, ramp quickly, extremely adaptive, and pride yourself on exceeding production goals

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Job Description:
Quality Assurance Officer Reporting to; Associate Director Distribution Quality Location; AmsterdamTenure; Full-time; Permanent﻿MAIN PURPOSE:To support Distribution Quality in ensuring Good Distribution Practices (GDP) are followed and can be shown to have been followed. In particular to support product quality by ensuring that transport conditions are monitored according to agreed schedules and that data is collated and reviewed and made available to responsible management. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES:Track and maintain a data base of Norgine distribution and Wholesale Dealers licences, Quality Agreements and identify potential gaps against GDP expectations set in EudraLex Vol 4 and in particular EUROPEAN COMMISSION Guidelines of 5 November 2013 on Good Distribution Practice of medicinal products for human use.-       Populate data base to support WDA’s is routinely updated-       Identify gaps or non-compliances in the data base and remediate
Support the Norgine BV Responsible Person (RP) activities in relation to the Norgine BV (NBV) Wholesale Distribution licence, in accordance with EudraLex Vol 4 and in particular transportation arrangements.-       Accept tasks assigned / delegated by the RP-       Ensure systems for supplier and customer bona fides are in place, current and readily available to affiliate companies
Support the global lead to ensure that transportation conditions are mapped and monitored against agreed schedules. Taking a lead in proposing schedules and managing flow of devices and data.-       Design transport temperature mapping plans-       Manage monitoring activity-       Download, review and archive data-       Issue periodic reports indicating compliance levels-       Identify noncompliance signals and report, raising Quality Events as appropriate
Ensure Norgine Quality Standards are understood and made available to Affiliate and Distribution partner level. Maintain support for and propose improvements to the Quality Management System.-       Perform review of new and emerging legislation to assess compliance-       Monitor compliance indicators for emerging issues and trends-       Draft proposals for maintaining compliance
Collect and report data to support the metrics that deliver understanding of the levels of compliance through the distribution network. Identifying noncompliance and associated risks and risk reduction strategies with clearly communicated action plans.-       Collect compliance indicating data, review and identify relevant signals-       Report potential signals to management
Support the RP Forum, providing administration, record keeping and organisation of presentations sharing knowledge, compliance issues, training and mentoring to the group.-       Seek out and discuss potential topics with forum members-       Identify training opportunities for meetings and deliver to maintain continuous professional development of RP’s-       Provide point of contact and knowledge management
Act as lead in quality event management and investigations for major and ninor quality events. Review, evaluate, and contribute to investigation into OOS or major deviations that are identified and follow-up on corrective actions associated.-       Raise Quality Events and ensure close out or escalation-       Conduct investigations, ensuring root cause is determined and CAPA identified.
Provide support to the Global Distribution team for ongoing operations and projects deployment in a compliant effective manner.-       Act as the Quality lead when assigned projects-       Complete tasks in a timely manner or escalate issues to line management
Identify and report quality risk and propose risk mitigation/ remediation plans with partners. Ensure the risk is reported and managed in appropriate manner to minimise impact on patient supply or to the Business-       Maintain the risk register for Distribution-       Conduct risk assessments-       Propose actions to reduce risks to an acceptable level-       Conduct as needed risk reduction activity Key Committee Memberships: Quality review meetings with service providers
RELATIONSHIPS:·      Reports to the Distribution Quality Manager.·      Maintains excellent working relationships with all Norgine manufacturing sites, distribution organisation and Affiliate offices.·      Liaise with distribution service providers.·      Works closely with Affiliate RP’s at local offices and Distribution service providers, this will require significant travel possibly up to 30%
SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE
·      A degree or equivalent in a scientific is preferred with 3 years relevant experience in a Quality environment in the pharmaceutical industry·      Knowledge of GMP and / or GDP·      Strong communication and supervisory skills are essential.·      The ability to introduce, co-ordinate, complete and report on projects. ·      A high level or self-motivation is necessary. ·      Attention to detail·      Able to interpret and rationalise data output·      Influencing skills·      Ability to perform audits, internally and externally.

About NorgineAcross the globe in 2018, Norgine is proud to have helped 23 million patients, employed almost 1,400 permanent staff and generated €395 million in net product sales to reinvest in medicines for the future, a growth of 15% since 2017.
Norgine is a leading European specialist pharmaceutical company that has been bringing transformative medicines to patients for over a century. We understand the complexities of the European healthcare systems and have a direct presence in 14 European countries, as well as Australia and New Zealand. We also have a strong global network of partnerships in non-Norgine markets.
We are a flexible and fully integrated pharmaceutical business, with manufacturing (Hengoed, Wales and Dreux, France), third party supply networks and significant product development capabilities, in addition to our sales and marketing infrastructure. This enables us to acquire, develop and commercialise specialist and innovative products that make a real difference to the lives of patients around the world.
Follow us on twitter @norgine or visit us at www.norgine..com

Datacenter Sales Specialist

Maarssen – Utrecht Area, The Netherlands

Are you experienced in consultative selling and have extensive knowledge about datacenters? Do you have a solid quantitative and qualitative network in the Manufacturing sector? Are you a skilled negotiator, a natural communicator and an excellent decision maker?

Then you are the one we are looking for to join our team as the Datacenter Sales Specialist!

In this role you increase the direct sales of Fujitsu’s server, storage and datacenter products in the Manufacturing sector. As part of the Product Sales department, you grow our share of wallet at our existing customers and attract new labels, either directly or through our strategic partners. In order to do so, you establish a solid opportunity pipeline. Furthermore, you develop a sales strategy for the Manufacturing sector, including a value proposition and win-strategy for all qualified opportunities. You identify and influence decision makers and stakeholders (internal and external).

We expect that you maintain a high level of Fujitsu’s and competitors product, services and solution know-how, and that you are on top of developments in the Manufacturing Market.

As in any commercial role, as well the administrative tasks such as updating the CRM database is part of the job. You make proper use of specified company tools and processes to manage sales within and across borders.

What is in it for you?

Fujitsu is currently one of the last IT Solutions partners in EMEIA that offers its own full range of products and services next to solutions and products of partners. The datacenter, server and storage products that Fujitsu offers are developed with our long-term vision in mind; innovative, eco-friendly and state of the art.

When you join our team we offer you an attractive salary and secondary benefits, including a variable bonus scheme and a lease car. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment with lots of training possibilities and the opportunity to build your career internationally. All this while working at an employer being awarded the Top Employer Nederland 2019 Certification! https://www.top-employers.com/en/companyprofiles/nl/fujitsu-technology-solutions-b.v/

For who are we looking?

You have several years of sales experience at an IT organization, and have a proven track record in managing and growing a datacenter client portfolio and winning deals. You have a Bachelor or Master degree, and you are a highly skilled negotiator, a natural communicator and an excellent decision maker. You are a real hunter who is able to communicate at C-level. As a person you have excellent communicational skills, are able to proactively improve ways of working, a strong team player who is flexible and shares knowledge. Next to that you are have a good sense of humor, straightforward and honest.

Do you fit this profile and also have excellent English and Dutch language skills? Then you are the ideal candidate and we would love for you to apply!

About Fujitsu

Fujitsu is the leading Japanese information and communication technology (ICT) company, offering a full range of technology products, solutions, and services. We use our experience and the power of ICT to shape the future of society with our customers. More information: www.fujitsu.com

We promote a Human Centric Intelligent Society, in which innovation is driven by the integration of people, information and infrastructure. We are committed to Digital Co-creation; blending business expertise with digital technology and creating new value together. More information: http://www.fujitsu.com/fts/about/

At Fujitsu we empower human difference and as we want the best people on our team, we welcome and encourage applications from people with diverse experiences, backgrounds and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all.
