About usThe Mercedes-Benz Customer Assistance Center is an international multicultural organization and an integrated part of Daimler’s Mercedes-Benz Cars Marketing & Sales. In our offices in Maastricht we think and act globally and assume a leading role for the Mercedes-Benz Customer Assistance Centers all over the world. Our goal is to provide excellent assistance to our customers and dealers of well-known Daimler brands like Mercedes-Benz, AMG, smart, Setra and Mercedes me. 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year, we ensure our customers’ mobility with our roadside assistance.
Additionally, we take care of all kinds of enquiries about passenger cars, trucks and vans during our opening hours. For our customers we are maybe the most important connection to the Mercedes-Benz brand. That’s why we live the brand’s most important promise: “The best or nothing”.
Partner Network Management & Lifecycle Services fulfills a key account function for the DAIMLER product aftersales “spare parts” business worldwide.
Certificate Management   This team ensures overall legal compliance and availability for all “CCC-Mandatory” spare parts for the Chinese market.
The jobThe Logistic Certificate Specialist acts within a Logistic or Technical department on high level specialist tasks and reports directly to the Logistic Operations Manager. The main responsibilities are to ensure best Quality of Service and Customer Experience. Specific for Certificate Management we Ensure legal compliance within Parts Availability in the Aftersales Logistics Business to our Global Partners around the world.
Task & Responsibilities: Safeguard (own) Knowledge of Processes, Tools and Systems MBCAC/GLC to the most current level within supported services.Support process changes ( including changes in regulatory requirements).Actively create and ensure up-to-date documentation on Knowledge and Processes.Efficient and Effective Planning of own Activities in order to safeguard SLA’s and Deadlines.Analyze, Monitor and report Quality Standards and KPI’s to Management Level.Deliver High Performance on Quality to ensure Customer Experience.Ensure all Certificates / documents are available and valid in Certus.Track the approval process of certification / uploading correct and valid documents.Solve and Handle escalations and involve other Partners in the supply chain and/or Management in a Customer Centric way.When required lead and plan telco’s / follow-up meetings.Support in strategic Business improvement projects and be able to lead work packages (track/communicate status and act on deadlines).Be able to lead the implementation of new business and/or Tasks in the Team to ensure quality performance in the Team.Track and manage overall certificate costs and initiate a request for quotation (RFQ) for certification / recertification with internal purchasing department when required.Ensure Professional Standard of communication to internal-/external Business Partners WorldwideMethodological and LEAN approach to problem solving (IF/NOT/THEN/WHEN/etc)Pro-actively identify and signal quality improvements and efficiency gained within supported servicesProvide correct and accurate information
Job requirementsFluent level in English and German both written and spokenHighly professional and consistent communication skillsAbility to manage complexity under high pressure and stressStrategic, progressive and out of the box thinking, think in solutions not problemsDemonstrate Independent working, taking Responsibility and accountability in daily workDemonstrate active attitude in own development in Knowledge and SkillsStrongly oriented to Customer’s Satisfaction and Quality of ServiceAdvanced level with MS Office applications (Most important Excel/Access)Flexibility is needed
We offer you a job in a multicultural, young and informal international working environment with interesting conditions, both primary and secondary:
A “tailor made” individual development planTransportation plan: free bike every 3 years, free public transport or contribution to fuel costsCollective health insurance at discounted ratesPension plan200 vacation hours (based on full time employment)Holiday allowance: 8% of annual salaryCompetitive performance based salary growthResult oriented bonusesLucrative relocation package. Principal Tech Recruiter
Salary and RemunerationOTE:  €71,000 - €110,000 Base Salary: €35,000 - €45,000 Commission – up to 30% commission with quarterly bonuses for consistent performanceRemote for 3 days a week, with 2 days in our Amsterdam office.EMI Options scheme – eligibility for top performers to earn share options in the group every yearOther BenefitsPrivate healthcare (after a qualification period)Remote working options (incl our overseas offices)Cycle to work schemeSubsidised gym membershipEnhanced Maternity LeaveSubsidised annual Ski TripMonthly and annual sales incentives – overseas trips, exclusive restaurants etcOpportunities to participate in Arrows Group Charity Foundation events
The roleArrows are in the process of growing their close-knit team of specialist Tech recruiters based in Amsterdam. This is an opportunity for someone to take a step up in their career into a role with Senior level responsibility, a strong baseline network of clients and candidates and the potential to enhance your career development and earnings while working across The Netherlands, UK & Germany.
The ideal candidate will have at least 3 year recruitment experience in the Tech sector (preferably with a focus in either Software or Data). To become a recruitment specialist at Arrows, not only will you specialise in an Tech sector but we also look for our leaders to have proven experience billing within their company and building their client portfolios. Therefore business development is a must.
As this is a Senior level position, candidates must have Dutch language skills to at least business level proficiency.
About ArrowsArrows Group Global is a global technology recruitment and solutions consultancy who have been recognised by the 'Best Companies to Work For' as one the Top 100 UK Companies to work for and have listed in the International Fast Track for growth. We operate at mid to senior level fulfilment with our core capabilities in niche staffing, Statement of Work (SOW) and embedded onsite talent management. Our customers range from blue chip companies such as Just Eat, Sky and Publicis Sapient to pioneering start-ups, in the fintech, e-commerce & media, internet sectors and public sector.Whilst Covid-19 has affected many businesses over the past 6 months, the technology sector has remained relatively robust & less affected. Through the strength of our client partnerships with a wide ranging set of businesses and strong financial management, Arrows Group have weathered the storm of the pandemic and we are now investing significantly in the growth of our group. The current crisis has resulted in many companies turning to digitisation of their products, services and business intelligence. Arrows Group is keenly positioned to take advantage of this growth & are therefore looking to expand throughout Europe with expectations to double our overall team in the next 24 months.You will be supported by a business that has invested heavily in technology and L&D. We have one of the best tech stacks available in the industry to assist our leaders and consultants in their work and career progression. We put our people at the heart of our business and will support you every step of the way. We really value our staff but also the clients and candidates we work with. Building great relationships are at the heart of what we do!
With offices in Amsterdam and London, and outreach across Germany as well, Arrows have a strong and stable brand across the tech community.
Please do "easy apply" if you're interested to learn more about the Principal Tech Recruiter role.
In addition to this we are also growing our London teams so please get in touch if you are looking for a UK based role as well.

ABB is a global company. Leader in electricity transmission and distribution, process and production automation and electrical, electronic and installation products and systems. We are at the forefront of innovation, following trends and thinking along with our customers. We have brought together 150,000 people working together in more than 100 countries around the world.
Over the last decade ABB has consistently invested in delivering power for the transportation of tomorrow, bringing the digital and physical worlds together. Since entering the EV-charging market a decade ago, ABB has sold more than 17,000 DC fast chargers across more than 80 countries. We are now the partner of choice for the world’s biggest electric vehicle OEMs and nationwide EV charging network operators. The exciting developments within this sector perfectly align with our Mission to Zero initiative, aiming to support cleaner and greener communities for all.

From intelligent insights to complete electrification solutions, ABB has the resources and technological leadership to make our customer’s e-mobility vision a safe, smart, and sustainable reality.

For the global support center in Delft we are looking for:

Global Service Sales Specialist

Profile:
As a Service Sales Specialist, you will be part of the Service Sales support team developing the Sales Level Agreements scope, promotion and implementation. You will use your technical and commercial knowledge to advise the local service teams and clients about the options of various service concepts provided by ABB, the aim of which is a significant contribution to the growth and success of our department.
 You are responsible for supporting the sales of our contracts regarding maintenance, monitoring, spare parts and service level agreements. You will support your Sales colleagues to determine the optimal and most cost-effective solutions to meet customer needs. You have frequent contact with the factories and local service organizations in various countries to ensure that price and delivery negotiations run smoothly. You organize various workshops within the Global Service organization. You will support the risk review for large and/or cross border projects Following formal commercial processes with clear communication of documents and information. Providing support and input in meetings, presentations and process developments. Analyzing customer and local sales units needs and resources to pro-actively finding solution by an extraordinary out-of-box thinking.

Requirements:
 You are in possession of an MBO or Bachelor degree in the field of electro/energy technology, supplemented with a few years of work experience in a sales position, preferably in a service environment. You are able to combine a strong and commercial insight with a result-oriented attitude, while applying the required interpersonal skills. You have experience or knowledge of remote services offering. You are solution-oriented and like to think along with the client. You are enthusiastic, stress-resistant, accurate and a real team player. You are fluent in English. You are an stress resistant and well-organized personality. You are passionate about technology and digital solutions.

Our offer:
We offer you a varying and responsible job in an international concern which feels very strongly about the development of its staff. You will have the freedom to assume a whole variety of responsibilities within a quickly evolving environment. You can also count on a competitive compensation package in line with your capabilities and experience.

Interested?
Register your CV and apply online via www.abb.nl by clicking on ‘Careers’.
For questions you can contact Jacqueline Pereboom, Talent Partner, via 010 - 407 82 14 or soll@nl.abb.com.

Vanwege uitbreiding van de activiteiten en verdere ontwikkeling van intelligente mobiliteitsoplossingen, zijn wij op zoek naar een Network Engineer / Specialist die cruciale ICT-netwerken kan inrichten en onderhouden. Het ICT-team (ongeveer 16 fte), waar het netwerkteam (5 fte) onderdeel van is, ontwikkelt en beheert datatransmissie diensten op het gebied van Verkeersmobiliteit. Denk hierbij aan verkeersregelinstallaties, bruggen, tunnels en sluizen.

Met ons netwerkteam van 5 collega’s beheren we de volledige keten van (eigen en vaak maatwerk)-applicaties, IT infrastructuur, communicatiemiddelen en inwinsystemen op het gebied van Verkeersmobiliteit. Hierin wordt gewerkt met de nieuwste technieken en tooling.

 

Je bent in staat vanuit business cases te denken om voorgenomen verbeteringen weloverwogen door te voeren of niet. Vanuit jouw expertise denk je graag mee met klanten, OPS-engineers en collega’s. Als Network engineer ben je een technische contact binnen de afdeling en trek je samen op met de OPS-engineers om onze klanten optimaal te bedienen.

 

Door de diversiteit aan producten en diensten en klanten heb je een gevarieerde en veelzijdige baan waarin de omvang en de complexiteit van de werkzaamheden enorm verschillen. Je bent vaak zelf bezig achter de knoppen maar kunt ook snel schakelen om het overzicht te bewaren. 




Jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden:

•      Adviseren en ondersteunen van klanten bij complexe vraagstukken over het inrichten, beveiligen en onderhouden van de netwerkinfrastructuur

•      Ontwikkelen van monitoring en beheer op afstand, hierin zien wij de toekomst

•      Meedenken bij het beschrijven en calculeren van werk

•      Opzetten, configureren en beheren van netwerken, routers en firewalls

•      Oplossen, analyseren en voorkomen van storingen

•      Meedenken bij het beschrijven en calculeren van werk

•      Meedraaien in het consignatierooster van het team

• Uitvoeren en up-to-date houden van de geldende interne kwaliteits-richtlijnen voor de afdeling



Desired Skills and Experience
Wat breng jij met je mee?Je wilt graag meer leren over onze producten, systemen en klanten. Op die manier kun je ervaring en kennis opbouwen en meerwaarde creëren binnen ons team en help je ons verder te professionaliseren.
Verder beschik jij over: HBO opleiding bij voorkeur richting (technische) informatica;Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring;CCNA/CCNP/JNCIA certificering (Cisco/Juniper) Hands-on ervaring & kennis van Cisco en JuniperDiepgaande kennis van routing, switching, security, firewalling, netwerkprotocollen en netwerk architecturenKennis van design, implementatie en testen van netwerken.Ervaring in Windows Server 2012 en Linux Red Hat / CentOS is een preErvaring met virtualisatie zoals VMWare is een preErvaring met Nagios is een preErvaring met Docker is een pre Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, accuraat en klantgerichtArbeidsvoorwaarden De opdrachtgever heeft de voorkeur om na een detacheringsperiode je over te nemen, het eerste jaar werk je via Yacht bij de opdrachtgever erna kun je dit aan arbeidsvoorwaarden verwachten:
Een veelzijdige baan binnen een technisch uitdagende, complexe en innovatieve omgeving waarin jij een belangrijke rol speelt in het continu ontwikkelen en verder verbeteren van onze dienstverlening. Het kantoor in Houten of Haarlem is goed bereikbaar met de auto of ov.·        Een afwisselende functie voor 32 of 40 uur per week;·        Een marktconform salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;25 vakantiedagen en 13 ADV dagenLaptop en smartphoneMogelijkheden tot thuiswerken in overleg en flexibele werktijdenEen pensioenregeling bij pensioenfonds PMTUitstekende opleidingsmogelijkheden, onder meer in samenwerking met de VolkerWessels AcademyEen winstuitkering

Job Title: Commercial Bank International - EMEA Network Group - Analyst - Amsterdam
Job Description:
About Commercial Bank International

The EMEA CBI is part of the Commercial Bank at JPMorgan Chase that focuses solely on European subsidiaries of US companies with whom we have a banking relationship in the US, and who require traditional banking services in Europe, Middle East and Africa. Our competitive advantage is that we cover this market through a partnership with our global bankers who build relationships with our clients and offer customized financial solutions. This approach brings together integrated banking solutions ranging from cash management to raising capital and structuring complicated financial solutions. Other products that we provide include loan syndications, working capital financing, asset based financing, derivatives and foreign exchange.

About the team

The EMEA networt team is a group of talented indiviuals that focus on serving the core portfolio of clients in Commercial Bank International. Many of our clients have a single point of contact in the EMEA region who works closely with their US counterparts, along with the JPM International Product Specialists in the US, to determine the best global treasury solutions. The Network team's objective is to act as a valued relationship manager helping the client to navigate J.P. Morgan. Network ICEs work to incubate key future clients of the firm as they grow and as their businesses change; the aim is to ensure that these clients see J.P. Morgan is a valued advisor and first point of contact for new business. Network is a large portfolio representing around 80% of the clients in CBI EMEA and annual revenues in excess of $80mm.

Role Overview

This position will be primarily focused on: servicing the specific cash management needs of the bank's existing network clients; relationship management; helping our colleagues to manage on-boarding & ramping of new business mandates from clients; as well asworking in close partnership with US origination teams i.e. International Product Specialists (IPSs), US Bankers (Corporate Client Bankers & Middle Market Bankers) and other Product Specialists from across the Firm to identify and support the broader banking needs and requirements of CB clients.

The Network Analyst will work with professionals across the business and within the broader bank as (s)he manages relationships with Middle Market or Corporate Client Banking Bankers & clients.

This position represents an excellent opportunity for candidates to:
Gain exposure to solving client issues and relationship management Develop expertise in managing cross region client dialogue and how to have difficult client conversations Negotiation, client sales and credit skills Build knowledge of commercial treasury management products and services
Key Responsibilities

Core functional responsibilities and expectations include but are not limited to the following:
Client coverage of a defined portfolio of names Execute on the regional Network client strategy for uncovering future opportunities (Incubate/Grow Clients) alongside providing robust relationship coverage of clients where we hold their entire EMEA wallet (Defend Clients) In partnership with key stakeholders, conduct a semi-annual review of your respective Network portfolio to ensure appropriate coverage and knowledge of opportunities Key contact and escalation point for all portfolio matters Thorough understanding of Know Your Customer responsibilities, importance and requirements, and the ability to apply these principles to entire portfolio of assigned clients Reporting directly to the CB EMEA Network Regional Executive
Qualifications

Candidates interested in becoming a full-time employee with the CBI:
Degree level qualification and relevant experience in Treasury Services sales, corporate relationship management, or portfolio management with proven problem solving experience are preferred Broad commercial banking product knowledge and/or experience would be an advantage - cash management, payment FX, overdrafts and traditional trade products etc. Knowledge of treasury services products a clear advantage Excellent communication skills both written and verbal Excellent organizational, planning, problem solving, time management and analytical skills are required Attention to detail Strong teamwork abilities Ability to multi-task and manage competing prioties to meet deadlines and exceed expectations. Self-starter with a strong work ethic and desire to learn. English is essential, Dutch, Spanish and Italian are preferred. Demonstrated, consistent professional presence with the ability to adapt to evolving needs and situations J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Het bedrijfOne Zero IT is op zoek naar enthousiaste, no-nonsense IT-consultants met een prettig ontwikkeld gevoel voor humor en gezelligheid die onderdeel willen uitmaken van een mooie groep personen, partners en klanten.
Bij One Zero IT werken we net even wat anders. Belangrijk vinden we dat onze klanten ontzorgd worden. Alleen de manier waarop we dit doen is net even anders. Heerlijk informeel, op niveau en met alle vrijheid (en eventuele back-up vanuit ons).
One Zero IT is een bedrijf met uitersten. We werken hard (al voelt dat niet zo), maar vinden het ook belangrijk dat we naast het werk de grootste lol hebben met elkaar dan wel onze maatschappelijke betrokkenheid tonen. Wij regelen regelmatig events of leuke uitjes; Als eigen consultant heb je sowieso recht om mee te gaan, maar we stellen deze events ook graag open voor ZZP's, klanten en iedereen die maar geïnteresseerd is om mee te willen gaan. Die open en verbindende cultuur vinden we belangrijk.
Profiel Network Automation EngineerWe nodigen graag iedereen uit die denkt een bijdrage te kunnen leveren aan ons mooie bedrijf. Starter, toe aan een 2e baan of ervaren Network Automation-specialist kom eens met ons in contact.In zijn algemeenheid bieden we plaats aan personen met:Een afgeronde HBO-opleidingPré: richting Technische Informatica of CybersecurityMinimaal 2 jaar werkervaring als Infrastructuur-specialistPré: richting projectenDiepgaande kennis op het gebied van Ansible, Python, SALT, CI/ CD etc.Certificeringen als CCNA, VCP, RHCA of JNCIA zijn een pré etc.De wil om alles weg te automatiseren en deze kennis op een actieve manier over te dragen vinden we tevens erg belangrijk.
Wij biedenNiet meer dan logisch dat je terecht komt in een omgeving waar je je IT-hart kan ophalen.
One Zero IT(www.onezeroit.com) heeft formele samenwerkingsverbanden met Bauhaus ArtITech (www.bauhaus.nl) en Matrix Mind (www.matrixmind.nl). Twee bedrijven die in Nederland voorop lopen in de executie van IT-programma's (Bauhaus ArtITech) en (Multi-) Public Cloud-integration (Matrix Mind).
Koffie/ thee/ borrel of broodjeWil je gewoon eens cultuur komen snuiven, uiteraard kan dat zonder enige vorm van verplichting of het idee dat je al gelijk formeel in gesprek bent over een nieuwe baan. Kom gewoon eens langs bij ons in Utrecht.
Vragen of solliciterenVoor vragen kun je contact opnemen met Karin Deetman (niet bemiddelaars). Sollicitaties of cv kun je vergezeld met motivatiebrief sturen naar karin@onezeroit.com.

Job Title: UVD Robot Specialist for region EMEA and AMERICAS.
Industry: ['Computer Software', 'Mechanical Or Industrial Engineering', 'Hospital & Health Care']
Job Description:
Become part of a fast growing and innovative company supplying unique and award winning robotic hygiene solutions.

The Company

UVD Robots was established in Odense, Denmark in 2016 following a successful co-development project between Odense University Hospital and Blue Ocean Robotics creating the unique UV-Disinfection Robot. Our UVD Robots provide efficient and automated disinfection solutions for hospitals and life science customers. Application of UV Robots in hospitals patients and operating rooms save patients’ lives by reducing Hospital Acquired Infections (HAI’s) and operational costs for hospitals.

Recently we are also experiencing a strong demand for our UVD Robots in non-healthcare applications as for example office spaces, production facilities, shopping centers, schools and institutions, elderly care centers, airports and other facilities.

We are pursuing an ambitious strategy for global expansion of UVD Robots solutions based on sales via our constantly expanding network of distributors and sales partners in Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific and Americas.

We make robots for humans enabling people around the world to do their job with better health and safety while also improving their productivity, skills and eventually their quality-of-life.

 We are proud to be serving humanity through our portfolio of robots.

 The job
As a  UVD Robot Specialist  , you will have a unique opportunity to create and develop amazing robots that affect people's working habits, especially in a world with Covid-19.

You will be responsible for installation of UV Robots together with our distributors, including training of distributors technical staff. You will also be responsible for remote customer support in close cooperation with our product development and production teams.
  You will be working with installation, service and technical support to direct customers and distributors, herein under:   Installations of UV Robots at customer locations i.e. hospitals, pharma and life-science companies   Providing supervision and support to installations carried out by distributor technical staff   Telephone, e-mail and skype support to customers and distributors   Temporary robot installations at exhibitions, events and demonstrations   Technical training for distributors engineering and service teams both on-site and at HQ   Delivering technical feed-back from robot installations to our product development team   The position requires travelling.

 Competencies
  You have experience in service and support of technical products, preferably from healthcare and life science markets. Further skills required:   Educational background at Bachelor/Diploma level in computers, electronics, mechatronics,   software or equivalent   Skilled in Linux programming   Good at communicating with customers users and technical staff   Excellent English skills and preferably Danish   Analytical and good at problem solving   Self motivating, structured and productive with a good overview   We are offering a very interesting position with good opportunities to develop yourself and work in a team of highly skilled employees from many different nationalities.

What We Offer.

UVD Robots ApS develops and commercializes the world's leading UVD Robots. We work in a dynamic, fast moving environment together as a young, professional and committed team. You will be part of our exciting journey, supporting the global expansion of the company.

UVD Robots ApS is a part of the Blue Ocean Robotic Group, and they supply all their venture companies, who are selling the mobile service robots. Blue Ocean Robotics Group is an efficient innovation factory that continues to conquer new robot territory with service robots for the healthcare, hospitality, construction and agriculture industries.

UVD Robots ApS is very close connected to our Mother Company, and together we join in on monthly social events, Warrant Program for all full time employees, lunch arrangements, spouse network, Blue Ocean Robotics Group Academy, language school, health insurance and of course PC and mobile phone are available. We also offer an Outplacement program for our international spouses so we support spouses in finding and developing a career in Denmark.

If you find UVD Robots an interesting opportunity and want to become part of a fast growing and innovative company, please send your application and CV via the HR portal at
Please note that we will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

Application Deadline

As soon as possible

The biggest multiplayer games in the world use Subspace to create the most competitive and engaging online experience possible. Backed by top Silicon Valley VCs and run by former executives from tech companies including Riot Games, SpaceX, Google, Facebook, as well as leading Telecom companies, Subspace builds deep tech in global networking.

We're hyper-focused on "leveling up" in-game, and as a company. We are hiring people who help us raise the bar, add to our culture, and bring positivity, enthusiasm, and pride to what we are building. Our team members exhibit curiosity, are proactive by nature, genuinely enjoy complex challenges, and share a keen sense of urgency.

We're looking for a Network Reliability Engineer to help design the next phase of our global infrastructure. You’ll collaborate with our R&D, product engineering, network software engineering, and data center operations to develop and deploy scalable, fault-tolerant network topologies. We are committed to continuous improvement and innovation, so you’ll be encouraged to get creative as you solve complex problems related to traffic engineering, orchestration, instrumentation, automation, and telemetry.

What You'll Be Doing
 Be a key member of the team that is responsible for the overall design and architecture of the backbone network, datacenter, and POPs Define our internal and external routing policies & traffic engineering Conduct network performance tuning and execute complex network-related projects and deployments Propose and collaboratively define network and backend software requirements Join a culture with innovation at its core… this is essential to our competitive growth and overall success Deliver solutions in a complex environment while collaborating seamlessly with our innovative teams Thrive and contribute to our continuous improvement when it comes to Lean-Agile principles and methods

What You Bring To The Table
 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent experience 8+ years of deep technical knowledge gained deploying and managing WANs Strong Linux networking and routing fundamentals Experience with configuring, operating and troubleshooting protocols like: OSPF, MPLS, BGP, BFD Experience with common protocols and concepts like: TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, DHCP, IPv6, Anycast routing Hands-on experience with global internet routing, peering/transit relationships, traffic engineering, and troubleshooting Experience with flow records, packet captures, and collating information from various sources and tools Be strategic around planning, documenting, testing, and the production rollout of our new network features Be a self-starter who can work with minimal supervision
Subspace's mission is to build a momentous software-defined network and make it universally available and impactful. Our goal is to serve the globe, which requires a team that is representative of the world that we serve. As a company we embrace an accelerated approach to diversity and inclusion, and support and encourage our employees to be comfortable bringing their full, authentic selves to work. We believe in fostering an environment where diverse perspectives thrive; this core value is a pillar of our business and is critical to our success.

What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Senior Sitecore Developer to join our Interactive Team.

About The Role

We are looking for a Senior Sitecore Developer to deliver and maintain software in Sitecore. You are a genuine CMS guru, a developer with multiple years of Sitecore implementation experience. A person, hands-on & craftsman. You have experience with customizing the Sitecore product as well as out of the box implementations. As a Sitecore developer you will, in a multi-disciplinary team, realize websites & online applications, based on the Sitecore CMS solution. The maintenance & extension of existing implementations is also part of the job.

About Cognizant Interactive

Customer and employee experience requires an approach that’s fast and agile to keep up with constantly evolving expectations. Cognizant assembles a global network of systematic thinkers and storytellers to design and deliver experiences with business impact. Our end-to-end practice includes foresight strategists, anthropologists, experience designers and technologists, all working together to ensure that experience design retains integrity in delivery.

Creating future experiences require people from multiple disciplines coming together to solve big problems. We have integrated specialist companies into our practice to enable experience transformation. These experts support our Interactive delivery teams, who provide design, UX/UI and content at scale, as well as AR/VR, conversational AI and other emerging technologies.

Our ideal candidate
 A minimum of 3 years’ experience with Sitecore; Over 5 years of experience in .NET; Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI / CD) using tools like Azure DevOps would be an added advantage; Database experience (e.g. MS SQL Server); Possess excellent English communication skills, knowledge of Dutch language is a plus; Experience working in Agile Scrum;
Cognizant can be a great place for you! We offer:
 A competitive salary based on your experience; Opportunities and challenges to be at the forefront of digital transformation at leading clients across different industries; Udemy and Cognizant Academy digital libraries for your continuous learning; Possibility to work from home; 25 days of paid holiday per year; A laptop and a smartphone; A pension scheme and medical insurance; Other perks and corporate benefits;
Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Ben jij een ambitieuze Network Engineer die de ontwikkelingen en innovaties op het gebied van Network & Automation op de voet volgt?Ben je een breed georiënteerde engineer en wil je je verdiepen in een specifieke technologie? Of wil je je expertise juist verbreden en certificeren in meerdere technieken en tools?Wij zoeken ter versterking van ons team zowel multi-skilled als specialistische engineers met passie voor hun vak!Bij ons krijg je de ruimte en vrijheid om in de praktijk jezelf verder te ontwikkelen op diverse projecten en aan je theoretische kennis te werken door het volgen van trainingen en behalen van certificaten.
Wat ga je doen?Als Network Automation Engineer werk je binnen een team van enthousiaste specialisten om de hoog beschikbare netwerk en security infrastructuren van onze klanten te beheren. Je draagt bij aan klant-specifieke oplossingen binnen complexe netwerkomgevingen en werkt mee aan transitie- en transformatieprojecten.Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het standaardiseren en automatiseren van veel voorkomende werkzaamheden. Je documenteert je werkzaamheden, bereidt wijzigingen voor en houdt diagrammen up-to-date. Je analyseert en lost tweede of derde lijn storingen in het netwerk op, voert updates uit en zorgt voor life-cycle management. Je ontwerpt, implementeert en configureert wijzigingen in het netwerk. Ook het realiseren van projecten om het netwerk continu aan te laten sluiten bij de ontwikkelingen in de organisatie behoort tot je werkzaamheden.We gaan graag met je in gesprek om te horen welke werkervaring jij binnen dit speelveld hebt mogen opdoen en in welke richting je je verder wilt ontwikkelen.
Wat breng je mee?Je hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen op HBO werk- en denkniveau. Je hebt ervaring met “zero down time” infrastructuren. Daarnaast ben je een gedreven professional met de kwaliteit om kennis te delen en over te kunnen dragen. En verder heb je:• Een afgeronde ICT opleiding op minimaal MBO-4 of HBO niveau;• Een geldige certificering voor één of meerdere van de volgende leveranciers: Cisco, Fortinet, Aruba, Juniper, Citrix, Pulse Secure of F5;• Kennis en ervaring van network automation, software defined networking en cloud-oplossingen;• Scripting kennis (Python, Yaml en Ansible is een grote pré);• Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring (netwerk beheer of engineering);• Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met implementatie, ontwerp en architectuur van complexe netwerken, kernbegrippen zijn: LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, BGP, IPv6, IPSEC, wireless networks, network security (VPN, Firewalls, IDS), remote access;• Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en de Engelse taal. Persoonlijke skills:• Uitstekende communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden;• Passie voor alles wat met network & security te maken heeft, en de ambitie om je te blijven ontwikkelen en te groeien;• Geen 9 tot 5 mentaliteit, je bent klantgericht, een teamplayer en hebt doorzettingsvermogen.
Waar kom je terecht?Als Network Automation Engineer kom je te werken in het Infrastructure Services team binnen onze unit Global Technology Operations. Onze klanten zitten door heel Nederland. Global Technology Operations (GTO) is gevestigd in Amstelveen, Rotterdam en Arnhem. Flexibiliteit ten aanzien van inzet en locatie is wenselijk, maar uiteraard zoeken wij naar een situatie waarin de reisinspanning acceptabel is.
Ons aanbod?Een vaste baan en de mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder te worden en zo mee te delen in onze successen. Zo wordt werken bij CGI dubbel beloond. Via de CGI Academy helpen we jou de juiste trainingen te volgen, want jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling vinden wij belangrijk en staat bij ons voorop. Een plek in onze hechte community waar we samen met elkaar de verantwoordelijkheid van projecten dragen en klantverwachtingen overtreffen. Een rol in ons CGI verhaal.
Are you ready to Be part of our story? 
Interesse?Solliciteer dan direct!Wil je eerst meer informatie over de inhoud van de vacature? Neem dan contact op met Rinaldo Dijo (Manager Infrastructure Services) via 06 4178 4347 of via rinaldo.dijo@cgi.comVragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met Seren Taylan (Recruitment Business Partner) via (088) 564 0000 of via seren.taylan@cgi.com
Bezoek voor meer informatie over CGI: www.cginederland.nl

Description

Werken bij Ingram Micro b.v.

Ingram Micro raakt tot wel 80% van de technologie die u dagelijks gebruikt door onze focus op Technology Solutions, Cloud en Commerce en Lifecycle Solutions. Met een omzet van $ 46 miljard, zijn we 's werelds grootste technologiedistributeur, met activiteiten in 56 landen en meer dan 35.000 medewerkers. We blijven ons wereldwijde bereik strategisch uitbreiden met 32 overnames sinds 2012.

We streven naar het uitbreiden van onze Advanced Solutions-activiteiten in Europa en het Midden-Oosten. Om onze ambitieuze doelen te bereiken, hebben we getalenteerde mensen nodig voor onze go-to-market Sales- (Presales, Sales en Business Development) en Marketingteams. Onze afdeling Advanced Solutions is voornamelijk gericht op B2B resellers.

In deze functie van Pre-sales consultant ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergroten van onze sales, door samen met onze klanten te werken aan projecten die meer of minder complex zijn. Je bouwt een band op met onze klanten en onderhoud die, door te werken conform de hoge standaarden van Ingram Micro als het gaat om (onder andere) klant- en resultaatgerichtheid.

Je draagt de verantwoordelijkheid voor het merk Extreme Networks, samen met de Business Development Manager. Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor Extreme Networks en je bouwt en onderhoudt een excellente relatie met hen.

De locatie voor deze fulltime baan is in Utrecht. Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan Andre van Oosten, onze Sr. Business Unit Manager.

Wat ga je doen?

Deze rol is een combinatie van Techniek en Sales, verantwoordlijkheden zijn o.a.
Technische vraagstukken van onze partners vertalen in oplossingen en producten van Extreme Networks.Je beantwoord product gerelateerde vragen van klanten en collega’sSamenstellen en opvolgen van offertes.Zorgen voor een goede orderverwerking door onze order desk
Wat breng je mee?
Je hebt technische ervaring met netwerkoplossingen in het Enterprise segmentJe hebt een sterke interesse in computer- en technologieproducten, bijbehorende systemen en diensten en je wilt je carrière starten of voortzetten in een oplossingsgerichte verkoopfunctie bij een internationale organisatie.Je bent ondernemend, ziet kansen en houdt van uitdagingen.Je hebt ervaring met, of zou graag beginnen met het opbouwen van ervaring in een snel veranderende en commercieel gedreven organisatie.Je bent klantgericht, positief van aard en gedreven door persoonlijk, team- en bedrijfssucces.Je taalvaardigheid in het Engels en Nederlands is vloeiend.Je vindt het leuk om een gamechanger te zijn in ons bedrijf, voor onze leveranciers en klanten, om de norm te stellen voor de komende jaren.
Wat bieden wij?
Een boeiende baan met ruimte om je talenten te ontwikkelen.De mogelijkheid om als Pre-Sales consultant een organisatie in volle groei te ondersteunen.Een marktconform salaris met een aantal extra’s
Bovendien kom je terecht in een dynamische en waarde gedreven organisatie, die staat voor gepassioneerd eigenaarschap, samenwerken, pro-activiteit & enthousiasme, klantgerichtheid, authenticiteit en kwaliteit! In het afgelopen jaar (2020) mochten wij distributeur van het jaar worden van APC, Vertiv en HPE. Daarnaast zijn we voor DellEMC genomineerd. (deze merken zijn onderdeel van het Datacenter team waarin je tewerk wordt gesteld).

“Als Projectleider Bodemdesk krijg je volop kansen om de nieuwe afdeling met als specialisme bodemvervuiling op te bouwen. Je bent praktisch en inhoudelijk betrokken bij de begeleiding van de projectteams. Jij gaat het onderwerp bodemvervuiling binnen SPIE op de kaart te zetten.” 
Jan Willem de Jager, SHEQ Manager SPIE Network Solutions en SPIE Infratechniek 
Niet ‘gewoon een baan’.Ben jij niet die specialist die onze kennis, kunde, werkwijze omtrent bodemonderzoek naar een next-level kan trekken? Dan is deze baan niet voor je weggelegd. Deze baan bij SPIE Network Solutions te Oss is er namelijk een voor een gemotiveerde Projectleider Bodemdesk die dit doel samen met zijn/haar collega's gaat realiseren. Onderstaande taken zullen tot je takenpakket gaan behoren.Het (laten) uitvoeren of inhoudelijk beoordelen van onderzoeken naar de milieuhygiënische kwaliteit van (water)bodem, inclusief asbestHet verrichten van BUS-meldingen en het opstellen van V&G plannen en bijbehorende evaluatiesAfstemmen van werkzaamheden met opdrachtgevers, bevoegde gezagen en veldwerkersFungeren als kennisdrager, vraagbaak en gesprekspartner/adviseur op bodemonderzoek bodemvervuiling en saneringen. Het opstellen van offertes op maat. Voortgang bewaken van de projecten, waarbij de nadruk ligt op de planning, kwaliteit en kosten/budgettering.Je bent in staat uitvragen te verzorgen naar milieukundige adviesbureau’s en gegevens te interpreteren en te vertalen naar (graaf)werkzaamheden.Organiseren van materiaal en materieel voor de sanerende werkzaamheden.Het onderhouden van het SIKB BRL 7000 protocol 7004 certificaat.Ingezet kunnen worden als kwaliteit verantwoordelijke persoon (KVP) voor de sanerende werkzaamheden .Ingezet kunnen worden als (register) deskundig leidinggevende op projecten (DLP of R-DLP)
Niet ‘gewoon een bedrijf’.Bij SPIE Network Solutions, gevestigd in Oss, zijn we dag en nacht actief met Glasvezel werkzaamheden. Dit doen wij zowel voor de zakelijke (FttX) als voor de particuliere (FttH) markt. Samen met een aantal andere partijen gaan wij heel Nederland verglazen om iedereen van supersnel internet te voorzien. We zijn trots op ons vakmanschap en de kennis die we inzetten. Jij kan daar aan bijdragen!Naast SPIE Network Solutions zal je ook ingezet worden als interne expert en adviseur bij de andere divisies van SPIE Nederland, wanneer zij met bodemonderzoeken te maken krijgen.
Met loyale vakmannen- en vrouwen vormt het team SPIE Network Solutions Oss een hechte club waar er altijd oprechte aandacht is voor iedereen. Ook krijg je de kans om je verder te scholen door het volgen van diverse cursussen.
Niet ‘gewoon’ een set arbeidsvoorwaarden.We vragen veel van jou als Projectleider Bodemdesk en dus bieden we veel. Om precies te zijn bieden we voor deze functie op basis van 40 uur per week:om te starten een jaarcontract.Salaris is afhankelijk van leeftijd, opleiding en ervaring.een PMT-pensioenregeling waarvan SPIE 70% betaald. Voor later.25 vakantiedagen + 13 adv-dagen. Dat tikt lekker aan.een winstdelingsregeling.Een leasauto waarmee je ook prive mag rijden.alle kansen voor verdere ontwikkeling en opleiding. Je hoeft ze alleen maar te grijpen.
Niet ‘gewoon een medewerker’.Dagelijks moeten wij het verschil maken om bij onze klanten op onze top te presteren. Dat vragen wij van al onze medewerkers, dus ook van jou als Projectleider Bodemdesk. Om het verschil te kunnen maken zul je een kartrekkersrol moeten gaan vervullen in jouw team. Daarbovenop:Heb je werk- en denkniveau op HBO niveau.Onze voorkeur gaat uit naar kandidaten met minimaal een afgeronde MBO opleiding. Bij voorkeur een Milieukundige opleiding aangevuld met MVK. 2 tot 4 jaar ervaring in (water)bodem- en/of asbestonderzoek en saneringen;In bezit van R-DLP.Kennis van en ervaring met BRL SIKB 7000 en de BRL SIKB 6000 met de bijbehorende protocollen;- wettelijke en relevante eisen en bepalingen, ook m.b.t. milieu en ARBO- werking te gebruiken PBM’s, materieel en materiaal- Nederlandse bodem en bodemkunde- milieu hygiënische verontreinigingen (inclusief asbest) en hun gedrag - herkennen van asbestErvaring met het schrijven van V&G -en of uitvoeringsplannen.Beschik je over de volgende competenties: nauwkeurig, flexibel, klantgericht, teambuilder, zelfredzaam, goede mondelinge en schriftelijke vaardigheden.Bekend met Microsoft Office 365: Word, Excel, Sharepoint, ed.Bij voorkeur bekend met Stantec's integrale Bodemrisicokaart.Je bent bereid te reizen door het gehele land om onze projecten te bezoeken en te begeleiden.
Gewoon solliciteren.Ben jij de persoon die geen genoegen meer neemt met een gewone baan bij een gewone werkgever?
Solliciteer gewoon direct op deze vacature voor Projectleider Bodemdesk. De werkzaamheden vinden plaats in ons kantoor te Oss. Uiteraard zul je ook vaak op locatie of bij de klant aanwezig zijn.
Heb je vragen? Schakel met Julie Dessing, corporate recruiter, via 088-1193555 of julie.dessing@spie.com.

Job Title: Cloud Consultant - Customer Engineer - Storage & Network
Job Description:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Are you looking to join a team where you help customers use the latest technology, where you receive innovative training and where you´re empowered to make a difference? Do you put your customers at the center of everything you do? Are you eager to learn to drive the highest technical quality? Do you like to work with best-in-class cloud technologies and do you have a passion to help customers adopt cloud and build solid a cloud foundation?

If so, the Customer Engineer position is for you! We need enthusiastic people to provide technical leadership to our customers. You work at customers in the Netherlands and Europe, both on-site and remotely.

Customer Engineers (CEs) are deep technical advisors supporting and enabling our Enterprise customers with Azure. Using your passion for technology you educate and assists customers to develop and deploy their applications and make sure they run healthy and efficient. You assess their solutions to find potential issues, threats and areas for improvement and work with them to solve these us. When a customer faces significant issues, you step in to use your technical depth to find the cause and suggest a solution.

Responsibilities

You will also be involved in wider Support Execution which means lots of teamwork to help our customers (and your colleagues) to be more successful. Therefore, we look for people who enjoy collaboration and can spot opportunities in their customers for developing even greater business value and grow those customer/partner relationships effectively. Other interesting areas would be to develop awareness of competition, modifying IP and creating new content.

About half your time will be spent in Support Management activities such as spotting performance issues, analysis of customer needs and dealing with any technical issues or problems and solving them. You’ll be part of a larger virtual account team and get to work in partnership with them to strengthen targeted customer relationships and work on immediate and long-term service delivery plans.

With your passion you will motivate others and yourself to drive the vision of changing the world to a better one through the power of the cloud.

With your spirit and your ideas, you will strive to be a role model and help our customers to understand the advantage of the latest technologies and you will help to improve their existing IT-environment.

You will act as an entrepreneur and as an evangelist internally and externally and will drive the value proposition of Azure with every action you take.

Qualifications

We are looking for engineers or technical consultants with an understanding of cloud concepts and technology and experience in supporting optimizing cloud workloads in production. Additional skills in specific cloud related components, like networking, identity, security or automation is a benefit, however the role is specifically targeted for expertise on cloud networking or storage services.

You have or are eager to develop the following skills:
Excellent written, oral and presentation skillsFluent in Dutch preferredExperience in the enterprise customer arena/face-to-face customer engagement skillsConfidence to work with engineering teams and technical decision makersKnowledge about Microsoft Azure solutions and offeringsDiagnosing and troubleshooting IT issues.
To set yourself up for success in this role we are looking for a solid grounding in systems development, network operations, software support or IT consulting, with preferably 1-5 years of working experience.

We believe that everyone can grow and develop. We succeed as a team by sharing knowledge and experience. Don’t worry about what you don’t know; come and show us what you do know, and we will teach you the rest.

Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) or equivalent is desirable.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Job Title: PhD position on the theory of quantum networks
Job Description:
While a quantum internet is being developed, many open questions remain on the power of networked quantum computers What are their exact capabilities? And for which distributed tasks can new protocols be found?

The MNS group of the Informatics Institute invites you to apply for a PhD position working on these questions.

What are you going to do?

As part of your PhD project, you will develop new multiparty protocols for joint computational tasks on quantum networks, and prove limits on their power. Research directions for your PhD include
 Joint quantum computation under timing constraints. What if networked quantum computers have to perform a computational task together, but are only allowed limited rounds of communication? Can there be a trade-off between time taken and entanglement? Computing on encrypted quantum data. In a quantum network, multiple parties will have to handle quantum data, while not completely trusting each other. To handle this situation, research will have to advance the state-of-the-art in secure quantum computation.

You will be embedded in the MNS group of the Institute of Informatics of the University of Amsterdam. The group focuses its research on the fundamental architectural problems that arise from the interconnection of systems and of data flows. We look at the emerging architectures that can support the operations of the future Internet.

You will work under the supervision of dr Florian Speelman, who will also serve as your co-promotor, and of dr Paola Grosso as promotor.

You will also work in close collaboration with QuSoft, the Dutch research institute for quantum software, which houses experts on all topics in quantum computing. Together, the local institutes form a rich research ecosystem with opportunities to work together with computer scientists, physicists and mathematicians from the various groups situated at the Amsterdam Science Park.

You will start your PhD project concurrently with a PhD student who will work on theoretical questions directly associated with the Quantum Delta CAT-2 project. This gives the opportunity to work together on shared research questions concerning applications on the prototype quantum network that is being developed.

You will
 research quantum networks, by developing new protocols for multi-partite quantum computation tasks, and by developing proofs that show the impossibility of some tasks; publish and present your work in international conferences and journals; be an active part of the local research groups at MNS and QuSoft; assist in educational activities and supervision of bachelor and master students.

What do we require?
 A Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related subject; high proficiency in English; previous demonstrated interest in quantum computing, in the form of coursework, projects, or academic publications; high motivation in pursuing academic research.

Our offer

We offer a temporary employment contract for 38 hours per week for the duration of 4 years (the initial contract will be for a period of 18 months and after satisfactory evaluation it will be extended for a total duration of 4 years). This should lead to a dissertation (PhD thesis). We will draft an educational plan that includes attendance of courses and (international) meetings. We also expect you to assist in teaching undergraduates and Master students.

The salary will be €2,395 to €3,061 (scale P) gross per month, based on a fulltime contract (38 hours a week). This is exclusive 8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus. A favourable tax agreement, the ‘30% ruling’, may apply to non-Dutch applicants. The Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities is applicable.

Are you curious about our extensive package of secondary employment benefits like our excellent opportunities for study and development? Take a look here.

Questions?

Do you have questions about this vacancy? Or do you want to know more about our organisation? Please contact
 Florian Speelman, Assistant Professor
T +31 (0)20 525 7538

About The Faculty Of Science And The Informatics Institute

The Faculty of Science has a student body of around 7,000, as well as 1,600 members of staff working in education, research or support services. Researchers and students at the Faculty of Science are fascinated by every aspect of how the world works, be it elementary particles, the birth of the universe or the functioning of the brain, or machines that display intelligent behaviour.

The mission of the Informatics Institute is to perform curiosity-driven and use-inspired fundamental research in Computer Science. The main research themes are Artificial Intelligence, Computational Science and Systems and Network Engineering. Our research involves complex information systems at large, with a focus on collaborative, data driven, computational and intelligent systems, all with a strong interactive component.

Job application

The UvA is an equal-opportunity employer. We prioritise diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We value a spirit of enquiry and perseverance, provide the space to keep asking questions, and promote a culture of curiosity and creativity.

The Informatics Institute strives for a better gender balance in its staff. We therefore strongly encourage women to apply for this position.

Coordinating Clinical Data Manager - someone who sets up, standardizes and manages programs for clinical data gathered from clinical studies done by several partner CRO's of this pharmaceutical and biotechnological, rising power-house.

Job Description

For a company that develops their own, knock-your-socks-off, therapies against a broad spectrum of diseases, we are looking for a Clinical Data Manager. In this position you will be the main point of contact for clinical data managers, coordinators and research associates at the CRO's that the company works with. To ensure standardization of data for all entities, you will set up and program the clinical data programs / databases (Rave, etc.), and guide the local clinical staff at the CRO's towards using these according to ICH-GCP guidelines. You keep oversight on all data management activities within several projects at once.

Responsibilities

Set up and manage the clinical data program / database (Rave).Standardize data capture and reporting at all partner CRO's and their data managers.Safeguard clinical study data integrity by ensuring ICH-GCP guidelines are followed.Contribute to constant process improvement and adjustment.Serve as the main point of contact for collaborating parties at CRO's and other clients.Oversee data capture and reporting, coordinating and training personnel where needed.Requirements

At least a finished MSc degree within biomedical sciences, biostatistics, clinical research or similar.Senior level of experience in clinical program data management.Experience with statistics and/or programming is highly desirable.Coordinating and managing capabilitiesExcellent communication in English (Dutch is a plus)Analytical, pragmatic, clear communication, direct.Benefits

Contract: Long term (1 year contract followed by permanent)Salary: €60k tot €100k per yearHours: 32 - 40 hours, full time preferredLocation: Utrecht areaVacancy number: 17060
 Oxford Global Resources is the largest recruitment agency within the fields of Science, Engineering and IT. All our recruiters have a relevant background within these fields and can help you find the perfect job through our extensive network.

As a specialist company we have a wide range of laboratory vacancies in Quality Control (QC) and Research & Development (R&D) within various sectors, including Pharmaceuticals, Biotechnology, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Food Industry, Chemicals, Environment and Plants.

Oxford is always looking for talent with expertise in Biotechnology, Immunology, Biochemistry, Virology, Microbiology, Molecular Biology, Life Science, Analytical Chemistry, Physical Chemistry, Polymer Chemistry, Petrochemistry and Diagnostics. We are keen to meet candidates who have experience in one or more of the following techniques: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, virus culture, cell culture, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, cloning, sequencing, protein purification, purification, HPLC, UPLC, chromatography, physical chemistry, viscosity, melting point, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titrations, Karl Fisher, formulation, sterility, determinations, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025.

Do you find this vacancy interesting? Or are you looking for a position at MLA, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc or PhD and are you interested in the vacancy laboratory Assistant, Laboratory Assistant, Sample Preparation Laboratory Assistant, Analyst, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validation Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Team Leader, Department Head, Laboratory Manager, Manager, Director, etc. Please contact us directly!

Our Marketing Technology Manager is, first and foremost, a technologist. Made up of one part IT geek and one part integrated marketing expert, this hybrid professional straddles the fence between both worlds, which today are really one and the same.
As a webmaster, you keep our global Magento websites up to date and work together with our web agency to optimize them further. We have our own OFYR media drive. After an introduction to the code and structure, your development skills allow you to maintain and fine-tune this You have a coordinating role in the development and roll-out of our online loyalty programYou work closely together with the digital marketeer and e-commerce team on a seamless customer journey and conversion optimization. You love a good dashboard and are keen on tracking and analysing performance.You set up, test, and automate our e-mail marketingYou have an advisory role in the connection of our CRM to the website, app, and other marketing channels. You research and recommend new marketing technology products or connect and integrate our current stack. For our colleagues, you can fix some quick IT-issues, give them access to our server, network printers or Office365...don’t worry about it too much, you have an external IT specialist as your back-up, to whom you are the single point of contact.
Your background
You have 3-5 years of experience in a digital agency, or in a MarTech environment. You are excited to share your portfolio, in which you have demonstrated some smart tech skills. Projects can be part of your studies, personal projects, or prior work experience. 
About OFYR Global 
OFYR embodies the art of outdoor cooking. It is designed for the finest moments with friends. OFYR is a young company, founded in 2015 that has rapidly conquered the international market with its unique authenticity, multifunctionality and design. 
We’re looking for a passionate technologist. A passion for the outdoors and design is a plus. And oh, we love good food (besides on Fridays, then we love greasy food). You will be welcomed in our global headquarters, located in Roosendaal, The Netherlands. We’re a small-scale, result-driven team, we get excited by creativity and have a common ‘can do mentality’. 
Apply by sending your cv and portfolio to marketing@ofyr.com

5G is changing the world. Be part of that change. Md7, a leading provider of innovative solutions to help mobile network operators, is seeking a passionate and detail-oriented native-level German Project Control Specialist to expand the team.
Are you the one friends ask to double check their work?Do you follow recipes exactly as written every time?Do you love minding the details?Do you have a clear goal that you work toward every day?
If you answered yes to these questions, please read on. As our organization continues to evolve and grow, we find ourselves looking for a new team member to assist us in delivering a high-quality experience to every client, every time.

Job Summary

The Project Control Specialist (PCS) is responsible for assisting with a variety of projects related to development and/or modification of cellular antenna sites to support our customers - the wireless phone operators. The PCS works closely with internal teams to request and track all purchase orders for various projects to include both vendor and client POs. The PCS orders, maintains and ensures the timely and accurate completion of the various project services and documents. The PCS communicates the timelines of the various services through forecasting in both internal and external workflow systems, while also delivering project updates on project status calls.

Major Goals And Responsibilities
Ensure timely completion of projectsOrder, review/quality check and submit/upload required project documentsCommunicate project status and issues through client meetings and reportingUtilize workflow management tools to capture data and report progress

Essential Activities
Project Tracking: includes tracking and coordinating key information from a variety of people and/or systems in a fast-paced environment.Internal/External Reporting and Forecasting: includes providing receiving and invoicing updates and timelines to internal management through project trackers/databases and weekly meetings.Ensure Accuracy: includes ensuring project information, documents and deliverables are complete/accurate and promptly uploading them into various software systems.Vendor Coordination: includes working with vendors to obtain quotes, issue purchase orders track progress and receive and forward deliverables to the appropriate party within MD7.Utilize Computer Systems: includes using multiple internal and external software workflow and data management systems.

Key Characteristics to be Successful in this Role

Skills
Native Level German and good English. Dutch language skills are a plus.Effective CommunicatorAbility to prioritize and be self-motivated with minimal supervision.Effective time and task management skills.Basic computer skills with Outlook, Excel and Word are required.

Experience
College degree preferred but not necessary.Experience in site acquisition and/or real estate for wireless operators a plus.Experience with providing extreme service to customers.
Md7 Core Values

Our Vision and Core Values are both foundational and aspirational at the same time. We never quit striving to improve. We are always looking to recruit exceptional talent that share in these values as well.
Respect for the Individual.Balanced Life.Giving Back.Continuous Improvement.Extreme Service.Integrity.

We want to be able to continuously innovate to empower success. That is why, in addition to exciting career opportunities throughout the world, we also provide the best training in the industry.

Additional Information
Location: Maastricht.Pay: Base salary.Employment type: Full-time, 6 months initial contract.

VAT MANAGERReporting to; Head of TaxLocation; AmsterdamTenure; Full-Time; Permanent  MAIN PURPOSE:
At the Norgine office in Amsterdam, a new position of a VAT Manager has arisen. The VAT Manager reports to the Head of Tax and is part of the Global Finance Team. The VAT Manager will take on responsibility for managing and advising on Norgine’s VAT position.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES:
·      Pro-actively advices and supports the business on predominantly European VAT aspects of business decisions;·      Initiates, manages and/or supports VAT planning strategies and implementation thereof;·      Identifies and manages VAT risks and opportunities;·      Continuously monitors and assesses the relevance of changes in VAT legislation;·      Provides training and awareness within the organization on relevant VAT topics;·      Monitors and assists in internal and external VAT audits;·      Participates in projects to ensure correct VAT treatment (e.g. acquisitions, divestments and business restructurings);·      Initiates, manages and/or supports implementation of processes and procedures that continuously improve the VAT position;·      Build and maintain strong working relationships with internal stakeholders (e.g. finance colleagues, customs manager, business contacts), Tax Authorities, third party advisors and external auditors.
SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:
·      Dutch Master’s degree in Tax Law or Fiscal Economics·      6+ years of working experience in VAT in Big consultancy firm/as in-house VAT Manager;·      Strong and up to date knowledge of EU VAT;·      Knowledge to translate VAT rules to operational activities;·      Relevant experience within an EU VAT environment, e.g. in industry and/or Big 4 firms;·      Fluent in English, Dutch is a big plus;·      Strong influencing skills and high adaptability;·      Good business understanding and knowledge with global outlook;·      Strong project management skills and analytical thinking;·      Independent and highly self-motivated;·      Practical attitude;·      Willing to do some travel.
Across the globe in 2018, Norgine is proud to have helped 23 million patients, employed almost 1,400 permanent staff and generated €395 million in net product sales to reinvest in medicines for the future, a growth of 15% since 2017.
Norgine is a leading European specialist pharmaceutical company that has been bringing transformative medicines to patients for over a century. We understand the complexities of the European healthcare systems and have a direct presence in 14 European countries, as well as Australia and New Zealand. We also have a strong global network of partnerships in non-Norgine markets.
We are a flexible and fully integrated pharmaceutical business, with manufacturing (Hengoed, Wales and Dreux, France), third party supply networks and significant product development capabilities, in addition to our sales and marketing infrastructure. This enables us to acquire, develop and commercialise specialist and innovative products that make a real difference to the lives of patients around the world.
Follow us on twitter @norgine or visit us at www.norgine..com

Netflix has been changing the way people watch shows and movies, and we've built a global CDN and backbone, Open Connect, that sets the standard for video delivery.

We have a global network connecting hundreds of sites and thousands of partners. Inter connecting our studios, offices, internet exchanges, and partners takes technical know-how, the ability to manage complex projects, and excellent communication skills. We are seeking a Network Provisioning Engineer to help scale our CDN, corporate, and studio connectivity.

Your responsibilities will include
Managing the installation and turn-up of connectivity; ensure contractual acceptance is met in accordance with vendor MSA including receipt and review of circuit design records and circuit testing resultsEnsuring circuits are designed to standard (resiliency/redundancy, latency, etc.)Working with various data centers, vendors, internal teams, and partners to troubleshoot connectivity and provide clean handoff for activation Testing, troubleshooting, and acceptance of all cross connects and telecommunication circuitsIdentify trends and proactively recommend hardware and fiber augmentsProviding support for new site builds, moves, and expansions; plan large scale circuit migrations with data center providers, vendors and partnersCommunicating with Technical Infrastructure Delivery, Business Operations, Logistics, and Network Engineering teams to streamline work of the various stakeholdersWorking with data center vendors and telecommunication providers to ensure reliable and functional connectivity per Netflix standardsReducing potential risks to upcoming projects timelines, by identifying issues and providing solutionsManaging vendor for on time delivery of services, escalate issues to account teams as appropriate and manage expectations of customers both internal and external on a periodic basisConducting regularly scheduled audits of all connectivity to ensure accurate inventory and invoicing

You will be successful in this role if you
Thrive and enjoy working in a high performance, fast-paced environment.Possess a fierce attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple circuit installations concurrently.Are an effective collaborator with excellent communication skills; able to articulate complex ideas in a direct, concise way.Can develop and seek process improvements and strategies to further automate and streamline provisioning workflows.Are comfortable with not being onsite doing the actual work, but instead, planning and documenting the work to be executed by remote hand partners.Possess the ability to troubleshoot issues remotely -- coordinating and communicating with remote hands, vendors, and other teams to quickly isolate and remediate installation issues.

Requirements
Team player with the ability to build peer, and external relationships.Support a global organization; able to time shift to lead or support projects executed in other time zones.In-depth understanding of dark fiber, wavelength, DIA, Understand the usage of patch panels, fiber optic connectors, optic types and form factorsExcellent written and verbal communications skills, able to provide detailed instructions for contemporaries to follow and executeExtensive knowledge of the telecommunications carrier and data center industry Ability to travel when required (Occasional)Ability to manage high volume of ordersAbility to participate in team on-callAbility to solve order issues and handle escalations

Job Description:
Crossover is hiring for multiple Network Engineer positions for our client, ZephyrTel.

Are you a seasoned engineer, with a breadth of experience in building & shipping products? Do you have high standards when it comes to what good code is and what it takes to build high-quality, fault-tolerant software? Are you ready to own the codebase of a full-blown enterprise product, act as a technical lead for it and take it from stormy waters into more clear ones? If so, then this job is for you.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be primarily responsible for resolving customer issues relative to system outages and defects. Outside of standard daily tasks, you will drive the cost optimization projects (i.e. automating processes where possible) and working through setting up the new infrastructure for future opportunities with our product offerings.

Network Engineer Key Responsibilities
Hands-on technical work including codingBecoming the go-to expert on products they are assigned to and maintaining architecture documentsUpholding high standards on fundamental data structures, algorithms, and architectural best practicesLeveraging teams of Engineers to build new features and fix software defects

Basic Requirements

Required:
10+ years overall in Telecom / Data-center management5+ years with system administration and visualization2+ years in a support role

Additional Experience Preferred (some But Not All Are Required)
MPLS Networking Support (Cisco ISR)Cisco Routing and SwitchingStorage Area NetworkingCitrix Load BalancersCertificate Management on Cisco, Citrix and other servers / Services (Apache Tomcat, IIS)Telecoms Signalling Support (Network Architecture)HP Server SupportVMware ESXiVPN and firewall administrationIBM AIX Support & AdministrationOpenVMS Support & AdministrationP2V and V2V management experience

Nice-to-have Requirements
CCIE Desirable (Cisco Certified Internetworking Expert)RHCE (Red Hat Certified Engineer)HP Certifications Desirable (HP Admin etc)BA in Information Technology / Computer ScienceAWS Management / Migration experience

About ZephyrTel

Be part of the major transformation in telecoms! ZephyrTel brings the power of end-to-end public cloud solutions to telecom operators around the world. Having acquired 9 companies over the last three years and serving 300 telecoms operator customers, ZephyrTel continues to expand the portfolio to offer the largest breadth of solutions based on the public cloud. Our strategy is to deliver solutions for the Telco space which are based on the public cloud and stand to truly transform our customers’ businesses, revolutionizing the cost equation, and make them more competitive.

What’s Next?

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

What to expect next:
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.You will be paired up with one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
