Job Description:
Heb je affiniteit met ICT, het onderwijs en wil je je inzetten voor een maatschappelijk betrokken organisatie? Dan is werken bij Kennisnet iets voor jou. Kennisnet is een mooie werkgever die door haar overkoepelende rol een grote invloed heeft op het primair- en voortgezet onderwijs en het mbo.
Voor Kennisnet is Aardoom & de Jong op zoek naar een:
NetwerkspecialistZoetermeer, 32-40 uur per week
Wil jij bijdragen aan een veilige centrale infrastructuur voor alle leerlingen in het mbo, voortgezet- en primair onderwijs? Ben je graag bezig met de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van netwerken, beveiliging en connectiviteit? Is zoeken naar oplossingen in een complexe omgeving voor jou de leukste uitdaging? Dan zien we graag je sollicitatie tegemoet!
Kennisnet is op zoek naar een netwerkspecialist, waarbij jouw primaire focus ligt op de dienst Veilig Internet. Deze dienst biedt Kennisnet in samenwerking met haar partner SIVON sinds 9 juni 2020 aan. Daarnaast richt je je ook op andere, al langer bestaande diensten van Kennisnet, zoals Entree Federatie en de overstapservice onderwijs.
Je werkzaamheden voor Veilig Internet zijn onder andere het maken van highlevel designs voor netwerkaansluitingen van onderwijsbesturen en de onderwijslocaties. Daarbij werk je samen met onze beheerpartij(en) om te komen tot lowlevel designs. Hierbij is de technische uitwerking van een specifieke klantaansluiting al vastgesteld. Je adviseert klantteams om tot een technisch beheersbare oplossing te komen en je werkt samen aan de doorontwikkeling van veilig internet.
Je draait mee in het team Exploitatie waar naast Veilig Internet, de onderwijs-community-cloud en het nationale dienstencentrum worden beheerd en ondersteund.
De onderwijs-community-cloud is de private cloud omgeving van Kennisnet waarop de diensten van Kennisnet en haar partners worden aangeboden. Daarnaast biedt het de basisinfrastructuur aan voor het onderwijs in de datacenters van het nationale dienstencentrum. Deze basisinfrastructuur is het hart van de dienst Veilig Internet.
Ook de Entree Federatie en de overstapservice onderwijs worden gehost op de onderwijs-community-cloud. Voor deze diensten ligt je focus vooral op de onderliggende infrastructuur van de onderwijs-community-cloud. Als netwerkspecialist werk je ook aan de meest efficiënte en betrouwbare mogelijke inzet van de infrastructuur voor deze diensten.
In operationele sprints van het team worden diverse infrastructurele taken door jou opgepakt.
Met jouw enthousiasme en kennis draag je bij aan het realiseren van een optimale dienstverlening en help je mee aan de verdere professionalisering van Kennisnet.
Functie-eisenAls Netwerkspecialist beschik je in elk geval over de volgende kennis en ervaring:Je hebt een opleiding op minimaal hbo-niveau in de richting (bedrijfs)informatica en bij voorkeur minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in de ICT-wereld, bijvoorbeeld als netwerkengineer, netwerk architect of technisch adviseur.Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen op wo-niveau.Je hebt ruime ervaring met het vertalen van functionele eisen naar technische beheersbare oplossingen.Je beschikt over aantoonbare kennis van de volgende technologieën en standaarden:Ervaring met het beheer van Fortinet firewalls binnen meerdere organisaties is een pre.Aantoonbare operationele ervaring met geavanceerde beveiligingsservices zoals Threat Protection.Je hebt een hands-on (operationele) mentaliteit en kan je rol goed vertegenwoordigen bij de klant en in de interne klantteams.Je kunt goed zelfstandig werken en tegelijkertijd functioneer je ook goed in teamverband.Je bent communicatief zeer vaardig, zowel op tactisch als operationeel niveau en schakelt gemakkelijk tussen die niveaus.Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal zowel in woord als geschrift.
BedrijfsprofielKennisnetKennisnet is de publieke organisatie voor onderwijs en ICT. Als gids helpen ze besturen en scholen verder met kennis over wat werkt met ICT in het onderwijs. Naast gids zijn ze bouwer van het publieke ICT-fundament. Kennisnet zorgt voor een stevige basis, zodat ICT in het onderwijs eenvoudig, veilig en betrouwbaar kan worden ingezet. Zij ontwikkelen en beheren ICT-diensten voor de klas, voor de school en diensten die markt en onderwijs met elkaar verbinden.Kennisnet is gevestigd in Zoetermeer en er werken ongeveer 110 professionals.
Het TeamHet team waar je terecht komt bestaat uit technisch beheerders en support medewerkers. Vanuit dit team wordt de basisinfrastructuur en de onderwijs-community-cloud beheerd. Met 10 collega’s zorgen jullie ervoor dat de diensten van Kennisnet en de ondersteuning ervan georganiseerd is. Ook de ondersteuning van de interne organisatie en ondersteunende systemen/ tooling wordt vanuit dit team geregeld.
ArbeidsvoorwaardenWerken bij Kennisnet betekent werken in een fascinerende omgeving die -net als het onderwijs- nooit stilstaat. Je krijgt aanvankelijk een arbeidsovereenkomst voor de duur van 1 jaar, maar wanneer je bij Kennisnet op je plek bent, gaan ze uit van een veel langer dienstverband.
Kennisnet biedt goede primaire- en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, die aansluiten bij de zwaarte en het niveau van de functie. Het salaris is afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
Bij de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden horen:Flexbudget van 10% van het maandsalaris dat je kunt gebruiken voor bijvoorbeeld het kopen van extra verlof of kan laten uitkeren.Opleidingsbudget van gemiddeld € 2.475,- per jaar.Een goede reiskostenvergoeding.Een tegemoetkoming in de ziektekostenvergoeding.Een vergoeding voor de privé internetaansluiting.Laptop, of keuze voor eigen device met een bijdrage van Kennisnet.Een relatief hoge pensioenbijdrage van de werkgever.
Kennisnet vindt het belangrijk dat hun medewerkers zich ontwikkelen en blijven leren. Alle medewerkers krijgen daar veel mogelijkheden en ruimte voor.Werken bij Kennisnet is: eigen verantwoordelijkheid, flexibele werktijden, je samen met gedreven collega’s en met partners buiten Kennisnet inzetten voor het onderwijs.
ProcedureBij de werving en selectie laat Kennisnet zich bijstaan door het bureau Aardoom & de Jong. Een referentiecheck, diplomacheck en online assessment, na de eerste gespreksronde maken deel uit van deze procedure.
Je reactie, voorzien van motivatiebrief en cv, zien wij graag voor 5 april tegemoet.Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatiebutton.
ContactpersoonR. ZwiepE: zwiep@aardoomendejong.nl
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

For Yokogawa Europe we are looking for a new colleague in the position of: Network & Security Engineer40 uur, Amersfoort This is what you are going to do as a Network & Security EngineerAs a Network & Security Engineer you are specialist in your field and are responsible for implementing and maintaining network infrastructure and security solutions and work in a multidisciplinary team on the realization of advanced networks, including: Office LAN, Regional WAN, Global WAN, Azure cloud network configurations and work from home solutions.
You take ownership of the delivery via changes and projects and are responsible for (independently) developing, configuring, installing, testing, maintaining and troubleshooting, routers, switches, firewalls, SD-WAN, VPN, virtual (cloud) networks, IDS-IPS systems and other security systems.
You are also responsible for incident handling; investigate causes of malfunction, corrective maintenance on hardware and software (e.g. router, switch, firewall, vpn configurations, firmware updates, installing patches, etc.).
You will carry out pro-active maintenance and do remote checks on system logfiles, alerts and notifications on behalf of clients and are also actively working on client systems.
Biggest challenge"To connect our passion for new technologies, enabling secure and reliable operations to our customers" You can make a difference! How?As a Network & Engineer you have the following:A completed IT related MBO-4 or HBO education;Experience with ITIL processes, such as incident management, change management and event monitoring.Experience with Cisco switches, routers and firewalls and VPN solutions;Experience with Cisco ISE;Preferably one or more achieved CCNA or CCNP certificates;Experience with Next Gen Firewalls and SD-WAN concepts;Knowledge of and experience with cloud virtualization and Hypervisors;Experience with working in projects.A practical attitude and strong analytical skills;A flexible, customer-friendly and solution-oriented attitude;Excellent communication skills and good command of the English language in speech and writing.  Focus on a better futureYokogawa Europe is a global supplier in the field of process automation and safety systems. Yokogawa focuses on achieving net-zero emissions, the transition to a circular economy and taking care of the common good, in order to make the world a better place for future generations. We work every day to create a better future for the next generation. You can achieve this together with your customers! Here is where you will workYou will work in an entrepreneurial, creative, internationally oriented working environment. Yokogawa is a "flat" organization with an informal working atmosphere. In addition, you work in a team and the lines are short. Interested?Please sent your application letter and resume by pushing the 'solliciteer' button. If you would like to know more about this position, don't hesitate to contact us. You can submit your application to our recruitment resource center.
recruitment@nl.yokogawa.com
An assessment may be part of the procedure.
All vacancies are outsourced and managed by Yokogawa’s Recruitment Resource Center. Acquisition based on these vacancies is not appreciated.

Je bent bereid om mee te draaien in een standby rooster en tijdelijk in het buitenland te werken. Bovenal heb je passie voor je vak! Wat zij bieden:
Een uitdagende functie binnen een snelgroeiende organisatie;De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen en door te groeien.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Are you looking to join a team where you help customers use the latest technology, where you receive innovative training and where you´re empowered to make a difference? Do you put your customers at the center of everything you do? Are you eager to learn to drive the highest technical quality? Do you like to work with best-in-class cloud technologies and do you have a passion to help customers adopt cloud and build solid a cloud foundation?

If so, the Customer Engineer position is for you! We need enthusiastic people to provide technical leadership to our customers. You work at customers in the Netherlands and Europe, both on-site and remotely.

Customer Engineers (CEs) are deep technical advisors supporting and enabling our Enterprise customers with Azure. Using your passion for technology you educate and assists customers to develop and deploy their applications and make sure they run healthy and efficient. You assess their solutions to find potential issues, threats and areas for improvement and work with them to solve these us. When a customer faces significant issues, you step in to use your technical depth to find the cause and suggest a solution.

Responsibilities

You will also be involved in wider Support Execution which means lots of teamwork to help our customers (and your colleagues) to be more successful. Therefore, we look for people who enjoy collaboration and can spot opportunities in their customers for developing even greater business value and grow those customer/partner relationships effectively. Other interesting areas would be to develop awareness of competition, modifying IP and creating new content.

About half your time will be spent in Support Management activities such as spotting performance issues, analysis of customer needs and dealing with any technical issues or problems and solving them. You’ll be part of a larger virtual account team and get to work in partnership with them to strengthen targeted customer relationships and work on immediate and long-term service delivery plans.

With your passion you will motivate others and yourself to drive the vision of changing the world to a better one through the power of the cloud.

With your spirit and your ideas, you will strive to be a role model and help our customers to understand the advantage of the latest technologies and you will help to improve their existing IT-environment.

You will act as an entrepreneur and as an evangelist internally and externally and will drive the value proposition of Azure with every action you take.

Qualifications

We are looking for engineers with an understanding of cloud concepts and technology and experience in supporting optimizing cloud workloads in production. Additional skills in specific cloud related components, like networking, identity, security or automation is a benefit, however the role is specifically targeted for expertise on cloud networking or storage services.

You have or are eager to develop the following skills:
Excellent written, oral and presentation skillsFluent in Dutch and proficient in EnglishExperience in the enterprise customer arena/face-to-face customer engagement skillsConfidence to work with engineering teams and technical decision makersKnowledge about Microsoft Azure solutions and offeringsDiagnosing and troubleshooting IT issues.
To set yourself up for success in this role we are looking for a solid grounding in systems development, network operations, software support or IT consulting, with preferably 1-5 years of working experience.

We believe that everyone can grow and develop. We succeed as a team by sharing knowledge and experience. Don’t worry about what you don’t know; come and show us what you do know, and we will teach you the rest.

Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) or equivalent is desirable.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

 The digital transformation at the LEGO Group is here! Do you have what it takes to build, implement and maintain a global IT infrastructure?
Bring your hands-on experience to the table to support our growing business needs by collaborating across the LEGO Group and participate in preparing, designing and implementing our network infrastructure, based on agile principles and latest network technologies.

Core Responsibilities

 Prepare, design and deploy networks based on business and technical requirements. Support, maintain, solve, and develop existing systems, to ensure a high level of performance and stability. Participate in the migration from pure MPLS into using IPSEC and SD-WAN Support installation and configuration of backend infrastructure (IP, Ports, Management platform etc.) Participate in the operation of network-related applications and servers in collaboration with other digital departments. Effectively communicate solution and architecture designs to team members and other technical teams. Ensure strong and consistency in delivering results, keeping focus, staying on top of industry trends and assessing new products and technologies.

 Play your part in our team succeeding
In Digital Technology / Infrastructure we are a team of highly skilled colleagues responsible for the network architecture and ownership of a newly revised cloud strategy within the LEGO Group.

We are results-oriented and driven with a solid focus on Network development, implementation and management and a tight and comprehensive roadmap in front of us. We understand that Network is mission critical and act as a foundation layer for the rest of the organization.

 Do you have what it takes?
 Bachelor or Master’s degree within IT, Engineering or a similar related education. Solid hands-on experience with Cisco, Arista and/or Palo Alto technologies including design, implementation and operations. Documented experience with designing, delivering, and operating secure, complex, mission critical IT environments. Knowledge of setting up Software based network using technologies such as Cisco SDA, Palo Alto, Arista or similar Knowledge of Wifi technologies considered an asset. 3-5 years of hands-on experience from a similar position in a multitenancy environment and international matrix organisation is preferred. Effective communicator with strong collaboration skills with stakeholders. 25-40 days per year work travel required. Being agile in spirit, have a true passion for technology, uses creativity and bravery to solve complex tasks would be the ideal combination!

 Join the global LEGO family
Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
“No matter who you are or where you come from, if you are truly passionate about technology and want to become even better at your game, then come join our friendly team”

Als Netwerkprofessional wordt je ingezet bij haar klanten. Het kan gaan om een senior beheerfunctie op complexe netwerken of om het inbrengen van jouw kennis bij infrastructuurprojecten.

Daarvoor heb je diepgaande kennis van IT infrastructuren en Architectuur en ben je in staat om samen te werken met directe collega’s en medewerkers van de klant. Hierbij komen jouw communicatieve vaardigheden goed van pas. Tevens ben je analytisch, initiatiefrijk en besluitvaardig.
Door jouw leergierigheid loop je vooraan met je kennis. Daarnaast denk je mee over de ontwikkeling van nieuwe oplossingen en diensten. Naast je werk bij de klant word je enthousiast van het helpen uitbouwen van een jong bedrijf.

Functie-eisen

Wij vragen een enthousiast talent die het verschil maakt. Om dit aan te tonen bezit je de volgende vakkennis:

– Enthousiast talent, dat het verschil maakt. Om dit aan te tonen bezit je de volgende vakkennis:
– HBO/WO werk- denkniveau, gecombineerd met een analytisch en conceptueel denkvermogen;
– Kennis van en ervaring met Routers / Switches / Firewalls (aantoonbaar door middel van certificeringen;
– Kennis van en ervaring met Firewalls / Loadbalancers (F5, Fortinet, Netscaler, Checkpoint en Cisco);
– Kennis van Management-tooling (Bijv. HP Openview, Prime, APIC-EM);
– Kennis van snmp, syslog, radius netflow/sflow, OSPF, BGP;
– Affiniteit met procesmatig werken (ISM);
– Teamplayer die proactief kan meedenken;
– Stressbestendig;

Een duidelijke toekomstvisie op hoe netwerken zich in de toekomst gaan ontwikkelen, wat zijn hierbij de knelpunten en de mogelijkheden om deze diensten te ontsluiten.

Imagine…
that you are working on innovative data analytics projects that allow the Rabobank to ‘Create a better world together’. You are making a difference each day, because you can put your sound knowledge of analytics together with your abilities to build a team and connect different stakeholders. If you are interested in working in a vibrant environment and like to add value each day by making data and analytics work, read on!

Making a difference

As Project Lead Analytics you are the driving force behind the intelligence and analyses that give Rabobank the leading edge on banking in the Netherlands :

You will be the link between the various stakeholders who are creating data driven solutions. You are a gifted maker of connections with a sound knowledge of advanced data analytics.You are a specialist in innovation with data analytics; With your resourcefulness and strategic views on analytics you can boost the innovation through analytics in the stakeholders’ team. You know what is needed to bring a analytics idea to production. This could range from improving the current service level to development of an innovative and new data driven business model.You are an actively involved foreman in a small multi-disciplinary team with roles such as data scientists and data engineers.You are an experienced analyst; You will be translating the requirements and goals of different stakeholders within the bank to advanced analytics solutions.You are able to create a broad support base for innovation with analytics. You will be pitching new ideas or presenting newfound insights or progress to different parties within the bank, from executive management to your colleagues;You will be working in an environment with a state-of-the-art Data lab.The analytical solutions of your team could be implemented in the banking app or online banking environment and are used by millions of people and businesses in the Netherlands; Your team might also be responsible for the design and build of a custom made front end for our colleagues.You will take an active role in knowledge sharing and project reviews to develop the ambitious team that you are part of.

With you
Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our Data Science & Business Consulting team works together to support the whole organisation with analytical solutions. With you as a Project Lead Analytics, the team consists of 45 colleagues in a variety of roles, including: Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Platform Engineers.

Robey, Business consultant: ‘I am leading data-driven projects within an innovative environment following a successful way of working. This gives me the opportunity to learn new things day in day out applying the newest techniques and using the customer as a starting point. We make sure all developed products solve a specific need or problem or are contributing to our goal to be the front-leader in advanced analytics’.

Eelco, Business consultant : “What I like best as Business Consultant is that you have a broad role with many responsibilities. For a large part you are translating business situations towards analytical solutions and are challenging the status quo. You are aligning data scientists and business representatives and should have the capabilities to design the best solution fit for purpose. Next to that you are end responsible for the projects that you run. We have a young and dynamic team and that makes this a great place to work.”

With your talent

A successful Project Lead Analytics has solid experience in the field of advanced data analytics, but is in the same time of an entrepreneurial nature; result-oriented and a bridge-builder. Hence it is important that you meet the following characteristics:

A completed Master’s Degree in a relevant field.5+ years proven experience in the field of advanced data analytics.
Up to date experience with prediction models, analysis and research methods and modern data- and IT-architecture.Experience on a senior level in initiation, management and implementation of complex analytics products in a large corporate with multi-disciplinary teams.Strong consulting skills. Excellent presentation and advisory skills. Focus on innovation. You have proven experience in initiating innovation in a complex environment.Excellent social skills. Strong ability to manage people and motivate, inspire and coach them. You are able to build a network inside and outside Rabobank, where you are seen as an authoritative specialist on successful analytic products.Entrepreneurial and can do mentality.Fluent in English, both verbally and in writing;Advanced proficiency in Dutch is considered an advantage.

Growing a better world together
You might already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 8.5 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a Better World Together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

We make sizeable annual investments in the voluntary sector in the Netherlands. This allows us to support about 1,250 sport and cultural organizations that are a second home to many people.We provide 500 million Euros in financing to the Dutch education sector annually because, after all, good education is the bedrock of tomorrow’s societyWith the Rabobank Foundation, we support social enterprises. This gives people experiencing barriers entering the labor market the opportunities they deserve, and helps them to participate fully in our society

Interested?
Do you want to further your career as a Project Lead Analytics. We would love to help you achieve this goal by focusing firmly on your growth and development. We invest in an environment where you keep learning every day. Our professionals will be there to share their valuable knowledge with you. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to help you grow and excel as a professional.

Based on a 36-hour working week, you can also expect:

a gross annual salary between 44.568 EUR and 75.875 EUR;a thirteenth month and holiday pay;an Employee Benefit Budget (10 % of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out;a personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;flexible working times and location-independent working;personal contributions to a pension scheme of only 3.5%.

Let's meet
Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Project Lead Analytics and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.

Good to know

Apply via the button “Apply now”. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy.Hila Leupen-Turabaz, recruiter would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via hila.leupen-turabaz@rabobank.nl.The application process includes screening. How do you make our customers happy?

Bol.com is changing retail to make daily life simpler for 12 million customers. A mission we take on with 39,000 partners that enrich our retail tech platform with customer-centric propositions. Combined, we offer 33 million articles and achieve peak sales of 700 orders per minute (Black Friday 2020). As those numbers demonstrate, there is a huge amount of data coursing through our organization. But how do we keep our mission-critical infrastructure in top condition so customers, partners and colleagues can take an awesome network for granted?

 The biggest challenge

Managing our network infrastructure is no small feat. And doing this successfully is imperative. The scope ranges from installing, configuring and patching network hardware – downtime is not an option – to conceptualizing future solutions to ensure we keep up with evolving customer demands and facilitate a growing number of customer-partner interactions.

Responsibilities

Your responsibilities as System Network Engineer
  Monitor, manage and continually improve the networking infrastructure of our extensive data center   Apply the same TLC to the network infrastructure of our highly mechanized and automated fulfillment centers #keeptheordersflowing   Participate in a standby schedule to ensure uptime of mission-critical hardware    Install and configure the necessary hardware, ensuring everything is up to the highest standards (more specifically, yours)   Contribute to discussions on structural improvements and help envision the networking infrastructure of the future

As System Network Engineer, you manage the network infrastructure that keeps our fulfillment and data centers up & running. 24/7. Without hiccups. It should go without saying that this is an incredibly impactful role. And a daunting one at that. After all, the scale is huge. Take our warehouses: our two main fulfillment centers have a combined footprint of several soccer fields. We opened another warehouse on top of that for the XL flow (think: TVs, outdoor kitchens, et cetera), and we’re in the process of building and opening even more assets. This entire infrastructure has to run flawlessly, and the same goes for the data that flows between these locations, our data centers, the cloud and HQ. It’s up to you to realize those ambitions. With a great sense of autonomy and ownership. And on-premise. Can you ensure bol.com is live 24/7/365?

 3 reasons why this is(n’t) for you
  Yes, if you have a solid IT background, especially in the networking domain   Yes, if you consider IP protocols, Wi-Fi, BGP, OSPF, MPLS, VXLAN, EVPN and Linux to be family members. And scripting / puppet close acquaintances.   Yes, if you’re fine with working at different locations: a driver’s license comes in handy    No, if you stick to what you know and don’t handle change very well   No, if you shy away from ownership when mistakes can have huge consequences   No, if you value your 9-5 mentality and expect issues to accommodate to that

 Where you’ll work

Network Engineer Maarssen - Netherlands        
Are you someone with extensive knowledge of, and extended experience in Network Infrastructures? Are you CCNP certified? Are you proactive and do you take initiative? Then you are the one we are looking for to join our team as a Network Engineer!
Fujitsu is looking for a Network Engineer who wants to be part of the Network team at Fujitsu. Together with your 19 colleagues you manage, maintain, monitor, and handle (major) incidents of the network infrastructure of Fujitsu’s clients. This management is either remotely at home, our office in Maarssen, or at the client’s location. You advise the client in relations to connectivity, firewalls, switching, routing and more. You take ownership of the client’s problems and escalate or gain support where necessary, to fix it. You know how to handle incidents, proactively take action when you see issues arising and you proactively offer improvements for the operational processes of the team. Together with other Fujitsu and/or 3rd party and customer teams, (e.g. infrastructure (Citrix), workplace, security, …) you participate in projects, make your own low level designs, next to your maintenance tasks.
What is in it for youFujitsu is currently one of the few IT Solutions partners in EMEIA that offers its full range of products and services next to solutions and products of partners. The IT solutions that Fujitsu has to offer are developed with our long-term vision in mind; Human Centric, innovative, eco-friendly and state of the art.Furthermore, Fujitsu is Microsoft Gold Partner and leading in Digital Workplaces.
When you join our team we offer you a attractive salary and secondary benefits, such as a variable bonus scheme and the possibility to obtain a lease car. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Top Employer Nederland 2020 Certification! www.top-employers.com/en/companyprofiles/nl/fujitsu-technology-solutions-b.v/
Do you have what it takes?As a Network Engineer you have proven experience in working with Netscaler, Azure Networking, Checkpoint, Cisco Meraki and/of NAC 802.1x. You are used to work with ITIL and Scrum. CCNP certification, or similar level of working and thinking is a must. Additionally, you have great analytical skills and the ability to take ownership. As a person you are responsible, and a team player with great communication skills and a good sense of humor. On top of that you have excellent Dutch and English language skills.Do you recognise yourself in the above profile? Apply now as we would love to meet you!

Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment and pharmaceutical products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the key emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing in Europe and the USA.

Group's key figures are approx. 3.8 billion Euros turnover, over 800 laboratories across 47 countries and about 45,000 staff.

Job Description
A senior technical resource within the team who can manage complex networks including datacentres.Contributing to day-to-day network issues, including managing Critical issues to resolution and adjusting to priority requests to support the Business requirement.Conducting Network audit in the current environment to identify the gaps and challenges in the technology, team expertise, process, documentations etc. and deploying the service improvement plan.Supporting during the technical escalations / elevated support for maintaining service level agreements.

University Degree in Information Technology or comparable field or relevant work experience in Information Technology (min. 10 years plus)Strong Communication Skill required in English (Verbally and Writing)Minimum 10 years working in Information Technology with experience or specialization in:High Skills and Extensive knowledge of networking and datacenter technologies, switching, routing, VoIP and high availability using Cisco componentsHigh skills and extensive in a geographically diverse environment of LAN / WAN / WLAN topologies, Proxies, Load Balancers and Network security technology especially:

Job Description:
Vacature van StackOps, locatie Den Bosch.

Ben jij een netwerk professional met internationale ambities? Ligt jouw passie bij het ontwerpen, opzetten configureren en monitoren van gecompliceerde netwerkomgevingen? En ben jij toe aan een nieuwe baan met veel uitdaging bij een topbedrijf?

Wat ga je doen?

Binnen dit bedrijf zal jij als netwerk specialist deelnemen aan het netwerkteam. Het team bestaat uit 3 man die op hun beurt weer deelnemen aan het It operations team. Tijdens het werken zal je verschillende werkzaamheden vervullen. Hierbij kun je denken aan het maken van low & high level designs. Daarnaast zal je deze netwerkplannen gaan implementeren en aan de hand van changes het bestaande netwerk configureren. Jij laat jouw expertise op netwerkvlak blijken door gedegen advies en verfijnde technische oplossingen.

Bij eventuele problemen binnen het bedrijfsnetwerk lever jij de 2e/3e lijn support. Daarnaast stel jij de benodigde documentatie op die past bij de verschillende normeringen waaraan het bedrijf moet voldoen. Uitvoerend maak jij de vertaalslag van IT naar Business.

Op technisch vlak heb jij inhoudelijk veel kennis van Cisco apparatuur daarnaast, daarnaast zal je ook gaan werken met HP en Palo Alto producten. Met minimaal 3 jaar ervaring ben jij als een vis in het water wat betreft routers, switches, datacenter, wireless én software defined netwerken.

Je werkt snel, accuraat en bent proactief. Je kan goed zelfstandig aan de slag, maar kan ook de lijnen binnen jouw team uitzetten. Hierbij draag je met een goede afstemming bij aan het succes van de organisatie.

Wie ben je?

 Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Network Engineer Kennis van Cisco (must), Palo Alto (Pre)

Wat mag je verwachten?

 Salaris indicatie tussen de €2.500.- en €4.800,- Bonusregeling Flexibele werktijden (Thuiswerken kan in overleg!) Informele werksfeer Interessante doorgroeimogelijkheden En natuurlijk een uitdagende technische omgeving

Waar ga je werken?

Deze opdrachtgever in omgeving Den Bosch is op zoek naar een ervaren netwerk professional die in een snel opererende organisatie verantwoordelijk wordt voor de globale netwerkinfrastructuur. De organisatie is een internationale partij die als logistiek dienstverlener topbedrijven zoals Amazon op hun wenken bedient. Het bedrijf heeft wereldwijd meer dan 20 locaties en is een echte marktleider. De organisatie schakelt snel en is continu in beweging. Momenteel zijn zij dan ook bezig met een flinke uitbreiding van hun IT-landschap.

Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op met: Joost van Huizen | tel: 070 - 2 197 197 / |

At Iron Mountain we protect what our customers value most, from the everyday to the extraordinary, while helping them bridge the physical and digital world. Our people have the opportunity to bring their creativity to a workplace that thrives on change. Here, you will be part of a team that doesn’t just embrace what’s exceptional. It creates exceptional.

Iron Mountain data center services include dedicated data centers, private data center suites, secure cages, individual cabinets, carrier-neutral network interconnection services, remote hands and more. For more than 30 years, discerning colocation customers have chosen Iron Mountain data center services as the safe choice based on our proven track record in client service excellence, established reputation in security & compliance leadership, maximum efficiency, and predictable results. Visit for more information.

We are looking for a Global Network Operations Center Specialist in our team based in the Haarlem office.

Job Summary

The Iron Mountain Data Center Global Network Operations (GNOC) team is seeking technically talented, customer service experienced and driven individual to join our Global Network Operations (GNOC) team. The GNOC Specialist is the first level of customer support, facility monitoring, Incident support and escalation. The Specialist must understand customer service etiquette, follow documented process and procedure, take a proactive approach towards system monitoring, incident reporting, and resolution, while maintaining service level agreement (SLA) and operation level agreement (OLA) timelines.

Primary (P) or Secondary (S)

Key Responsibilities
Provides Level 1 support to internal and external customers with a high degree of customer service, quality and expertise via phone, chat, email, tickets. Monitor local and remote colocation facilities resources including electrical equipment, compute and network infrastructure equipment and network monitoring applications. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following activities: Intake customer calls and requests via phone, chat, email, ticketsMonitor local and remote data center colocation infrastructure environments, reacting appropriately to ensure disruption is avoided or minimizedMonitor compute and networking infrastructure, reactive appropriately to ensure disruption is avoided or minimized Support basic troubleshooting for end users experiencing ticketing portal access issuesTriage and/or disseminate service requests based on ticket management workflows and documented proceduresMonitor and support cross-functional procedures, tools and systems for the detection of incidents, expedient impact assessment, proper assignment and escalationMaintain working knowledge of customer confidentiality and security best practices Responsible for 24-hour operational support and on call rotation or emergency coverage.

Functional Knowledge, Skills, And Competencies
Must be able to multitask effectively during busy times, exercise patience and professionalism during stressful situationsAbility to build and maintain effective working relationships in a matrix environment through effective communication to coordinate with fellow GNOC Specialists for daily issues, reported Incidents and encourage team work.Candidate should possess strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with a variety of entities at all levels and across all functions of the organizationExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to effectively prioritize tasks and documented procedures to support internal OLAs, customer requests, monitoring alarms receivedProblem solving abilityAbility to escalate complex issues to the appropriate resource; ability to follow established escalation procedures. Ability to work effectively in a fast pace and changing environment. Comfortable working both independently and as part of a remote team. Customer advocate with strong customer service experienceMust have the ability to take a proactive approach to key responsibilities while exercising the ability to independently make decisions "on the fly"Must have critical thinking skills and the ability to take logical approaches to problem solvingMust possess the ability to work with or without direct supervision and follow documented proceduresMaintain a working knowledge of technical and functional responsibilities of an IT Service Desk and of general data center operationsProactive communications skills to support remote team work and coordinationWorking knowledge of common operating systems and software applications (including G-suite)Must be able to work in a 24X7 shift environment with a flexibility to work diverse schedules

Our Offer

We offer good salary and benefits, like a free lunch provided for you every day at the office, an attractive pension scheme and discount on your health insurance, combined with outstanding career development opportunities.
Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter today.

Iron Mountain is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. Job Description:
NETWORK FINANCE MANAGER – FOODS EUROPE

Location: Rotterdam - Weena
Local terms and contract apply

Function: Finance Business Partnering

Schedule: 100%, full time

Travel: Up to 20%

About Unilever

Unilever is one of the world`s largest Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) businesses, with interest across Personal Care, Homecare, Refreshment and Foods product categories. We make products that people love – and that make a difference. Nutritious foods. Household care essentials. Indulgent ice creams. Refreshing teas. Luxurious shampoos. Affordable, disease-combating soaps... and many more. In fact, we make around 400 much-loved brands including global brands such as Knorr & Dove, but also local brand such as Calvé (the Netherlands) and Suave (the Americas). Shoppers buy them in more than 190 countries. That means you’ll find at least one of our products in seven out of ten households on the planet. And we want every one of those products to make a positive impact on the lives of the people who buy them.

We want our business to flourish, and we know that our success depends on others flourishing around us. That's why our purpose is to make sustainable living commonplace, and why sustainable, long-term growth is at the heart of our business model.

Purpose Of The Role

European Supply Chain organization is at the core of the European Operational Model. Through its significant factory footprint in Europe, the regional Supply Chain supplies the four European Performance Management Units (EU PMUs) as well as a variety of other Unilever Units and 3rd party customers. Foods contribute roughly 40% to Unilever turnover in Europe

Based in Rotterdam and reporting into Foods Finance Director, Network Finance Manager for Foods is responsible for managing the production costs across the manufacturing network.

Key Priorities For The Incumbent Are
Performance Management: Manage and optimize >EUR 300M production cost across Foods factoriesStewardship: Ensure zero control deficienciesChange Programs / Transformation: Finance lead for in full implementation of Change ProgramsMarket insights: Create and enhance market x factory interlock points to drive end to end cost improvementPeople Development: Develop and manage a broad team of factory controllers

The incumbent partners Supply Chain VPs for Foods for key decisions related to manufacturing footprint and production costs management. As part of Category Supply Chain Leadership team, the job provides a great opportunity to work with large number of stakeholders across Manufacturing, Planning, Finance and Markets.

Main Responsibilities

Performance Management
Lead overall category Business Planning for production costsPartner Category Supply Chain VPs to deliver in-year factory financial plansDrive the waste reduction agenda (Zero Based Material Waste, Business Waste) aligned with category strategy/planBe the custodian of monthly performance management rhythm for production costs (actuals, forecast, manage risks and opportunities and drive gap closing plans)Custodian of production CAPEX and other investment plans (including proposals, budgeting, approval, tracking etc)

Change Programs / Transformation
Lead multi-year factory masterplans including and Change ProgramsEnsure On time and in full delivery of in-flight Change ProgramsDrive WCM cost optimization and Run to Standard Finance support as per factory plans

Stewardship
Ensure effective implementation of relevant Financial controls including Fixed Assets, Inventory and IFRS complianceDrive financial control stewardship across site, resulting in zero control deficiencies

Markets Insights
Ensure regular handshake with Categories and Markets to explain key movements in factors impacting production costsHighlight and drive key hotspots requiring joint supply chain and markets efforts in order to drive costs/service optimization (e.g. SKU complexity reduction, Run to Standard/WCM)Custodian of governance of N1 supplier investment tracking

People Development
Manage and develop a broad team of Finance resources across EuropeContinuously energize and motivate the resources to become a highly effective finance team

Experience

JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
We are looking for an experienced Finance Manager for the role.Minimum of 8 years’ experience in Finance, with min. 3-4 years’ experience in a manager role of Supply Chain FinanceWorking experience in a FMCG company or similar industryProfessional finance qualification equivalent to CA, CIMA, ACCADeep understanding of (Unilever) P&L and has experience with the relevant controlling processes.

Leadership Behaviour
Strong business acumen has a natural passion for operations design and business results.Is biased towards actions that have the most tangible and significant impact to the business.High level of flexibility to see the big picture but at the same time courage to deep-dive into specific areas if need arisesAlways on curiosity to continuously peel the OnionAbility to present effectively to senior leaders in the organization and to flex the communication style depending on the audience.Ability to work remotely with numerous stakeholders and to develop with them collaborative relationships.Genuine passion to develop people through mentoring and coaching.Fluent in English, both verbal and written

Why You Should Work For Unilever

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!
A competitive salary package according to role & experienceAttractive short and long term incentivesCompany Pension (Only applicable if based in the Netherlands)Flexible career opportunitiesLibrary full of learning & well-being resources whenever and whereverAn exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen

Excited About The Role

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

Disclaimer

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Imagine…
that you are working on innovative data analytics projects that allow the Rabobank to ‘Create a better world together’. You are making a difference each day, because you can put your sound knowledge of analytics together with your abilities to build a team and connect different stakeholders. If you are interested in working in a vibrant environment and like to add value each day by making data and analytics work, read on!

Making a difference

As Project Lead Analytics you are the driving force behind the intelligence and analyses that give Rabobank the leading edge on banking in the Netherlands :

You will be the link between the various stakeholders who are creating data driven solutions. You are a gifted maker of connections with a sound knowledge of advanced data analytics.You are a specialist in innovation with data analytics; With your resourcefulness and strategic views on analytics you can boost the innovation through analytics in the stakeholders’ team. You know what is needed to bring a analytics idea to production. This could range from improving the current service level to development of an innovative and new data driven business model.You are an actively involved foreman in a small multi-disciplinary team with roles such as data scientists and data engineers.You are an experienced analyst; You will be translating the requirements and goals of different stakeholders within the bank to advanced analytics solutions.You are able to create a broad support base for innovation with analytics. You will be pitching new ideas or presenting newfound insights or progress to different parties within the bank, from executive management to your colleagues;You will be working in an environment with a state-of-the-art Data lab.The analytical solutions of your team could be implemented in the banking app or online banking environment and are used by millions of people and businesses in the Netherlands; Your team might also be responsible for the design and build of a custom made front end for our colleagues.You will take an active role in knowledge sharing and project reviews to develop the ambitious team that you are part of.

With you
Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our Data Science & Business Consulting team works together to support the whole organisation with analytical solutions. With you as a Project Lead Analytics, the team consists of 45 colleagues in a variety of roles, including: Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Platform Engineers.

Robey, Business consultant: ‘I am leading data-driven projects within an innovative environment following a successful way of working. This gives me the opportunity to learn new things day in day out applying the newest techniques and using the customer as a starting point. We make sure all developed products solve a specific need or problem or are contributing to our goal to be the front-leader in advanced analytics’.

Eelco, Business consultant : “What I like best as Business Consultant is that you have a broad role with many responsibilities. For a large part you are translating business situations towards analytical solutions and are challenging the status quo. You are aligning data scientists and business representatives and should have the capabilities to design the best solution fit for purpose. Next to that you are end responsible for the projects that you run. We have a young and dynamic team and that makes this a great place to work.”

With your talent

A successful Project Lead Analytics has solid experience in the field of advanced data analytics, but is in the same time of an entrepreneurial nature; result-oriented and a bridge-builder. Hence it is important that you meet the following characteristics:

A completed Master’s Degree in a relevant field.5+ years proven experience in the field of advanced data analytics.
Up to date experience with prediction models, analysis and research methods and modern data- and IT-architecture.Experience on a senior level in initiation, management and implementation of complex analytics products in a large corporate with multi-disciplinary teams.Strong consulting skills. Excellent presentation and advisory skills. Focus on innovation. You have proven experience in initiating innovation in a complex environment.Excellent social skills. Strong ability to manage people and motivate, inspire and coach them. You are able to build a network inside and outside Rabobank, where you are seen as an authoritative specialist on successful analytic products.Entrepreneurial and can do mentality.Fluent in English, both verbally and in writing;Advanced proficiency in Dutch is considered an advantage.

Growing a better world together
You might already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 8.5 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a Better World Together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

We make sizeable annual investments in the voluntary sector in the Netherlands. This allows us to support about 1,250 sport and cultural organizations that are a second home to many people.We provide 500 million Euros in financing to the Dutch education sector annually because, after all, good education is the bedrock of tomorrow’s societyWith the Rabobank Foundation, we support social enterprises. This gives people experiencing barriers entering the labor market the opportunities they deserve, and helps them to participate fully in our society

Interested?
Do you want to further your career as a Project Lead Analytics. We would love to help you achieve this goal by focusing firmly on your growth and development. We invest in an environment where you keep learning every day. Our professionals will be there to share their valuable knowledge with you. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to help you grow and excel as a professional.

Based on a 36-hour working week, you can also expect:

a gross annual salary between 44.568 EUR and 75.875 EUR;a thirteenth month and holiday pay;an Employee Benefit Budget (10 % of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out;a personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;flexible working times and location-independent working;personal contributions to a pension scheme of only 3.5%.

Let's meet
Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Project Lead Analytics and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.

Good to know

Apply via the button “Apply now”. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy.Hila Leupen-Turabaz, recruiter would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via hila.leupen-turabaz@rabobank.nl.The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.We want to use your talent in the broadest sense and would like to look at your response more broadly than this vacancy. Your profile will be included in the Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. If you object to this, you can indicate this by e-mail at data.analytics@rabobank.nlThe application process for this vacancy may include an individual assessment.Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link.Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

Description

Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching? Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we’re just getting started changing the way millions of people around the world enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals Series such as the multi-award-winning The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan, The Boys; UK-produced hit Amazon Original series like Good Omens, The Grand Tour, All or Nothing: Manchester City and forthcoming drama series The Power; exclusive TV shows like Star Trek: Picard, American Gods and Vikings; and movies like Late Night and Get Duked, plus live sport including ATP and WTA Tour and US Open Tennis and Premier League football.

Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon’s Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights.

We are seeking an experienced, dynamic and self-motivated Executive for our Originals team in Amsterdam. In this position you will support the sourcing, development and execution of original productions, reporting into the Head of European Originals. You will leverage your experience as a producer and/or commissioner in both development and production, along with a deep knowledge of the creative and business issues involved in bringing new projects from idea to launch.

You will support pitches and review material to deliver informed and productive feedback. You will be joining a dynamic, creative and fast-paced team, bringing an in-depth knowledge of the Dutch TV landscape to support multiple projects in development and production, as well as a high volume of submissions.

Responsibilities
 Work with stakeholders to help hire the local team across all business areas (BA, Legal, Finance, Creative etc) Work with the senior studios team to execute the content strategy for the Netherlands. Support the development and production pipeline of Dutch Originals Creating mechanisms and processes in order to be operationally excellent in the territory. Act as a local point of contact and support for the Dutch creative community (production companies, talent etc.) Cultivate new creative relationships in the marketplace as a representative of Amazon Studios. Assess proposals and pitches, making recommendations on submissions to enter into development and providing feedback. Collaborate with Production, Legal and Business Affairs to secure production and talent for original programming. Play a key role in ensuring the Dutch Originals team execute the Studio’s vision and goals. Manage production of new programmes from inception to launch, interacting with key stakeholders internally and externally during the process. Attend weekly business, development and production meetings as required.

Basic Qualifications
 Experience working with other departments such as production, research, PR, casting, business and legal affairs Experience in executing against a content strategy and delivering results. Experience overseeing all creative aspects of development production and post production Experience as a creative executive Experience as a producer and/or developer and/or commissioner of premium unscripted television programming Series Producer, Executive Producer, Commissioning Editor-level (or equivalent) or above. Fluent in Dutch and English
Preferred Qualifications
 In-depth understanding of the Dutch unscripted marketplace, creative trends and the television landscape Broad network of creators, including on and off-screen talent Experience collaborating with high-level on and off-screen talent Passion for creating innovative, diverse programming Extensive experience across several areas of unscripted production/development/commissioning. These might include documentary, entertainment, fact-ent, specialist factual, events and/or formats Familiarity with SVOD or OTT video services Excellent communication and writing skills
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Titel
Network Specialist
Organisatie
Defensie beschermt wat ons dierbaar is. Militairen verdedigen Nederland, de (economische) belangen en bevriende landen. Ze komen op voor anderen en ondersteunen bij rampen. Zo draagt Defensie bij aan vrede, vrijheid en veiligheid in de wereld. Kijk op de website van Defensie voor meer informatie hierover.
Functie eisen
Minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare ervaring binnen het aandachtsgebied netwerken en security Beschikt over minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met netwerk architectuur Beschikt over minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met Netwerk Monitoring Kandidaat heeft goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift, niveau B2 Kandidaat heeft kennis van ICT netwerk en security vraagstukken Kandidaat beschikt aantoonbaar over CISCO CCNA en CCDA kennis, opgedaan middels gecertificeerde trainingen Kandidaat heeft kennis van van netwerkbeveiligingsstandaarden en methodieken Minimaal 2 jaar kennis van en ervaring met: Palo Alto, Checkpoint, Cisco, Fortinet, ArcSight, EleasticSearch, Splunk, Snort, Suricata, Bro/Zeek, Moloch, RSA NetWitness

Wensen
Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare werkervaring met Hoog gerubriceerde informatiesystemen Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare werkervaring binnen het Ministerie van Defensie Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare kennis van Netwerk architectuur; kunnen maken en toepassen Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare kennis van het opstellen van high level designs voor netwerk infrastructuren Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare kennis van en ervaring met het optimaliseren van netwerkverbindingen bij smalbandige WAN links

Achtergrond opdracht
Voor een landelijke netwerkupgrade is Defensie op zoek naar een ervaren netwerkspecialist. Daarnaast zal een SIEM implementatie tot de opdracht behoren

Projectnaam: Netwerkupgrade

Achtergrond Opdracht

Een landelijk netwerk zal worden geupgrade. Hierbij worden veel locaties (bijv. Eibergen, Burum, Den Helder) aangedaan binnen Nederland. Dit zal niet zeer frequent zijn. Het houden van sitesurveys, opstellen van rapportages en het doen van verbetervoorstellen maken hier onderdeel van uit. Daarnaast zal een SIEM implementatie voor het netwerk worden uitgevoerd.

Organisatorische Context En Cultuur

Een professionele IV/ICT-organisatie, die de Defensieonderdelen en andere klanten binnen de overheid faciliteert in het effectief en doelmatig kunnen (blijven) uitvoeren van hun taken. Als organisatie staat de BS voor betrouwbare, beveiligde IV/ICT-diensten die marktconform zijn wat betreft techniek en prijs. Medewerkers binnen de BS werken samen en delen kennis, vanuit het besef dat alleen op deze wijze de beste kwaliteit kan worden geleverd.

Bijzonderheden / Extra Toelichting

Voorbehoud 1. De mogelijkheid bestaat dat de kandidaat na verloop van tijd voor vergelijkbare werkzaamheden in een ander project of context wordt ingezet. In beginsel streven wij er naar dat de standplaats in een dergelijk geval niet wijzigt.

Job Description:
Always wanted to be part of a winning team, continuously develop yourself and be part of projects that makes a difference for our clients on a global scale? If you are, then Accenture can provide the best opportunities for you to grow and learn. As one of Accenture Network Junior Consultants you will be supporting our clients in their journey to become true digital disrupting businesses with the latest technology to release the ‘New’.

Your job

As Network Junior Consultant you will help Accenture clients transforming their networks and IT infrastructures to quicker, more robust, more efficient and simpler technologies to respond to evolving needs. We are ambitious to create a digital strategy with Software Defined and Cloud Networking solutions to disappear limitations of legacy services.

In our team you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career path on technical skills or functional roles. You’ll have numerous opportunities to grow and develop with technology training and certification programs.

Key responsibilities may include:


Network Optimization and Transformation for WAN, LAN and Wireless Networks

Network Assessment, Design and Implementation

Network Security and Automation

Cloud and Software-Defined Networking

Working with Agile and DevOps frameworks

Your Team

Accenture Technology leverages design thinking, industry insights and the latest digital methodologies to help clients innovate, grow and improve their businesses. Our expertise, capabilities and experience mean that our clients (including some of the biggest brands in the world) trust us to find the right solutions for their needs.

Together with our talented international colleagues, we focus on connecting the needs of businesses with the new possibilities that come with technological progress. Because that's where the real challenges are: inventing and testing things that have never been tried before, getting new applications ready for roll-out, and ultimately guiding clients to select and implement the right technologies to transform their businesses.

Your background


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications Engineering or relevant studies;

Education and /or Trainings in Business management is a plus

0 - 2 years Technical and /or Functional experience in Networking and Telecommunications technologies

Eager to learn and develop skills, analytical, service-minded and you should definitely be a team-player

Interested in client facing roles and projects

Knowledge or experience in Cloud and Infrastructure Services is a plus

Certifications on Routing, Switching, Security and VoIP is a plus otherwise willingness to retrieve these certificates

Certifications on AWS Networking, MS Azure Solutions Architect or Google Cloud Networking is a plus

Fluent in English and Dutch preferably

Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:


A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)

An expense allowance

Discount on Accenture shares

The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?

Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.

Questions? Connect with Maarten Peters via maarten.peters@accenture.com

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Are you insatiably curious? Do you embrace uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from your mistakes? Do you collaborate well with others, knowing that better solutions come from working together? Do you stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve, and are you motivated every day to empower others to achieve more through technology and innovation? Are you ready to join the team that is at the leading edge of Innovation at Microsoft?

As a Specialist, you will be a senior solution sales leader within our enterprise sales organization working with our most important customers. You will lead a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the sales process and achieve/exceed solution sales and usage/consumption targets for related workloads in your assigned accounts. You will help customers evaluate their applications, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction.

To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture. Check out all of our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us.

Responsibilities

The reinvention of business process represents a bold bet for Microsoft in accelerating our growth in commercial cloud services. The mission of Dynamics 365 is to help our customer digitally transform their businesses to drive new sources of revenue, create new and engaging ways to serve their customers, and to transform the way in which their business runs to drive new levels of profitability for their organization.

The Dynamics 365 Specialist is an accomplished sales leader with a proven track record of driving complex digital transformation using Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions in large enterprise accounts that have the highest potential and strategic value.

The Dynamics 365 Specialist leverages advanced business transformation skills honed at management consultancies and their extensive network of C-level customer and industry relationships to consistently exceed quota with multimillion-dollar wins.

The Dynamics 365 Specialist uses their leadership status in industry, professional groups, LinkedIn network, and extended team to create shared visions, influence key stakeholders and lead virtual teams to drive transformation.

Responsibilities
Develop and maintain customer account plans for all the accounts in your designated territory which includes white space analysis, current customer solution and technology footprint/landscape, customer pains, competitive landscape, and industry trends.Develop deep trusted adviser relationships with Business Decision Makers by actively understanding customer business pains, requirements, strategic growth objectives, industry trends and providing business-value-outcome-based solutionsDevelop, maintain, and document comprehensive business plans resulting from joint customer planning and discovery workshops which address customer strategic priorities for digital transformationDiscover, assess, evaluate, and challenge strategic customer objectives by translating them into digital transformation opportunities that leverage Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM), Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (ERP), Microsoft PowerApps and Microsoft Power Automate.Create and drive demand for qualified digital transformation opportunities in our enterprise accounts that can benefit from running their business on Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM), Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (ERP), Microsoft PowerApps and Microsoft Power Automate.Address key change scenarios with quantifiable business value outcomes and justificationDevelop and lead account strategy in the sophisticated and complex business environments of our enterprise accountsBe a disciplined operator by maintaining a rolling pipeline, keeping it current and in accurate stages. Leverage marketing, inside sales, partners and your relationship network to build pipelineSupport and leverage all sales promotions, sales events and sales strategies to close opportunitiesDevelop, drive, manage and lead a discipled opportunity execution plan with a diverse pursuit team of experts, SMEs, pre-sales resources and partners geographically dispersed and virtual both internal and external to Microsoft including our Global Systems Integrator partnersCreate compelling business value outcome backed proposals, negotiate terms and contracts with successful close.Own and deliver on revenue targets for Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, Microsoft PowerApps and Microsoft Power Automate for your territory/accounts

Qualifications
1+ years of experienceSolution sales for CRM and ERP or similar business applicationsSelling software-as-a-service or cloud-based CRM and ERP business applications to enterprise customers.Digital transformation management consulting experience with leading international firmsDeveloping demand for multimillion-dollar digital transformation opportunities in Large enterprise accountsDeveloping and leading account strategy and opportunity execution plans in complex business environments in large enterprise account targetsDriving and leading sales processes across account planning, opportunity planning, deal negotiation, customer decision frameworks, evaluation plans and engaging in sophisticated business case discussions.carrying and exceeding sales quotas by driving and closing enterprise dealsProposal preparation, negotiating terms and contracts for large multi-million-dollar digital transformation opportunitiesSenior level pursuit leadership varied experience in selling CRM business applications with a strong track record of new account development, territory building and quota performanceAssessing strategic customer objectives, digital transformation opportunity discovery, key improvement scenarios, and an ability to measure and present incremental and new economic valueLeading, partnering and orchestrating with virtual teams of experts, SMEs composed of industry, engineering, solution, technical, licensing and legal team membersDisciplined operator with demonstrated accuracy in forecasting business and maintaining CRM pipeline hygieneCertification and / or deep experience in business value sellingDemonstrated passion and commitment to customer success Fluency Dutch and English preferred.

Deep Understanding Of
Business solutions, ERP & CRM and how they translate into business impactThe security, regulatory & compliance needs of global customersWorking knowledge of Microsoft’s commercial cloud offerings - including Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Azure.Competitors and related ecosystem

Desired Skills
Demonstrated success in large multimillion-dollar pursuits, multi-year engagements and competitor disruption and displacementProven consultative business management consulting skills, including the ability to articulate a clear, concise return on investment value statementProven solution envisioning skillsAccount planning and execution leadership skillsAbility to sell C-Level and across both IT and business units as a trusted advisorAbility to sell both an application and deployment of a platformStrong time management skills - able to maintain a high level of productivity, manage multiple competing priorities, and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a fast-paced, complex, collaborative, and team-oriented environmentExcellent organizational agility, able to coordinate across multiple stakeholders: Marketing, Engineering, Licensing, Legal, Field leadership to winAbility to identify and prioritize opportunities that will drive digital transformation for a clientAbility to position long term strategic solutions vs. the competitionProblem solver and ability to work in fast-changing environment and manage ambiguity
