Job Title: Commercial Bank International - EMEA Network Group – Analyst - Amsterdam
Job Description:
Job Description

About Commercial Bank International

The EMEA CBI is part of the Commercial Bank at JPMorgan Chase that focuses solely on European subsidiaries of US companies with whom we have a banking relationship in the US, and who require traditional banking services in Europe, Middle East and Africa. Our competitive advantage is that we cover this market through a partnership with our global bankers who build relationships with our clients and offer customized financial solutions. This approach brings together integrated banking solutions ranging from cash management to raising capital and structuring complicated financial solutions. Other products that we provide include loan syndications, working capital financing, asset based financing, derivatives and foreign exchange.

About The Team

The EMEA networt team is a group of talented indiviuals that focus on serving the core portfolio of clients in Commercial Bank International. Many of our clients have a single point of contact in the EMEA region who works closely with their US counterparts, along with the JPM International Product Specialists in the US, to determine the best global treasury solutions. The Network team’s objective is to act as a valued relationship manager helping the client to navigate J.P. Morgan. Network ICEs work to incubate key future clients of the firm as they grow and as their businesses change; the aim is to ensure that these clients see J.P. Morgan is a valued advisor and first point of contact for new business. Network is a large portfolio representing around 80% of the clients in CBI EMEA and annual revenues in excess of $80mm.

Role Overview

This position will be primarily focused on: servicing the specific cash management needs of the bank’s existing network clients; relationship management; helping our colleagues to manage on-boarding & ramping of new business mandates from clients; as well asworking in close partnership with US origination teams i.e. International Product Specialists (IPSs), US Bankers (Corporate Client Bankers & Middle Market Bankers) and other Product Specialists from across the Firm to identify and support the broader banking needs and requirements of CB clients.

The Network Analyst will work with professionals across the business and within the broader bank as (s)he manages relationships with Middle Market or Corporate Client Banking Bankers & clients.

This Position Represents An Excellent Opportunity For Candidates To
 Gain exposure to solving client issues and relationship management Develop expertise in managing cross region client dialogue and how to have difficult client conversations Negotiation, client sales and credit skills Build knowledge of commercial treasury management products and services

Key Responsibilities

Core functional responsibilities and expectations include but are not limited to the following:
 Client coverage of a defined portfolio of names Execute on the regional Network client strategy for uncovering future opportunities (Incubate/Grow Clients) alongside providing robust relationship coverage of clients where we hold their entire EMEA wallet (Defend Clients) In partnership with key stakeholders, conduct a semi-annual review of your respective Network portfolio to ensure appropriate coverage and knowledge of opportunities Key contact and escalation point for all portfolio matters Thorough understanding of Know Your Customer responsibilities, importance and requirements, and the ability to apply these principles to entire portfolio of assigned clients Reporting directly to the CB EMEA Network Regional Executive

Qualifications

Candidates interested in becoming a full-time employee with the CBI:
 Degree level qualification and relevant experience in Treasury Services sales, corporate relationship management, or portfolio management with proven problem solving experience are preferred Broad commercial banking product knowledge and/or experience would be an advantage – cash management, payment FX, overdrafts and traditional trade products etc. Knowledge of treasury services products a clear advantage Excellent communication skills both written and verbal Excellent organizational, planning, problem solving, time management and analytical skills are required Attention to detail Strong teamwork abilities Ability to multi-task and manage competing prioties to meet deadlines and exceed expectations. Self-starter with a strong work ethic and desire to learn. English is essential, Dutch, Spanish and Italian are preferred. Demonstrated, consistent professional presence with the ability to adapt to evolving needs and situations

About Us

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Organization

Commercial Banking is focused on helping our clients succeed and making a positive difference in our communities. We provide credit and financing, treasury and payment services, international banking and real estate services to clients including corporations, municipalities, institutions, real estate investors and owners, and nonprofit organizations.

Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek

 Create the most innovative security solutions for our stores and online platforms to shape tomorrow’s retail.

As our Domain Security Officer within the Global Support Office, you become an important part of the Global Information Security Advisory Department. There you will work as a Domain Security Officer at Albert Heijn, Etos or Gall & Gall under the banner Ahold Delhaize. You make sure our customers get and optimal and smooth customer experience in our stores and online, whilst safeguarding their data and our systems. You will also work on groundbreaking innovative services such as our online shopping experience, mechanization of our distribution centers and in-store innovations, such as securing the hardware for our tap-to-go service.

As Domain Security Officer, make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by
 Advising on innovative security solutions for Albert Heijn and our global organization .  A dvising on the centralization of our security controls.  W orking closely with our other Security Experts of the Global Cyber Security Teams.  C onducting and facilitating security reviews .  Being the First Point of Contact for almost all security-related topics. The platform security consultant will act as the conduit to expertise available within the ISO (Information Security Office) team.  Formally assessing information security risks related to solution / business projects, determine the potential impact of those risks, and conduct follow-up, throughout the project lifecycle, on any necessary remediation efforts.  Working hand in hand with DevOps teams (developers, architects, product owners, business) to serve the platform’s requirements and ISO requirements to ensure that the security posture is in line with the risk appetite and threat landscape.  Conducting initial and ongoing formal assessments of information security risks related to vendors, determine the potential impact of those risks, and conduct follow-up on any necessary remediation efforts.  Developing a specialized knowledge of and key relationships with the local brand, ensuring that security is imbedded in each brand and that their security needs are being met. Collaborate with other team members to identify opportunities for implementing common security solutions.
 Your new workplace and colleagues
As Domain Security Officer for the Global Information Security Advisory Department, you will be working at Ahold Delhaize. Approximately 370,000 employees worldwide serve over 50 million customers a week. On a somewhat smaller scale, you will be working with 1,500 colleagues in Zaandam, the Netherlands. Occasionally, you visit our other offices in the region. For example, our offices in Brussels, as business requires. By working together to improve every day and through innovation, we reinforce our role as a leader in retail and e-commerce. This is also how we build on trusted local brands. Strong brands that offer a great deal of knowledge, experience, and impact.

You will find your new workplace at our bustling head office, next to Zaandam train station. More specifically, on the 8th floor of the Global Support Office (GSO) in the Global Information Security Department. However, due to COVID-19, we currently still work from home as much as possible.

Everything you do with your colleagues is directly visible in our stores and for people at home.

 Dit bieden we jou

At Ahold Delhaize we want to grow. That is only possible if you grow with us. That is why you can go in all directions with us career-wise and in your personal development. While we work together to build our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours a week)
 A gross monthly salary up to € 6.500,-.  Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home.  A very good pension plan with a personal contribution of 5.3%.  Reimbursement of your travel expenses to and from Zaandam.  20 vacation days.  A personal budget, which you can decide to spend on extra vacation days, discounts or pay-outs.  The possibility to attend training courses at our expense.  A bonus on top of your salary.  Attractive discounts on various insurance policies.  A laptop and telephone.  A 10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per year.  Regularly fun promotions and delicious tastings with free products.

Requirements

At Ahold Delhaize, you’ll be working for one of the biggest retailers in the world. You are bursting with the ambition to keep up with us. And specifically for this vacancy as a Domain Security Officer for the Global Information Security Advisory Department, you are skilled at communication, presentation and stakeholder management. You supplement these skills with
 Master’s or Bachelor’s degree or equivalent technical training in Information Technology, Information Systems Security, Cybersecurity, or related field.  Experience with security architectures such as cloud, mobile, enterprise, web and app security architecture.  Experience with security tests in place to fight off things like code execution, SQL injection and cross site scripting.  Experience with security in cloud computing and microservices architecture.  Minimum 4 years of relevant IT and Information Security experience and you have the ability to act independently with minimal supervision.  Familiarity with security-related legal and regulatory requirements.  Demonstrate specialized knowledge, including data protection methods, in at least one of the following areas and, as required, share this expertise with other team members to facilitate ongoing activities – security architecture, web application security, mobile application security, security in SDLC, cloud security or network security  Be a generalist specialist with a good breath of knowledge across several of security with deep expertise in 2 or 3 areas.  Moderate level in English, Dutch is optional but preferred.

 Dit breng je mee

Seeing is believing. This is true in our stores, as well as in our head office in Zaandam. It could be your new workplace, where you, as Domain Security Officer for the Global Information Security Advisory Department have influence over the most renowned retail markets in the Netherlands. Apply now!

In addition, we would like to ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions
 Why would you like to work for Ahold Delhaize?  Why do you think you will be successful in this position?  Please indicate one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop.
Want to know more before you apply for our role at Ahold Delhaize? René Lepp, Talent Acquisition Partner IT, is happy to tell you everything about this vacancy via .

Zoek jij een baan van 9 tot 5 of die baan waar alles voor je geregeld wordt en bepaald is? Reageer dan niet! Vind jij het wel belangrijk om naast alle gebruikelijke zaken zoals een leaseauto, laptop, mobiel, internet en een goed salaris ook:  ·        Veel vrijheid te hebben bij het invullen van je werkzaamheden?·        Alle ruimte te krijgen jezelf en het team verder te ontplooien?·        In een informele omgeving te werken waar naar je geluisterd wordt?·        Mee te groeien met een snelgroeiende organisatie?
Reageer dan wel! De functie (Junior) Engineer is heel veelzijdig. Je bent actief in alle facetten van de infrastructuur van onze klanten. Je werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit:  ·        Oplossen van storingen bij klanten·        Implementeren nieuwe oplossingen bij klanten·        Changes & updates doorvoeren·        Bijhouden van relevante documentatie·        Jezelf ontwikkelen Wat vragen wij van jou? ·        Ervaring als support engineer of project engineer·        HBO denk- en werkniveau·        Flexibiliteit & doorzettingsvermogen·        Teamspeler·        Klantgericht·        Oplossend vermogen·        Communicatief vaardig·        Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift·        In bezig van een geldig B rijbewijs·        Je bent in staat zelfstandig te opereren, natuurlijk met ondersteuning van het team Over SolidBE:SolidBE heeft uitgebreide ervaring op het gebied van networking en security in verschillende omgevingen, voornamelijk bij Global Enterprises. Wij geloven in een solide en veilige netwerkinfrastructuur die zich aanpast aan de klant zijn organisatie. Innovatie en ICT gaan hand in hand. Wij leveren vernieuwende oplossingen waarmee onze klanten verzekerd zijn van de beste prijs-kwaliteitsverhouding. SolidBE houdt niet vast aan klassieke methoden, maar zoeken altijd naar de beste oplossing van het moment.

Titel
Network Specialist
Organisatie
Defensie beschermt wat ons dierbaar is. Militairen verdedigen Nederland, de (economische) belangen en bevriende landen. Ze komen op voor anderen en ondersteunen bij rampen. Zo draagt Defensie bij aan vrede, vrijheid en veiligheid in de wereld. Kijk op de website van Defensie voor meer informatie hierover.
Functie eisen
Minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare ervaring binnen het aandachtsgebied netwerken en security Beschikt over minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met netwerk architectuur Beschikt over minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met Netwerk Monitoring Kandidaat heeft goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift, niveau B2 Kandidaat heeft kennis van ICT netwerk en security vraagstukken Kandidaat beschikt aantoonbaar over CISCO CCNA en CCDA kennis, opgedaan middels gecertificeerde trainingen Kandidaat heeft kennis van van netwerkbeveiligingsstandaarden en methodieken Minimaal 2 jaar kennis van en ervaring met: Palo Alto, Checkpoint, Cisco, Fortinet, ArcSight, EleasticSearch, Splunk, Snort, Suricata, Bro/Zeek, Moloch, RSA NetWitness

Wensen
Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare werkervaring met Hoog gerubriceerde informatiesystemen Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare werkervaring binnen het Ministerie van Defensie Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare kennis van Netwerk architectuur; kunnen maken en toepassen Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare kennis van het opstellen van high level designs voor netwerk infrastructuren Kandidaat heeft aantoonbare kennis van en ervaring met het optimaliseren van netwerkverbindingen bij smalbandige WAN links

Achtergrond opdracht
Voor een landelijke netwerkupgrade is Defensie op zoek naar een ervaren netwerkspecialist. Daarnaast zal een SIEM implementatie tot de opdracht behoren

Projectnaam: Netwerkupgrade

Achtergrond Opdracht

Een landelijk netwerk zal worden geupgrade. Hierbij worden veel locaties (bijv. Eibergen, Burum, Den Helder) aangedaan binnen Nederland. Dit zal niet zeer frequent zijn. Het houden van sitesurveys, opstellen van rapportages en het doen van verbetervoorstellen maken hier onderdeel van uit. Daarnaast zal een SIEM implementatie voor het netwerk worden uitgevoerd.

Organisatorische Context En Cultuur

Een professionele IV/ICT-organisatie, die de Defensieonderdelen en andere klanten binnen de overheid faciliteert in het effectief en doelmatig kunnen (blijven) uitvoeren van hun taken. Als organisatie staat de BS voor betrouwbare, beveiligde IV/ICT-diensten die marktconform zijn wat betreft techniek en prijs. Medewerkers binnen de BS werken samen en delen kennis, vanuit het besef dat alleen op deze wijze de beste kwaliteit kan worden geleverd.

Bijzonderheden / Extra Toelichting

Voorbehoud 1. De mogelijkheid bestaat dat de kandidaat na verloop van tijd voor vergelijkbare werkzaamheden in een ander project of context wordt ingezet. In beginsel streven wij er naar dat de standplaats in een dergelijk geval niet wijzigt.

Voorbehoud 2. Bij meerdere geschikte kandidaten behoudt de dienst zich het recht voor om meerdere gunningen te doen. Dit zal geschieden op basis van de rangorde in de eindbeoordeling.

In our team you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career path on technical skills or functional roles. You’ll have numerous opportunities to grow and develop with technology training and certification programs.

Key responsibilities may include:


Network Optimization and Transformation for WAN, LAN and Wireless Networks

Network Assessment, Design and Implementation

Network Security and Automation

Cloud and Software-Defined Networking

Working with Agile and DevOps frameworks

Your Team

Accenture Technology leverages design thinking, industry insights and the latest digital methodologies to help clients innovate, grow and improve their businesses. Our expertise, capabilities and experience mean that our clients (including some of the biggest brands in the world) trust us to find the right solutions for their needs.

Together with our talented international colleagues, we focus on connecting the needs of businesses with the new possibilities that come with technological progress. Because that's where the real challenges are: inventing and testing things that have never been tried before, getting new applications ready for roll-out, and ultimately guiding clients to select and implement the right technologies to transform their businesses.

Your background


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications Engineering or relevant studies;

Education and /or Trainings in Business management is a plus

0 - 2 years Technical and /or Functional experience in Networking and Telecommunications technologies

Eager to learn and develop skills, analytical, service-minded and you should definitely be a team-player

Interested in client facing roles and projects

Knowledge or experience in Cloud and Infrastructure Services is a plus

Certifications on Routing, Switching, Security and VoIP is a plus otherwise willingness to retrieve these certificates

Certifications on AWS Networking, MS Azure Solutions Architect or Google Cloud Networking is a plus

Fluent in English and Dutch preferably

Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:


A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)

An expense allowance

Discount on Accenture shares

The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?

Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.

Questions? Connect with Maarten Peters via maarten.peters@accenture.com

Senior Network Engineer (m/v 32-40 uur)
Falco Networks is een in Heiloo gevestigd bedrijf dat, zoals de naam reeds doet vermoeden, gespecialiseerd is in netwerkbeheer (Routing & Switching, SDN), implementatie en troubleshooting. Met onze gedreven organisatie bedienen wij klanten in geheel Nederland, maar bevinden onze klanten zich ook wereldwijd. Van oorsprong ligt onze focus op de Service Provider markt maar is de horizon verbreed richting Enterprises en de Groot Zakelijke Markt (MKB-plus).
Wat bieden wij?﻿Als Senior Network Engineer ben je bij Falco vooral bezig met het ontwerpen, implementeren en uitwerken van nieuwe ontwerpen, het uitvoeren van complexe changes en het oplossen van lastige problemen. Je helpt onze Junior Network Engineers met incidenten en changes en werkt samen met onze Medior Network Engineers aan ontwerpen en projecten.Door de grote verscheidenheid aan klanten, technieken en vendoren ontwerp, bouw en beheer je maatwerk omgevingen die zeer uiteenlopen, maar altijd bedrijfskritisch en interessant zijn. Hierdoor zal je je breed kunnen (moeten!) ontwikkelen en is geen dag hetzelfde.  
De belangrijkste taken die in deze functie naar voren komen zijn:Het maken van high en low level (network) designsSamen met je collega’s werken aan een toekomstbestendige infrastructuur voor onze klantenHet zijn van een gelijkwaardige gesprekspartner van de verschillende partijen waarmee je contact hebt2e lijn 24/7 stand-by diensten draaienPre-sales activiteiten
Wie zoeken wij?
Je hebt HBO of academisch werk- en denkniveauJe hebt minimaal een JNCIP R&S certificaat of eventueel vergelijkbare en aantoonbare kennis.Je hebt ervaring met o.a. Juniper, Extreme en FortinetJe bent ervaring met o.a. BGP, OSPF en MPLSJe bent enthousiast over nieuwe technieken als SDNJe bent bekend met Linux en automatisering (Python is een pré)Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederlands en EngelsJe bent georganiseerd, autonoom maar werkt ook graag in groepsverbandJe hebt minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functieJe beschikt over een rijbewijs type B
Wat bieden wij?
Een stimulerende en uitdagende functie in een ambitieus en groeiend bedrijfEen aantrekkelijk salarisFulltime (minimaal 32 uur) dienstverband met uitzicht op een vast contractEen leaseauto behoort tot de mogelijkhedenDe juiste technische voorzieningenTechnisch innovatieve projecten en klantenEen professionele maar ook informele werksfeerRuimte en aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en eigen initiatief
Durf jij de uitdaging aan?
Voor meer informatie over de vacature bij Falco Networks BV bel je Alan van der Himst op072 – 53 23 744.

Zoek jij een baan van 9 tot 5 of die baan waar alles voor je geregeld wordt en bepaald is? Reageer dan niet! Vind jij het wel belangrijk om naast alle gebruikelijke zaken zoals een leaseauto, laptop, mobiel, internet en een goed salaris ook:  ·        Veel vrijheid te hebben bij het invullen van je werkzaamheden?·        Alle ruimte te krijgen jezelf en het team verder te ontplooien?·        In een informele omgeving te werken waar naar je geluisterd wordt?·        Mee te groeien met een snelgroeiende organisatie?
Reageer dan wel! De functie (Junior) Engineer is heel veelzijdig. Je bent actief in alle facetten van de infrastructuur van onze klanten. Je werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit:  ·        Oplossen van storingen bij klanten·        Implementeren nieuwe oplossingen bij klanten·        Changes & updates doorvoeren·        Bijhouden van relevante documentatie·        Jezelf ontwikkelen Wat vragen wij van jou? ·        Ervaring als support engineer of project engineer·        HBO denk- en werkniveau·        Flexibiliteit & doorzettingsvermogen·        Teamspeler·        Klantgericht·        Oplossend vermogen·        Communicatief vaardig·        Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift·        In bezig van een geldig B rijbewijs·        Je bent in staat zelfstandig te opereren, natuurlijk met ondersteuning van het team Over SolidBE:SolidBE heeft uitgebreide ervaring op het gebied van networking en security in verschillende omgevingen, voornamelijk bij Global Enterprises. Wij geloven in een solide en veilige netwerkinfrastructuur die zich aanpast aan de klant zijn organisatie. Innovatie en ICT gaan hand in hand. Wij leveren vernieuwende oplossingen waarmee onze klanten verzekerd zijn van de beste prijs-kwaliteitsverhouding. SolidBE houdt niet vast aan klassieke methoden, maar zoeken altijd naar de beste oplossing van het moment.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
We are looking for a Junior Network Engineer for Vodafone Group in IJmuiden, Netherlands. This is an ideal beginner position for aspiring Junior Network Engineer.

At Vodafone Group we build connections to all our Global operations, acting as an advisory board to drive consistency and customer excellence across 30 countries and for over 420 million customers. We are constantly uncovering tactics to innovate the way we operate, set our global standards or lead our strategic performance. By joining Vodafone Group, you will be part of evolving our digital world of total communications. Now is the time to get on board.

As we evolve into a truly digital company, Vodafone Group Enterprise uses the power of our Global network, operating companies and partner networks to confidently connect large corporation customers. Across our Carrier Services, Cloud & Hosting, Internet of Things (IoT), Product Management, Security and Sales/Marketing operations we connect and secure organisations in a rapid changing world and empower their people and consumers through our “ready business” total communication solutions. We believe, quite simply, that the answer for any business is to be ready for anything. Are you now ready for your career with us?

Enjoy the challenge
 Support the Netherlands onsite team. Deliver Network Services to IT users that match the business needs and tied to SLA’s. Technically strong in providing support and implementation of network services. Build and manage customer relationships through maintaining an effective infrastructure provision relationship with the Solutions Groups. Support and execute the infrastructure strategy to meet both business needs and lifecycle management requirements. Provide effective and secure network infrastructure that supports delivery of agreed IT services.
You Strengthen

Vodafone Group Enterprise Operations delivers consistent, excellent service to all our 1700 multi-national clients. From designing to delivering extraordinary service that exceeds our customer’s expectations, we lead excellence across all our global markets and customer lifecycle. Under the guidance of our empowered business leader, joining our team you can be part of ensuring our excellence transformation across for all our Enterprise customers.

As a Junior Network Engineer, you could be part of a wider European and India network operational support team, delivering support to the various customer networks. Multiple international sites are supported from all Base Locations. Current equipment includes switching, routing and wireless network technologies configured in many cases with multiple virtual switches using Cisco and Alcatel technologies.

This is how you do it?
 Customer first - Driven by the need to understand and meet the expectations / requirements of customers, both internally and externally. Proactively builds strong relationships across the customer network. Personally builds / maintains strong relationships across the customer network. Managing change - Develops a shared vision and strategy for change. Delivers change whilst managing the interface between “day to day” and improvement projects. Tenacious in the pursuit of change goals. Problem solving & decision making -Defines problems, systematically gathers and analyses data, identifies cause & effects and establishes root causes & achievable solutions. Makes good and timely decisions. Drive for results - Is passionate about and perseveres in the pursuit of challenging stretch goals. Demonstrates energy, drive and enthusiasm when striving to accomplish and improve results. Interpersonal effectiveness - Flexible use of accomplished interpersonal behaviours that facilitate in building trust and engagement amongst others whilst reducing the opportunity for conflict. Willing and able to handle difficult conversations in a positive manner.
You have it in you
 Bachelor/Master degree in Engineering or Computer Sciences Experience in
 Physical network cabling TCP/IP Layer 2 network switching   English speaking and writing You live in the Netherlands, maximum travel distance 30 minutes from IJmuiden in case of issues.
What is the key to our success? It’s simple – our people. Across a Global footprint, we believe we’re at our best when you’re at yours. From our diverse workforce, our flexible working policies to our creative work spaces, we embrace a culture of learning and sharing to develop our next stage growth. It’s in our hearts to push forward, to create a better future, to never rest and find new ways that help people communicate.

We are committed to developing the very best people by offering a flexible, motivating and inclusive workplace in which talent is truly recognised and rewarded. We respect, value and celebrate our people’s individual differences - we are not only multinational but multicultural too. Our excellent flexible benefits programme allows you to choose what’s right for you. Our Vodafone Foundation gives the ability for our people to give something back. We embrace empowering our people to shape their world.

Enjoy The Benefits

Based on a 40-hour work week at VodafoneZiggo, you can count on:
 A gross salary between € 2.249 and €3.212 per month, with potential for growth and an attractive bonus scheme An ambitious employer, who recognizes that when you develop, VodafoneZiggo develops. Which is why we offer education and training opportunities and provide possibilities to take your next career step(s) here, too 20 days paid vacation, with an option to buy up to 40 additional days off You also receive a monthly Benefit Budget of 14,95% of your gross salary; you can use this to put money aside for vacation plans, save up additional sabbatical leave, buy extra days off, or you can simply take the cash. The choice is yours! You get a voucher for a phone, and (of course) a Vodafone subscription to go with it. Which you are also welcome to use for private calls. As an ambassador of our organization, you obviously get discounts on Vodafone and Ziggo products With an eye to your retirement, we offer a pension scheme that also allows you to save for extra retirement income We offer an NS-Business Card of your choice, including the option of a 1st class train pass that you can also use privately If you want, you can work for us part-time Flexibility: work when and where you perform at your best We value social impact. You can take part in several initiatives in this area, during work time. For example the Online Masters program, in which you teach kids how to navigate the digital world responsibly We also offer good (financial) arrangements if you find yourself going through a rough patch, such as our disability plan And we offer discounts on health insurance, sports memberships, day care and more
You do it
Are you in? Now click on the application button and reply.

Any questions? Just call Alexander Wich (recruiter) at: 06- 24927067 or send a message; alexander.wich@vodafoneziggo.com

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
Lead Network Engineer
Groningen

Are you someone with extensive knowledge of, and extended experience in Network Infrastructures? Are you CCNP certified? Are you proactive and do you take initiative? Then you are the one we are looking for to join our team as a Lead Network Engineer!

Fujitsu is looking for a Lead Network Engineer who wants to be part of the Network team at Fujitsu. You work together with 19 colleagues to manage, maintain, monitor, and handle (major) incidents of the network infrastructure of Fujitsu’s clients. This management is either remotely at home, or at the client’s location in the north of the Netherlands. As the senior of this team, you help improve the standards, and take junior engineers under your wing. Furthermore, you work together with the Global Delivery Center of Fujitsu in Poland, to deliver excellent service to Fujitsu’s client. You advise the client in relations to connectivity, firewalls, switching, routing and more. You take ownership of the client’s problems and escalate or gain support where necessary, to fix it. You know how to handle incidents, proactively take action when you see issues arising and you proactively offer improvements for the operational processes of the team. Together with other Fujitsu and/or 3rd party and customer teams, (e.g. infrastructure (Citrix), workplace, security, …) you participate in projects, make your own low level designs, next to your maintenance tasks.

What is in it for you?
Fujitsu is currently one of the few IT Solutions partners in EMEIA that offers its full range of products and services next to solutions and products of partners. The IT solutions that Fujitsu has to offer are developed with our long-term vision in mind; Human Centric, innovative, eco-friendly and state of the art. Furthermore, Fujitsu is Microsoft Gold Partner and leading in Digital Workplaces.
The Netherlands branch of Fujitsu has an independent style and culture although being part of the greater company. With typical no-nonsense se direct communication, strong community sensibility we strive for the family like feeling. With the increasing market share we welcome new colleagues to take part in this growth journey.
When you join our team we offer you a attractive salary and secondary benefits, such as a variable bonus scheme and the possibility to obtain a lease car. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Top Employer Nederland 2020 Certification! www.top-employers.com/en/companyprofiles/nl/fujitsu-technology-solutions-b.v/

Do you have what it takes?
As a Network Engineer you have extensive proven experience in working with Checkpoint, Cisco Meraki, Netscaler, Azure Networking, and/or NAC 802.1x. You are used to work with ITIL and Scrum. CCNP certification, or similar level of working and thinking is a must. Additionally, you have great analytical skills and the ability to take ownership. You have experience in taking the lead in a team. As a person you are responsible, and a team player with great communication skills and a good sense of humor. On top of that you have excellent Dutch and English language skills.
Do you recognise yourself in the above profile? Apply now as we would love to meet you!

About Fujitsu

Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers. Fujitsu’s purpose is to make the world more sustainable by building trust in society through innovation.

We promote a Human Centric Intelligent Society, in which innovation is driven by the integration of people, information and infrastructure. Using a wide portfolio of trusted technology services, solutions and products we are committed to Digital Co-creation; blending business expertise with digital technology and creating new value together. More information: www.fujitsu.com.

At Fujitsu, we empower human difference and as we want the best people on our team, we welcome and encourage applications from people with diverse experiences, backgrounds and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialized clinical diagnostics testing. In 2019, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Job Description

The Network Engineer is primarily responsible for the engineering, configuration, installation, maintenance, and upgrade of networks, routers, switches, firewalls, remote access systems, and network management systems.

Specific Assignments – Key Accountabilities

Service Strategy / Build
Research, evaluate, and recommend networking hardware and software such as routers, switches, firewalls, remote access systems, and network management systems;Design, configure, and implement local & wide area networks (LAN/WAN/WLAN);Own, configure and manage the solutions for load-balancing, end-point protection, VPN (including SSLVPN), VOIP etc.;Design, validate and update Eurofins networking standards;Follow Eurofins Service Management Processes;Contribute to the improvement of Network services’ health.
Service Run / Continuous improvement
Take responsibility for day-to-day network management, including seeing through critical issues to resolution and juggling different priorities to support the Business requirement;Deploy and administer of various network Solutions (Cisco, CheckPoint, etc.);Identify, diagnose, and resolve connection, reliability, or performance issues;Manage technical escalations/provide elevated support to maintain service level agreements;Assist in overseeing the primary activities of individual contributors (L1 Network Engineers) to ensure completion of tasks and attainment of departmental goals;Work with little to no supervision, with latitude for independent judgment;Consult with senior peers on medium to complex projects;Work within and assist with management of defined IT processes and procedures including Systems Development Life Cycle methodology;Follow ITIL methodology, and utilize existing Eurofins policies and procedures;Conduct network audits to identify gaps and challenges in the technology, team expertise, process, documentations etc. and deploy the service improvement plan. Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/IT or similar;Minimum of 3-7 years of experience with Active Directory, DNS, and DHCP;Minimum of 3-7 years of experience with switches/routers, firewalls and related device support;Minimum of 3-7 years of experience with planning and implementing local and wide area networks (LAN/WAN/WLAN);Minimum of 3-7 years of experience with planning and implementing layer 2 network design and protocols (STP, VLAN);Minimum of 3-7 years of experience with planning and implementing enterprise networks with dynamic routing (OSPF, BGP);ITIL Foundation certification is strongly preferred;Eager to learn and continuously develop personal and technical capabilities;Extensive knowledge of networking technologies, switching, routing, VoIP and high availability;Experience with network design/architecture/engineering;Extensive knowledge of LAN / WAN / WLAN (AP, etc.) topologies, Proxies, Load Balancers and Network security (Firewall, VPN);Knowledge of SD-WAN Technology, Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) is preferred;Extensive knowledge of Layer 3 Protocols (BGP, OSPF, MPLS, QOS, etc.);Experience with IPsec, Dynamic and Route Based VPN tunnels, and VPN technologies like IPSEC VPN;Experience in maintaining technical documentation;A deep understanding of ITIL-based processes;Fluent spoken and written English is required;Willingness to travel (up to 30% of working hours).

Additional Information

What We Offer
 An attractive salary package with extra-legal benefits;A permanent position in a dynamic working environment with a good team spirit where personal development and growth are encouraged;The ability to progress and gain increased areas of responsibility (within the Program and the Eurofins Group).

Application

As the role and Eurofins' IT Talent Acquisition team are international, please ensure to send your application in English.

POSSIBLE LOCATIONS FOR THE ROLE:
Barcelona, SpainLeiden, Netherlands

Job Description:
Posted by









            Clifford Haakmeester


            Senior Tech Recruiter @ Solvinity | IT Sourcer | Black Belt Certified | Gamer | Salsa Dancing









        Send InMail






Voor onze klanten en hun uitdagingen ga je behoorlijk de diepte in en heb je technische kennis nodig. Je bent analytisch sterk, kunt het overzicht behouden en bent niet bang om elke dag te leren.
Jij weet alles van Netwerk Engineering en Application Firewalling, IDS/IPS oplossingen en geïntegreerde proxytechnieken en VMware NSX. De vraag is niet of je verder wilt in engineering, maar hoe je dat gaat doen!  Wat doet een Solvineer?De dag van een engineer bij Solvinity is gevuld met uitdagende klantprojecten: een mooie mix van ontwerp, migratie en tweede- en derdelijns beheer. Je werkt in een dedicated klantteam. Binnen dit team zijn we verantwoordelijk voor een nieuw en grootschalig project, waar we een innovatief platform bouwen voor één van de grootste security organisaties in Nederland. Naast het bouwen ligt de focus ook op migratie en onderhoud door middel van automatisering binnen dit nieuwe (container-) platform. Continuïteit en security staan hierbij bovenaan. Binnen dit team help je andere engineers en je leert tegelijkertijd van collega’s die wat meer weten van bijvoorbeeld Linux of Azure. Je wilt je blijven ontwikkelen, zowel in de breedte als de diepte. Bij Solvinity noemen we dat een T-shaped engineer.
Jouw groeiJe draait steeds grotere projecten, die steeds complexer worden en meer impact hebben voor klanten. Je ontwikkelt je verder door de diepte in te gaan met onze klanten, softwareleveranciers en natuurlijk je collega’s. Wij houden je op onze beurt scherp met actuele cursussen en trainingen.
Dit ben jijAls jij als Solvineer dagelijks het verschil wilt maken voor klanten, herken je jezelf helemaal in dit lijstje:
·       Je bent al minimaal 6 jaar Netwerk Engineer in een enterprise/hosting omgeving;Communicatief vaardigHBO-denk- en werkniveauGoede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taalBewezen ervaring met VMware NSXBewezen ervaring met het implementeren van VXLAN-technologieënBrede kennis van LAN-, WAN- en DC-omgevingenKennis van routing- en schakelprotocollen in een zeer beschikbare omgevingKennis en ervaring met Firewall-productenKennis van scripting- en automatiseringstoolsJe voert zelfstandig en (bewaakt, evalueert, continu verbetert) Incident-, Probleem-, Wijzigings- en ConfiguratiebeheerprocessenTechnische implicaties van beveiligings- en risicoprincipes
Over Solvinity  Solvinity een van de grootste aanbieders van Secure Managed IT Services in Nederland. We ondersteunen organisaties met hoge beveiligingseisen in hun digitale transformatie met innovatieve, klantgerichte IT-oplossingen in de cloud, outsourcing, managed hosting en Lango Workspace. Daarnaast leveren we CI/CD, containertechnologie en ‘Stretched’ DevSecOps oplossingen voor softwareontwikkelaars.   Met de nieuwste technologieën transformeren, beheren en beveiligen we bedrijf kritische gegevens en applicaties voor toonaangevende klanten zoals (rijks-)overheid, gemeenten, TNO, TransLink (OV-chipkaart), ING en ONVZ. Zo zorgen wij ervoor dat deze organisaties zich kunnen concentreren op hun kernactiviteiten.  Onze diensten hebben impact op mensen, organisaties, en in veel gevallen onze samenleving. Dit bewustzijn heerst in alles wat we doen. Vanuit onze kernwaarden toewijding, creativiteit, expertise en integriteit bouwen we dagelijks aan een nauwe samenwerking waarin we, samen met onze klanten, blijven groeien. Met ruim 300 Solvineers en vestigingen in Amsterdam, Amersfoort, Assen en Den Bosch behaalden we in 2020 een jaaromzet van 50 miljoen euro.  Kijk voor meer informatie op www.solvinity.nl, of volg Solvinity op LinkedIn en Twitter.
﻿Wat zijn Solvineers?Onze mensen zijn IT-specialisten met een nieuwsgierige, kritische, slimme en coachende instelling. Maar een Solvineer heeft ook soft skills als empathie en teamgeest: we zijn allround teamspelers en hechte collega's. "Nooit stoppen met leren" is ons motto, daarom bieden we Solvineers trainingen, meet-ups en evenementen om op de hoogte te blijven en nieuwe vaardigheden te leren.
Hoe kun je contact met ons opnemen?Passen we bij elkaar? Wil je ons daarvan overtuigen? Bel dan onze recruitmentspecialist Clifford Haakmeester op 020-3643600 of mail hem op recruitment@solvinity.com.

As a part of a global team, our Network Projects Team supports all Global and Local Infrastructure projects worldwide. The team currently consists of 6 project engineers located in the headquarters in Rotterdam and several part time project engineers in regions Americas, Asia and Middle East and China.  The network projects team works closely together with security, operations and architects to translate requirements, policies and standards into detailed implementation designs and support the execution of the projects and handover to operational support. Projects vary from complete greenfield builds of LAN/WAN/Security for new locations and small projects like expansions, life cycle projects, innovation projects, etc.
The projects team is responsible for delivering high quality standards, within budget and planning, offering well skills and experienced engineers on technologies LAN, WAN, Security, VPN, Remote Access, Wifi, PKI, NAC and OT networking.
Globally we support many interesting and sometimes challenging projects, in an environment that is ever evolving and growing. Requirements:The ideal candidate is familiar and able to execute assigned projects in a timely manner within budget and matches the following profile:Demonstrable (minimally 5 year) experience with professional support and projects in a business-critical and preferable international/global LAN & WAN infrastructure.Expert-level experience with network & telecom (LAN/WAN, Wireless LAN, Firewalls, IPSec) is essential (experience with Cisco at CCNA level is a pre, NSE4/NSE7 certification is a pre)Good level of expertise on security (firewalling, NAC & PKIGood administration, documenting and network drawing skillsMotivated to initiate and participate in a team-effort to assess the network infrastructure: actively suggesting technical & support improvements.Comfortable working both on your own, and in cooperation (technically and functionally) with the windows, unix, database, and application support-teams.Interested in improving project-involvement and plan-based workingA strong common-sense approach to IT-support & IT-projects.Familiar with ITIL, project management and IT-security concepts.Enthusiastic team-member, capable of working in (sometimes) stressful and under pressure conditions.Fluent in English and DutchVCA certified or willing to get VCA
What we can offer:Market conform salary depending on skills and experienceBonus opportunityTravel allowance30 holidays on an annual basisCollective Health Insurance (contribution Vopak of 50% of basic package)Vopak’s own pension scheme https://pensioenfonds.vopak.com/We will continuously invest in your personal growth, and future career path within Vopak
Tasks & responsibilities:Create detailed design fulfilling requirements, based on Vopak standards and policiesParticipate in a global operating team, sometimes need to travelLead engineer in assigned projects for approved projectsAlign with architects for design questionsAssist operations team for complex troubleshootingCollaborate on centralised documentation of standardsImplementation/installation of infrastructure solution on-site or remoteConfiguration Templates developmentsCreating Detailed configuration filesUpdating documentation (google maps, visio drawings, fiber layouts in netterrain) Handover to support for completed projectsAnalyze and improve security policies on the firewalls using central managementUpgrade firewalls, switches and other network devicesWilling to travel (not often, but if needed typically 2 weeks) Are you the Senior Network Engineer (Global Projects) that we are looking for?Then apply via the ‘apply’ button. For more information about the vacancy and/or the recruitment process, please contact the recruiter via below contact details.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Are you looking to join a team where you help customers use the latest technology, where you receive innovative training and where you´re empowered to make a difference? Do you put your customers at the center of everything you do? Are you eager to learn to drive the highest technical quality? Do you like to work with best-in-class cloud technologies and do you have a passion to help customers adopt cloud and build solid a cloud foundation?

If so, the Customer Engineer position is for you! We need enthusiastic people to provide technical leadership to our customers. You work at customers in the Netherlands and Europe, both on-site and remotely.

Customer Engineers (CEs) are deep technical advisors supporting and enabling our Enterprise customers with Azure. Using your passion for technology you educate and assists customers to develop and deploy their applications and make sure they run healthy and efficient. You assess their solutions to find potential issues, threats and areas for improvement and work with them to solve these us. When a customer faces significant issues, you step in to use your technical depth to find the cause and suggest a solution.

Responsibilities

You will also be involved in wider Support Execution which means lots of teamwork to help our customers (and your colleagues) to be more successful. Therefore, we look for people who enjoy collaboration and can spot opportunities in their customers for developing even greater business value and grow those customer/partner relationships effectively. Other interesting areas would be to develop awareness of competition, modifying IP and creating new content.

About half your time will be spent in Support Management activities such as spotting performance issues, analysis of customer needs and dealing with any technical issues or problems and solving them. You’ll be part of a larger virtual account team and get to work in partnership with them to strengthen targeted customer relationships and work on immediate and long-term service delivery plans.

With your passion you will motivate others and yourself to drive the vision of changing the world to a better one through the power of the cloud.

With your spirit and your ideas, you will strive to be a role model and help our customers to understand the advantage of the latest technologies and you will help to improve their existing IT-environment.

You will act as an entrepreneur and as an evangelist internally and externally and will drive the value proposition of Azure with every action you take.

Qualifications

We are looking for engineers with an understanding of cloud concepts and technology and experience in supporting optimizing cloud workloads in production. Additional skills in specific cloud related components, like networking, identity, security or automation is a benefit, however the role is specifically targeted for expertise on cloud networking or storage services.

You have or are eager to develop the following skills:
Excellent written, oral and presentation skillsFluent in Dutch and proficient in EnglishExperience in the enterprise customer arena/face-to-face customer engagement skillsConfidence to work with engineering teams and technical decision makersKnowledge about Microsoft Azure solutions and offeringsDiagnosing and troubleshooting IT issues.
To set yourself up for success in this role we are looking for a solid grounding in systems development, network operations, software support or IT consulting, with preferably 1-5 years of working experience.

We believe that everyone can grow and develop. We succeed as a team by sharing knowledge and experience. Don’t worry about what you don’t know; come and show us what you do know, and we will teach you the rest.

Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) or equivalent is desirable.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Industry: ['Information Technology & Services', 'Computer Software', 'Mechanical Or Industrial Engineering']
Job Description:
Van stroomstoringen tot security issues, als Senior Network Engineer heb je het allemaal meegemaakt. Gelukkig blijft het netwerk in jouw beheer stabiel, en zijn complexe incidenten altijd gauw opgelost. Werken met grote gebruikersomgevingen, terwijl je jezelf ontwikkelt bij verschillende bedrijven? Onze opdrachtgevers in de randstad staan om je te springen.
Over deze functie

Als Senior Network Engineer ben jij in control om de gehele infrastructuur draaiende te houden. Je werkt hiervoor zelfstandig aan het configureren, installeren, troubleshooten en het onderhouden en beheren van netwerken, exchanges, routers/firewalls, switches en applicaties. Daarnaast zorg je voor een goede beveiliging van het netwerk en de systemen. Complexe incidenten los je op volgens het ITIL-proces. Daarnaast heb je een signaalfunctie, dus als iets beter kan kom je met verbetervoorstellen. En implementeer je deze ook zelf.

Via Brunel IT werk je zelfstandig of in een team bij bedrijven in de telecom, banken, scholen, ziekenhuizen of overheidsinstellingen. Bij de ene opdrachtgever ben je zelf in het netwerk bezig, bellen klanten jou over netwerkproblemen en los je deze als vanzelfsprekend op. Bij de andere opdrachtgever staan de netwerken extern en heb je vooral telefonisch contact voor het oplossen van tickets. Je projecten zijn hierdoor altijd gevarieerd. En heb je ambities tot Network Designer? Niets is onmogelijk; zeker niet bij Brunel.

Over jou

Ga Even Na Of Je Het Volgende In Huis Hebt

Je gaat nóg meer werk maken van je IT-carrière. Waar begin je.
Een mbo 4-diploma met minimaal vijf jaar werkervaring Een CCNP-certificering of het volledige kennisniveau hiervan Ruime kennis op het gebied van LAN, Wireless of Security Bij voorkeur ervaring met netwerkapparatuur van Cisco of Juniper Evaring met Nextgen-firewalls zoals Checkpoint, Fortinet of Palo Alto

Afgevinkt? Dan kijken we samen naar de rest. Dat ideale bedrijf wacht op je, dat is zeker.

Wat wij bieden

Dit, Onder Andere

Als Senior Network Engineer moet je een hoop met je meenemen. Daarom staat daar natuurlijk ook een hoop tegenover.
Volop ruimte voor jouw eigen ontwikkeling, door middel van opleidingen, trainingen en het halen van certificaten - zoals bijvoorbeeld CCIE De flexibiliteit van verschillende projecten met de zekerheid van een contract Begeleiding bij elk project - waar je ook bent, je hebt een vast aanspreekpunt bij Brunel Een gunstige pensioenregeling en korting op individuele verzekeringen Een fijn salaris, interessante bonuskansen en allerlei extra's op het gebied van sport en cultuur

Over ons

Brunel is wereldwijd zakelijk dienstverlener, gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy. We verlenen onze diensten binnen de vakgebieden IT, Engineering, Finance, Legal, Marketing & Communicatie en alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Dit doen we samen met 10.000 collega’s vanuit 35 landen. En we doen dit met focus. Want bij Brunel geloven we erin dat als je ergens 100% voor gaat, dat je daar de allerbeste in kan worden.

Brunel IT zet op flexibele of permanente basis hoogwaardige kennis en capaciteit in voor de top van het Nederlandse bedrijfsleven, universiteiten en overheidsinstellingen tot aan het groot MKB. Kortom, organisaties met een grote gebruikersomgeving en interessante projecten.

Wat zeg je ervan? Zet jij de stap naar Brunel? Dan kun jij complexe netwerken beheren bij toonaangevende organisaties. Solliciteer nu.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
As a Team Lead Network Engineer EMEA, you will have the responsibility to manage and enable network engineering staff to establish and maintain a global network and its performance by building modern network configurations and connections, troubleshooting network problems, and being able to multitask in an efficient and effective manner.
syncreon is a dynamic and growing Global 3PL/4PL company. It is a lean employment environment and as a result, the NE team has to be an efficient and flexible working team. The ability to multitask and work under various time restricting pressures is a critical element of the employment. Over the coming years, syncreon will grow and the Engineers who work with us will be part of and critical to this growth.
About The RoleHow you will contributeAs the Team Lead Network Engineer EMEA, you will supervise EMEA NE team members on a day to day basis reporting directly to the Global Network Manager.Work with members of other IT groups, peers, and management to solve systems-related issues for internal and external customers.Attend weekly/monthly calls with vendors and maintain vendor relationships.Attend weekly Problem Ticket management calls and proactively ensure the Network team are updating and closing the tickets quickly and correctly.Attend weekly internal Change Control Management calls and support Network Changes.Supervise and review new bid requests.Supervise and provide oversight on Network Task Control for new sites/launches.Supervise and provide oversight on Network refreshes.Actively participate, enforce, and follow syncreon’s Change, Incident, and Problem management processes.Ensure all Network related configurations and changes meet policy and standards.Supervise system upgrades; install OS, maintenance releases, critical fixes, and service packs; assist with application upgrades, installations and systems monitoring.Define, create, and deliver documentation - hardware/software configurations, change control, downtime/availability, problem/resolution, procedures, resource usage, etc.Responsible for supervising the Network administration, to include the OS, for the following environment: Voice, Video, Switches, Routers, access points, Firewall. (Cisco Knowledge Required)Responsible for understanding and be able to troubleshoot - LAN/WAN interfaces; troubleshoot LAN and TCP/IP issues on servers; DNS and DHCP configuration and troubleshooting.Manage and maintain the BGP MPLS WAN backbone of the company.Supervise the Wireless network configuration and management (Airmagnet Experience is a bonus).Proactively watches emails for alert notifications from the service desk and resolves or escalates these as required.Implement changes for systems for security and compliance as defined by compliance and security team.Any other tasks as assigned by Global Network Manager.
Required Skills & ExperienceBachelor's degree in an engineering discipline, or equivalent experience.3+ years of supervising or managing a regional networks team.Strong technical background and capabilities.Strong time management capabilities and personal administrative management.Strong abilities to manage and influence team members to achieve company goals and objectives.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to multitask and prioritise under pressure.Experience installing, configuring, customizing and supporting enterprise applications such as (switches, Routers, access points, Firewall, Intrusion Prevention Systems).Previous experience following change management and change control processes.Strong troubleshooting and customer service skills.Ability to work in a team environment effectively.Be CCNP certified switching and routing.
Additional InformationRemote working possibly. Preferably you are located near Tilburg/Waalwijk (NLD), near Hinckley (UK), and/or near Dublin (IRL).Travel required to support launches, refreshes, or other projects. Expected travel is approximately one week in every six.
At syncreon we are fully committed to the health and safety of our employees. We have full prevention and mitigation processes in place, including cleaning and sanitization practices, as well as screenings, masks and social distancing. syncreon complies with national, state and local orders.
Compensationsyncreon offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally; stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.
NoteCandidates chosen to move forward within the Recruitment Process, may be required to undergo an assessment and/or submit further background information. Any offers of employment may be conditional on completion of required checks and provision of relevant documentation, in accordance with the applicable local legislation.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
Modis have an excellent opportunity for a Senior Network Engineer, the successful applicant will be seconded to our air traffic control client located near Maastricht.
Please note, only applicants from an EU member state can be considered.
Modis is a specialised IT & Engineering consultancy with more than 30 years’ experience providing consultants to our key partners in The Netherlands.  Currently we are recruiting a Senior Network Engineer for our air traffic control client located in Maastricht. This opportunity is initially for 1 year but planned for 4 years after at this particular client. Following this project your employment with Modis could progress for many years based on our client portfolio.
The role is best suited to applicants with 5+ years Network Engineering Experience.
The Objective of the role:The NET Team is responsible for all LAN & WAN infrastructure and Network IT Security Systems. It faces sustained high levels of workload due to a number of complex projects requiring LAN and/or WAN connectivity, activities aiming at the timely replacement of obsolete hence unsupported IT equipment.You will be required to develop and maintain post-ops analysis and other business dashboards.In addition, the drastic increase of home-users in 2020 has resulted in a number of technical and organisational measures to assure full access to all necessary on-site resources from any remote location without any compromise to security.All Senior NET Engineer(s) will typically perform following key tasks:Identify malfunctioning hardware and/or software for the purpose of implementing necessary corrective actions, resolving technical problems and provide ongoing support to the end-users of the operational MADAP networks and non-operational OFFICE networkPerform primary network system administration on network and IT Network Security equipmentAssist in the design, development, configuration, installation and maintenance of network systemsConduct analyses and testing of network systems for the purpose of documenting findings and ensuring efficiencyCreate utilities for the purpose of automating repetitive and daily routinesImplement new network operating systems and application software for the purpose of ensuring compliance with licensing, patches and updates according vendor and/or IT security guidelinesMonitor LAN/WAN Infrastructure for the purpose of measuring performance and/or ensuring the secure and reliable operation of all MADAP networks and its Network Security Infrastructure.Drafting of TE2 documentation, e.g. Build state documents, Test documentation, Version documentation, Baseline Documentation in accordance with the Maastricht Management SystemPerform other related duties, as assigned, for the purpose of ensuring the efficient and effective functioning of the NET Team



MUST HAVEBachelor degree in engineering (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Telecommunications) or equivalentCisco CCNP AccreditedTECHNICAL/PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONMinimum of 5 years relevant experience in networking and IT security technology: practical experience in network troubleshooting is essential on network equipment together with experience in the field of hardware installation, system integration, testing and servicing activities.Practical Experience with following brands: CISCO, CHECKPOINT, FORTINET, optionally GIGAMONDetailed knowledge of data communication protocols (TCP/IP,DNS, HTTP/S, FTP...), Routing, Switching, proven by minimum 2 practical cases as an example.Knowledge of Quality of Service and experience designing/implementing QoS in an enterprise environment proven by minimum 1 practical cases as an example.Familiar with network management tools and SIEM. (e.g. Zenoss, CA Spectrum & Splunk)Familiar with design concepts in LAN/WAN design.Experience in a project environment, quality/security standards, configuration management & toolsGood knowledge of MS Office tools Word, Excel, Visio.Ability to draft clear and concise technical papers in English.
OTHER REQUIREMENTS (PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS)Autonomous, investigative, mature, social, patientDesire to work in a multi-cultural teamGood team worker, positive and open minded, committed to getting a job doneHands-on approach.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
De functieIn de rol van Senior Network Engineer bouw jij mee aan de continue ontwikkeling van het Eurofiber netwerk. Hierbij beschik jij over uitstekende technische kennis van netwerken en coachingsvaardigheden om de functie succesvol in te vullen. 
Jouw focus ligt op de complexere zaken van het netwerk. Zo zorg jij onder andere voor het continu bewaken en monitoren van de netwerkkwaliteit, troubleshooten waar nodig en altijd het overzicht bewaren. Je realiseeert aanpassingen en uitbreidingen aan het netwerk, werkt in wisselende teams samen met projectmanagers, incidentmanagers, klanten, en leveranciers. Je weet collega’s te coachen en begeleiden wanneer nodig. Daarnaast weet je je keuzes goed te onderbouwen richting management en hebt daartoe goede presentatievaardigheden.  
Al met al, een divers takenpakket waar eigen inbreng erg wordt gewaardeerd en waar je jouw eigen draai aan kunt geven. Uiteraard ben je secuur en kijk je met kritische blik naar het werkveld. Werken binnen een commerciële infra/IT-organisatie is voor jou weggelegd en je weet te schakelen met diverse specialistische professionals, leveranciers en klanten.

Wat wordt er van jou verwacht?
MBO+/HBO niveauOngeveer 5-7 jaar relevante werkervaringErvaring in een telecom, infra of IT-omgevingHet vermogen om wendbaar te zijn in onze veranderende omgevingEen professionele houding die gericht is op samenwerkingEen verbinder
De maatschappelijke en technologische uitdagingen van nu vragen om een Senior Network Engineer met degelijke kennis van protocollen als OSPF en BGP, LDP, RSVP en MPLS en comfortabel is met protocollen als STP/RSTP en PVST (i.v.m. klantdomeinen). Daarnaast heb je de kennis en kunde om designs vanuit Sol. Arch te valideren en/of te challengen danwel verbeteren. Je hebt enige jaren ervaring in de telecombranche met specialisatie op netwerk systemen zoals DNS, DHCP, SNMP en ervaring met scripting op linux systemen.  
Je hebt daarnaast goede kennis van netwerk technologieën als IP, MPLS en Ethernet en met performance en alarm management en monitoring systemen. Ervaring met tools als Cacti/PRTG, Netadmin, Infovista, PowerDNS, Rancid is een pre, evenals kennis over transportnetwerken zoals C/DWDM of SDH. 
De vaardigheid om vragen vanuit de organisatie (Product Management, operationeel) te vertalen in oplossingen in het netwerk systems / reporting / scripting domein zijn jou bekend.  

Wat bieden we jou?
Een dienstverband van 40 uur per weekEen bonusregeling en dertiende maand29 vakantiedagen per jaar (o.b.v. 40 uur)Flexibele werktijdenEen goed bereikbaar kantoor, gelegen naast het station
Wij bieden jou een plek binnen een bedrijf dat aan de basis staat van innovatie in bedrijven en organisaties. Jij maakt deel uit van een ondernemend team van specialisten en zorgt voor het continu ontwikkelen van het Eurofiber netwerk. Samen kijken we naar de snelle ontwikkelingen binnen de markt en de kansen die ze ons bieden. Tegelijkertijd staan we ook stil bij jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Want wij geloven in de kracht van onze medewerkers en de must om in hen te investeren.  

Meer informatieIs deze vacature iets voor jou? Dan ontvangen we graag jouw cv en motivatie. Belangrijk om te weten is dat een assessment onderdeel kan uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure. Heb je inhoudelijke vragen? Neem dan contact op met Sander Berentsen via 06 18 29 93 39.

Location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Job Description:
About Worldline Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payment and transactional services industry. With innovation at the core of its DNA, Worldline’s core offerings include pan-European and domestic Commercial Acquiring for physical or online businesses, secured payment transaction processing for banks and financial institutions, as well as transactional services in e-Ticketing and for local and central public agencies. Thanks to a presence in 30+ countries, Worldline is the payment partner of choice for merchants, banks, public transport operators, government agencies and industrial companies, delivering cutting-edge digital services. Worldline’s activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services, Financial Services including equensWorldline and Mobility & e-Transactional Services. Worldline employs circa 12,000 people worldwide, with 2019 revenue of circa 5.3 billion euros. worldline.com
The Network environment

The Network Department is part of the equensWorldline Business Infrastructure department focusing primarily on the Dutch datacenters but is working in a close international relationship with Germany, Belgium, France and Italy.
Standardization and country overarching activities will make sure the teams will get a closer working relationship in the near future supporting each other whenever necessary.

Key to these activities is the highest level of availability and performance necessary to process the billions of transactions which pass our networks.

What will be your job?
The Network team is responsible for running, designing, configuring and implementing the network infrastructure. Customer focus must be the number one mindset.

The team is working in a complex multi-disciplinary infrastructure of Cisco switches and routers, Checkpoint firewalls and F5 loadbalancers. The team is responsible for the entire network infrastructure.

equensWorldline is looking for a junior network engineer. The junior network engineer will have a great opportunity to acquire deep knowledge of a very divers networking infrastructure and gets a great opportunity to certify this knowledge through trainings and the corresponding exams.

The junior network engineer will be working in an environment with a huge responsibility which requires flexibility and perseverance. Never a boring day, that is the promise.

As a Junior Network Engineer your job will be to:
 Align with the business and projects regarding demands, (service)requests and new services; Assess new requests based on architecture standards , policies and regulation; Align designs with other Teams within the Technical Engineering department. Perform together with senior engineers Root Cause Analysis (RCA) of major incidents; Prepare (plan) network changes for CAB approval and deployment; Deploy network changes; Participate in international projects.

What do you have to offer?

You Have a

You are a Junior Network Engineer who will act in a dynamic, high pressure international environment and you are able to learn fast and acquire in-depth technical networking knowledge.
  Higher vocational education or work & thinking level You are driven to become an expert and therefore ambitious, quick-thinking and analytic You are willing to train yourself to become this expert You can demonstrate an affinity with network engineering You are speaking English on a professional technical level, Dutch, German or French is a plus

You Are Able To
 Work effectively to complete assignments in group settings; Work cooperatively to achieve common goals, act in the interest of the organization without letting personal interests prevail; Take a co-operative approach with a positive attitude with others and share information and knowledge; Work with integrity, meaning working in such a way that the job is executed properly, transparently, carefully and complying with the applicable laws, regulations, policies and Code of Conduct; Hold yourself and others responsible for measurable high-quality, timely, and cost-effective results. Determine objectives, set priorities.  Implement changes out of office hours  Participate in 24x7 standby shifts, one week per 7 weeks

The Dutch network team is a team of closely related engineers who are always willing to take that one step extra to get the job done. Team members are always willing to back each other up. Your job is enabling, maintaining and expanding the European payment infrastructure together with highly qualified colleagues.

Young people with an IT degree are encouraged to apply for this job. You will have a great opportunity to start a successful career in a rapidly expanding company

The 20 000 employees of Worldline are all different but share the same values. You can see it in the way we behave. We are curious and humble – we are learning every day, we keep things simple and everyone engaged. In our fast-moving industry, we are adaptable and life-long learners. Everyone demonstrates the same dedication to quality and efficiency. We have an entrepreneurial spirit and sense of service. Above all, we never turn our back on a challenge. These values nurture a dynamic and innovative team where everyone can develop and grow

BGP, OSPF en MPLS Je bent enthousiast over nieuwe technieken als SDN Je bent bekend met Linux en automatisering (Python is een pré) Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels Je bent georganiseerd, autonoom maar werkt ook graag in groepsverband Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie Je beschikt over een rijbewijs type B
